loans.name: Abla Sylvie

texts.fr: Âgée de 39 ans, Abla Sylvie vit au Bénin et a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Abla Sylvie est mariée à un certain Symplice. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Abla Sylvie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges du ménage.  Abla Sylvie vend du jus de citron et du bissap et de l'eau en sachet  dans sa boutique depuis quatre ans ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer à l'éducation et à l'entretien des enfants.  Abla Sylvie vend aussi des objets d'électricité.  Abla Sylvie s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et au Nigéria. La clientèle de  Abla Sylvie devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu,  Abla Sylvie sollicite une deuxième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des sachets, du citron et des feuille de bissap

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is 52 years old farmer from Gubaan, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is married with three children. She has been in the farming business for 21 years. This is the main source of her income. Edna is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for his rice production. With this loan, She will be able to improve the productivity of her farm and thus she can harvest as many as they can so that they can provide the needs of their children especially the education . In the future,Edna hopes to make her farming business more productive and abundant so that they can provide all the needs of their family.

loans.use: To buy ferlitizer

loans.name: Gloria Honduras

texts.en: My customers know that I will make arrangements to their liking.  They come to my house to order arrangments for weddings, sweet fifteen parties, birthdays, and holidays.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials such as plastic flowers and lovely baskets

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Paco was born in the state of Guerrero, where his children and the rest of his family reside. However, 8 years ago he decided to visit the capital of Querétaro in search of better employment opportunities, as he was facing many financial difficulties in his hometown. That is how he came to start his own toy-selling business in Querétaro, after a friend offered to rent him a space in a central location. Thanks to the business, he has been able to cover his costs and help his family. He therefore wants to continue to grow.

At this time he is in need of a loan of $200 to acquire a larger quantity of merchandise, thereby increasing his sales and, consequently, his income. You have the opportunity to support Paco. Become an important part of his achievements. He and his family sincerely appreciate your help.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Paco nació en el Estado de Guerrero, lugar en la que radican sus hijos y el resto de su familia, sin embargo el hace 8 años decidió visitar la capital queretana en busca de una mejor oportunidad de empleo, ya que estaba enfrentando muchas dificultades económicas en su lugar de origen. Es así como inicia en Querétaro su propio negocio, la venta de juguetes, pues una de sus amistades le ofreció la renta de un local en un lugar céntrico. Gracias a esta actividad el ha podido solventar sus gastos y ayudar a su familia, es por el quiere continuar creciendo.

En este momento el requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 200 DLLS para poder surtir una mayor cantidad de mercancía y de esta manera incrementar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos. Tú tienes la posibilidad de apoyar a Don Paco, vuélvete parte importante de sus logros. El y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Imeleta

texts.en: Imeleta, her husband and their two children live in a small Somoan village.  Prior to Imeleta joining SPBD, both Imeleta and her husband were unemployed and relied on the help of neighbors and nearby relatives for basic necessities such as food and water.  The women in Imeleta’s village encouraged her to join SPBD.  She did, and with her first loan, she was able to start up a small village store.  Since then, Imeleta and her family have seen small but steady gains in their standard of living.  Also, Imeleta happily reports that the self-satisfaction she has gained as a result of her business endeavors has contributed to a marked improvement in her relations with her husband and children.  She remains grateful to the other village women who have continued to counsel her on running a small business.  Imeleta’s goal is to grow her business to bring in enough income for her to equip her home with water and electricity.  To achieve that goal, Imeleta is seeking further financing in order to expand her shop’s stock of goods.

loans.use: Purchase goods for her shop

loans.name: Nereah

texts.en: Nereah A. is a 58-year old widow.  She lives in Migori, Kenya, with her seven children and four grandchildren. She is a leader of Buchwa women's group, a community initiative that provides home-based care services to people living with HIV/AIDS. She also runs a food kiosk at Achuth market in Bware, specializing in selling the local favorites, chapattis (fried flat bread) and mandazzis (fried sweet dough) served with tea.  She supplements her food kiosk business by buying and selling dry maize and also has local dairy cattle breeds which produce milk for sale. Her daily income has increased by 100%, and she has managed to save a bit of her profits.  She requires US $600 to enable her to move her business to a larger space and a more lucrative location.

loans.use: Expand her food kiosk business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve her store and buy more products

loans.name: Fiel Da Rocha Fernan

texts.pt:
Fiel da Rocha Fernando is not married but he lives with his girlfriend with whom he has 2 children. He works for the government as a clerk. H e joined the credit program in 2005, with the loans he has been able to buy home appliances. His girlfriend has her own small business. With this loan he wants to buy construction material to improve his home. He is able to support his family and the loans have been very useful.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Fiel da Rocha Fernando, solteiro, vive maritalmente com uma mulher com quem tem 2 filhos. Ele e funcionario numa instituicao estatal. E escriturario. Ele entrou para o programa de credito em 2005. Com o valor dos emprestimos nessa altura conseguiu comprar electrodomesticos para a sua casa.A sua esposa faz pequenos negocios, mas ele nao faz negocio nenhum. O emprestimo dele e de consumo. Com o emprestimo actual ele quer comprar material de construcao para poder construir uma casa feita de material convencional, pois que actualmente vive numa casa de pau a pique. Os seus dois filhos estao a estudar.Ele consegue sustentar a sua familia sem ggrandes problemas, pois que o emprestimo tem-lhe sido muito util.

loans.use: Buy construction material

loans.name: Alba

texts.es:
Description

Alba M. is 35 years old, and married to Valentin Caceres who is 41 years old. They live in their own house, with the basic necessities. They have 3 children, two sons and one girl, all teenagers who study at the public school.

Alba has been the owner of a small general store for more than 5 years. She sells items for every day use such as rice, oil, drinks, flour, etc. She runs her business from her home, and her children help her. Her husband has worked for the railroads for more than 20 years and has a monthly salary which helps cover the costs of taking care of and educating the children.

The motivation for requesting a loan is to be able to purchase more merchandise to stock the business, such as ciders, wines, beer, soft drinks, etc. because the demand for these items is always high at the end of the year. One of the projects Alba has for next year is to open another business, selling clothing, items for the home, office, gifts, etc. There is currently no such shop in the neighborhood and her customers are requesting it.

Descripción: DESCRIPCION necesidad La señora Alba M. de 35 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Valentín Cáceres de 41 años, viven en casa propia, equipada con las necesidades básicas del hogar. Tienen tres hijos aún menores de edad, dos son varones y una mujer; todos ellos son adolescentes y están estudiando en colegios públicos.

La señora Alba es propietaria de una despensa con más de 5 años de antigüedad, vende artículos de primera necesidad como ser arroz, aceite, bebidas en general, harina, etc., su negocio lo tiene en su propia casa, que es atendida por ella y por sus hijos. Su marido trabaja como empleado ferroviario hace más de 20 años y tiene un salario mensual, con la que ayuda a cubrir los gastos de alimentación y la educación de sus tres hijos.

El motivo por el cual solicitan el crédito es para la compra de mercaderías en oferta como ser: vinos, sidras, cervezas, golosinas, productos enlatados, etc. ya que en épocas de fin de año la demanda de estos artículos es bastante alta.

Uno de los proyectos de Alba para el próximo año es la de abrir otro negocio, esta será en el ramo de mercería y bazar (venta de artículos varios como ropa, artículos para la casa, librería, regalos, etc.). ya que en el barrio no existe ningún comercio dedicado a esos rubros y sus propios clientes le solicitan este tipo de artículos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE STOCK FOR HER STORE SUCH AS CIDERS, WINE, BEER AND SODAS, AS DEMAND FOR THESE ITEMS IS ALWAYS HIGH AT THE END OF THE YEAR.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in more clothing and garments for sale and to maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Lourdes Mercedes

texts.en:
Lourdes Mercedes R. M. has a store where she sells food and drinks in the center of Juanjui, San Martin.  She’s rented the space for her business since 1996.  She has a good location next to a small technical university where students come to grab a quick bite to eat, drink, and relax.  She is established in the city and now has many loyal customers.

Lourdes is 45 years old, single and has one child.  Her daughter is very important to her so she saves carefully so she can send her to University.  Lourdes started her business after working in restaurants for many years earning very little money.  She decided she could start her own business and take charge of her life.  She now feels happier and more confident than ever.

A member of the community bank Micaela Bastidas, Lourdes is seeking a loan of $275 to invest in her business.  She will repay the loan over a period of 4 months.  With the loan she would like to buy beer, sodas, and snack foods.  The loan will help her meet the demands of her clients.

loans.use: To buy beer, sodas and snacks foods

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Mrs. Em K., 53, works as a vendor of grocery products, making an average profit of $2 a day . Her husband, Mr. Sous Ton, 51, raises pigs, earning about $2 a day of profit. They have five children, two of whom work in a factory, typically earning $60 each per month. This couple is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase more pigs for breeding purposes.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to breed.

loans.name: Austine .

texts.en: Austine T. E. is 29 years old, married and has 2 children. He resides in Benin-City, Edo state, Nigeria. Austine sells men's and women's clothing and shoes and has been in this business since 2005. He needs a loan of $875 to buy more clothes and shoes for sale.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Refija

texts.en:
Refija was born in 1954 and she is a widow. Her monthly income is 600.00KM. She sells clothes at her home.

Refija wants to use this loan in the amount of 1200.00KM for buying textiles and to rent a bench in order to sell textiles at the market and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy textiles and rent a bench at the market.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia Z. D. C. is a busy business woman in the town of Mache high in the mountains of the Libertad region. Her family owns some land where they raise different animals such as pigs, cows, and chickens to sell at local markets. They also own two vans that they use as taxis to shuttle people to and from Mache and the capital of the region, Trujillo.

Julia is 51 years old, married, and has 4 children. She loves working with her family and spending time with her children. She loves building relationships and working hard to improve her family’s future.

A member of the community bank Mujeres D. Mache, Julia is requesting a loan of 1500 PEN to repay over 4 months. She will use the loan to buy feed and vaccines for her animals.

loans.use: To buy feed and vaccines for her animals

loans.name: Morm

texts.en: Morm V., 46, is married and lives with seven of her children in the Kampong Cham province. Working a farm together with her husband, Morm V. typically makes US$1.50 each day. Her family is also supported by two of the children who work in the garment factory and one child who is in construction. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Morm V. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$300 to purchase fertilizer for their farm, a purchase that she believes can bring an increase to her daily income.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en: Mrs. Somaly P. is a grocer in Tie Prumpie Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Previously, Mrs. Somaly P. obtained a loan to start her current business. Because her business is doing well, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods in order to expand her business. Her husband, Mr. Ponara Bou, is a construction worker. Mrs. Somaly P. is 39 and is the mother of six children, two of whom help their mother while three others are enrolled in school. The youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is 30 years old and married with 2 children, aged 10 and 14. She became a food seller in 2005. Every day she works from 7 AM to 3 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Mwanahawa now hopes for a loan to buy more food items like rice, maize flour, vegetables and bananas to sell.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell.

loans.name: Muhabat

texts.ru: Абдуллоева Мухабат жительница района Восъе.Возраст 34 года, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Образование средние. Клиентка занимается куплей продажей золотых изделий.Она торгует на местном рынке района. Торговля является основным источником дохода ее большой семьи.Так как заработная плата мужа небольшая. Мухабат скупает у оптовых поставщиков золотые изделия и реализует в розницу. На кредит хочет закупить золотые украшения.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Muhabat A. resides in the Vose region. 34-years-old, she is married, has four children, and a secondary school education. She trades in items made of gold at the local regional market. This business is the main source of income for her large family as her husband’s salary is low. Muhabat buys from wholesale suppliers of jewelry and sells retail. She wants to buy gold adornments with this loan, and plans to repay the loan within twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Usha

texts.en:
Mrs. Usha T. works as a farmer in Balkhu, Kathmandu. She has five children in school and a husband who works as a painter. She mostly grows seasonal vegetables and sells her vegetables in a local market.
Now Mrs. T. is requesting a Rs 20000.00 loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farm, and plans to use extra profits to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buys fertilizers and seeds for her farm

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice A. O. sells used children’s clothing in Rongo, Kenya. She has been doing so for 5 years and says that while business is okay, it could be better. Each month, Alice travels into the city of Nairobi twice in order to purchase the clothing she sells. She is only able to buy as much as her funds at the time allow, which usually limits her purchases. She would like to be able to afford to buy larger amounts of inventory during each trip, as it is cheaper to purchase the used clothing in bulk.

Alice is a widow and is the sole breadwinner for her 3 children. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenyan Schillings in order to buy the used children’s clothing in bulk from Nairobi, thus increasing her inventory and saving her money.

loans.use: To buy used children's clothing

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin A. is 50 years old and married with four children. His wife is a tailor. He sells tailoring materials such as thread, zippers, etc. 

He plans to increase his tailoring materials to meet his customers' demands. He is requesting a loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Yihya

texts.en:
Yihya is a 42-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Yihya has been installing aluminum for 15 years. He works with all kinds of aluminum including for kitchens, windows and doors. Yihya has requested a loan of USD$600 from A. Majmoua in order to purchase household expenses. Yihya has been a microcredit client for seven years now and has always paid on time.

The loans have influenced his life in a good way. Yihya is speciA. in his work because he has competitive prices and his clients are his friends. He decided on doing this business because of his knowledge and his experience in this work. When he first started, he faced a lot of competition. In the future, he hopes to improve his family's income.

loans.use: Yihya needs the loan for household expenses.

loans.name: Sak

texts.en: Mrs. Sak H. is a villager in Chhoer Teal village, Kandal province, Cambodia. She and her husband, Mr. Hing Vet, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate vegetables. Their field is infertile and Mrs. Sak H. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to make her soil more productive. She is 38 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom attend the local school while the last is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes inicio el negocio porqué dejo de trabajar como empleada en una empresa y quería dedicarse a una actividad que le permitiera estar mas al cuidado de sus padres y poder brindarles una mejor atención ya que son personas mayores y están a su  cargo, fue por eso que se decidió a poner su negocio de papelería. Comenzó en Febrero de 2002 en la cochera de su casa pero solo duro 3 años y lo cerro porque entro a trabajar como empleada a una empresa y no lo podía atender. Posteriormente lo reinicio en Febrero de 2002 y desde entonces se ha dedicado por completo al negocio y a cuidar de sus padres. Acaba de abrir otra papelería en otra colonia de la ciudad donde le ayuda a su hermana y una vecina,  en su papelería acaba de comprar tres computadoras para tener un tipo  Caber-café y adquirí también otra copiadora por lo que siente que ha ido progresando poco a poco.

Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $12,000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas para comprar mercancía y le  servirá mucho para capitalizarse y poder comprar papelería ya que con la compra de las computadoras se quedo  con poco dinero para invertir en mercancía.
texts.en:
Lourdes set up her stationary store because she had left her previous job working for a company, and wanted to dedicate herself to an activity that would allow her to care for her parents, who are quite dependent on her in their old age. Although she ran the store off and on for a while, it has been her only business since February 2002. Since then, she has dedicated herself full time to the store and to her parents. In fact, not only has Lourdes opened a second store in another neighbourhood, with her sister and neighbour helping her run it, she has also bought a photocopier and three computers to help turn the first store into a cyber cafe as well as a stationer's. Little by little, her business is growing. Lourdes needs a loan of $12,000 pesos, which she will pay back in 10 installments, so that she can buy stationary to sell. She is short on capital at the moment. Because of the money she spent on the computers, she does not have enough left over for merchandise. .

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Faiese

texts.en:
Faiese L., 24, is married with 1 child. She has 2 years of experience in a handicrafts business. She sells to the general public, tourists and overseas markets 2 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (approximately $166 USD).

SPBD loans are Faiese’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase carving equipment like sand paper, a chainsaw and painting materials.

loans.use: To purchase a chainsaw, sand paper, and painting materials

loans.name: Abdufatto

texts.ru: Абдуфатто в первый раз получил в МикроИнвест займ для продолжения строительства своего дома и тогда он купил строительные материалы. Условия кредитования МикроИнвест ему понравились, и так как он занимается бизнесом, он решил получить займ для его развития. Абдуфатто 51 год, он женат и имеет 5 детей. Бизнес Абдуфатто располагается в самом престижном ресторане города, где он арендует бар. В его баре работает 2 человека (на фото продавец). Абдуфатто надеется что полученный займ способствует развитию его бизнеса и он и дальше будет получать кредиты.
texts.en:
Abdufatto's first loan from Microinvest funded the purchase of building materials for continued construction of his house. He liked Microinvest's loan conditions, and since he has a business he decided to request a loan for its development. Abdufatto is 51 years old, married, and has five children. His business is in the city's top restaurant, where he rents the bar. Two people work at the bar (the vendor is in the picture). Abdufatto hopes that the loan will allow him to further develop the business, and that he will be able to continue to receive loans in the future.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: María Elpidia

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Brigida M. se dedica a su negocio de venta de refrescos los cuales son elaborados por ella misma todos los días y ofrecidos en su establecimiento en dicho mercado.

Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las frutas para elaborar los refrescos y de esta manera comercializarlos en su localidad para continuar manteniendo su humilde hogar. Ella se ha caracterizado por ser una fiel cliente de Ceprodel y por esto espera que su crédito sea otorgado.
texts.en:
In the Mayoreo Market in the city of Managua Brigida Martinez runs her business selling fresh fruit drinks, all of which she makes and sells herself in the market.

She is recurring to Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan to purchase fresh fruit with which to make her fruit drinks and sell them through her stand, in order to continue supporting her humble home. She has been a loyal client of Ceprodel and she hopes that her loan will be granted to her.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For ingredients to make fruit drinks.

loans.name: Oyetola

texts.en:
Oyetola F. is 50 years old and married with 3 children. Oyetola has a cassava farm where she produces garri and fufu. To make garri, cassava tubers are peeled, washed and grated or crushed to produce a mash. The mash is placed in a non-water proof bag and allowed to ferment for one or two days, while weights are placed on the bag to press the water out. It is then sieved (or sifted) and roasted by heating in a bowl. The resulting dry granular garri can be stored for long periods. It may be pounded or ground to make a fine flour. Fufu is a thick paste or porridge usually made by boiling starchy root vegetables in water and pounding with a large stick and bowl until the desired consistency is reached. 

Oyetola is requesting a loan of N80, 000 to purchase more cassava to plant for making garri and fufu to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava to plant for making garri and fufu to sell

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian A. started her fish sales ten years ago at Dorma Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo of Ghana. Vivian prepares and serves her customers very tasty and good quality fish, and because of that many customers buy from her stand. She has a cunning mouth to convince her suppliers to sell her more fish when there is high demand for fish and the supply is low.

She buys stocks of fish from the fishermen and smokes them at a nearby stand. She has a big customer base that travels from the other part of the region to buy her fish. They buy from her both the fresh ones and the smoked ones. She is now 38 years old, married, and mother of six children. Currently all her children are in school. She wants to use the loan to buy increased stocks of assorted fish to make increased sales and income to support her children's educational needs and her business growth. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Provident’.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked fish and dried fish

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: C'est un jeune de kolda qui s'est lancé dans la réparation de motocyclettes et la vente de leurs piéces détachées. Il est célibatare mais responsable dans la gestion quotidienne de la maison où il vit avec sa maman. Avec ses revenus il essaye d'aider sa maman et de préparer un peu son avenir. Cependant le manque de moyens ralentit ses activités qu'il aimerait voir se développer
texts.en:
This is a young person from Kolda who got started in the motorbike repair business along with their spare parts. He is unmarried but in charge of the everyday managing of the house, where he lives with his mother. With his revenues, he tries to help his mother and to prepare a little for his future. However, a lack of means is slowing his business, which he would like to see develop.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair motorbikes and to sell spare parts

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina O., a 36-year-old mother of three children, owns a one-hectare farm. She helps her husband, Drix O., to till the farm to ensure an abundant harvest for her family. The couple dream of good things for their children. They want to send them to school so that when they get older, they will find better employment and be able to provide for their future families.

Mrs O. is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP from Kiva partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI). She will use the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and herbicides. The loan will help her achieve maximum yield from her farm and a better income for her family. As well as enjoying accessible credit from CEVI, Gina is secured by the CEVI micro-insurance program.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Gái's Group

texts.en:
Gái Thị N. was born in 1963. She lives in Luc Canh village, in the Xuan Canh commune, with her husband and two sons. Her husband is a truck driver. The older son is in high school. The younger son is at home. Ms Gai has a small store at home. She has borrowed via microfinance for two years. This time, she needs 5,886,000 VND (or ~$330 US) to buy goods to sell.
No: 010107010001  

 There are four other fund participants in her group:

Thảo Thị Phan was born in 1981. She cooks for a factory and breeds pigs and poultry. She needs 3,270,000 VND (or ~$185 US) to buy food for them.
No: 010107010003 

 Lan Thị Quỳnh N. was born in 1951. She has two children. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (or ~$280 US) for a small business.
No: 010107010002 

 Nga Thị Phạm was born in 1954. She has two children. She has an electrical shop. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (or ~$280 US) to buy electrical goods for her shop.
No: 010107010005 

 Hải Thị Hoàng was born in 1976. She has two children of school age. She wants to borrow 4,578,000 VND (or ~$255 US) to buy vegetables to sell at the market.
No:010107010004

loans.use: To buy goods to sell

loans.name: Kansé

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Kansé C. a 31 ans, marié et père de deux enfants. Il réside avec sa famille à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur C. après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès,  s’initia  au commerce  de vente d’articles  divers. Actuellement Kansé opta pour une spécialisation en habillement et en alimentation. Il  dispose  de deux boutiques, une  de Prêt à Porter et une Alimentation à la gare routière de Sikasso. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y’a environ une  année. Il est à son deuxième prêt individuel après  avoir remboursé  par  anticipation le premier prêt. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, il compte acheter, 8 cartons de biscuits, 4 cartons de mayonnaise Calvé, 8 paquets de boissons NBB, 3 cartons de savons, 4 casiers de boissons BRAMALI, 3 cartons du thé, 5 sacs du sucre, 5 paquets de bonbons, 5 cartons du lait NIDO, 5 casiers de boissons MALTA, etc. Il s’approvisionne auprès de commerçants grossistes à Bamako avant de les revendre en détail à une clientèle composée généralement de voyageurs et surtout de routiers.
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 350 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Kansé C., 31, is married and the father of two children. He lives with his family in Sanoubougou I, one of the working class neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

After having tried out several businesses without success, Mr. C. began selling various items. Presently Kansé has chosen a specialization in clothing and foodstuffs. He has two shops, one selling ready-to-wear and one groceries in the bus and truck stop of Sikasso. He is much in demand with his clientele because of the quality of his merchandise.

Wishing to satisfy his ever growing clientele, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso about one year ago. He is on his second individual loan after having reimbursed the preceding one early. With this new loan he intends to buy 8 cases of cookies, 4 cases of Calvé mayonnaise, 8 packets of NBB drinks, 3 cases of soap, 4 cases of BRAMALI drinks, 3 cases of tea, 5 sacks of sugar, 5 packs of candy, 5 cartons of NIDO powdered milk, 5 crates of MALTA drinks, etc. He buys his goods from the wholesalers in Bamako and then re-sells them retail to a clientele composed generally of travelers and especially transporters.

He expects to make a monthly profit of 350,000 F CFA which will be used essentially to grow his working capital, contribute to supporting his family, and pay the interest on his loan, investing any remainder back into his businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is fifty-four years old. She is divorced and has given birth to six sons. Some are still in school while others are learning trades. She works very hard to be able to provide for the family. Janet lives with her children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader. She runs a provision store in her community. She buys her goods in Kumasi. Janet has been in business for seven years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday A. is currently in the business of selling bread and groundnut and is requesting a loan to purchase more groundnut to sell.  Sunday is 28 years old and is Married with a husband that is a police man. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase more grounndnut to sell

loans.name: Luzel

texts.en:
Luzel M. lives in the village of Scions, Canitoan, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 34 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she sells used clothing (or "ukay-ukay" products) to people who live in her community. She has been in this business for more than two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Luzel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and increase her business opportunities. She has applied for her first loan, for 5,000 PHP, to buy additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell

location.town: Scions, Canitoan, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: So

texts.en: As known the fish is the main vital fresh food to everyone in particular the families who depend on the fishing and fish selling, from Tunle Sap River, where is the best place for fish sheltering. Mrs. So S. one among those people currently depends on selling fish at the local busy market. She sells fish that she either gets from her husband’s fishing or buys from her wholesale supplier. So S. is a humble mother who has been blessed with a lovely young kid. So S. has been inherited a piece of farmland from her grandparents for years. In addition, she hopes to grow various crops on her own land. Due to the lacking money, So S. decided to seek a loan to purchase farming materials such as seeds, fertilizer, pumping machine, and other supply to begin a farming business.

loans.use: To purchase farming materials such as seeds, fertilizer, pumping machine, and other supply to begin a farming business

loans.name: Oscar William

texts.es: El señor Oscar William L., tiene la edad de 33 años, habita en el Km. 16 carretera hacia ticuantepe,  junto a su esposa , la cual trabaja como domestica en una casa privada , para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen dos hijos , actualmente estudian su primaria , los planes hacia su familia es poder brindarle comodidad a sus hijos , ya que la casa no tiene división , don Oscar desde hace dos años , se dedica a la venta de lácteos , agradece a la institución por la confianza y el apoyo que le ha brindado con este segundo crédito , lo cual con las ventas logro pagar el primer desembolso , los planes hacia un futuro es poder comprar un tramo en el mercado Oriental y ser vendedor mayorista. Con este préstamo invertirá en la compra de queso, crema, cuajada, y otros para incrementar las ventas y poder tener mejores ganancias para hacer los proyectos de su casa.
texts.en:
Mr Oscar William L. is 33 years old and lives along the Km. 16 highway towards Ticuantepe with his wife, who works as a domestic helping in a private home to help him with the household expenses. They have two children who are currently studying in primary school. His plans for his family is to be able to give comfort to his children because right now the house has no room division. For the past 2 years, Mr. Oscar has been selling milk, with thanks for the institution for the confidence and support that they have given him with this second loan. With the sales from this loan he will be able to pay for the first expenditure, his plan for the future is to buy a plot of land in the Oriental market and be a wholesaler. He will invest this loan in the purchase of cheese, cream, curds and other products to increase his sales and be able to make greater profit to be able to complete the projects on his house.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cheese milk, curds

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal  Damas responsables está conformado por un grupo de mujeres  capaces y luchadoras que tienen como prioridad sacar adelante a su familia a  pesar de los obstáculos que día a día deben surfear, además han formado un excelente ambiente y equipo de trabajo velando siempre el bienestar de todas sus integrantes, este banco está ubicado en la ciudad de Cuenca al sur del país en la región sierra centro.

La señora Rosario Q. es socia del banco comunal Damas Responsable, vive en el sector  Catamarca en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 69 años de edad está  casada y madre de seis hijos  no recuerda la edad de cada uno de ellos,  todos sus hijos se encuentran casados y viven  independientemente con sus familias solo le acompañan su esposo que es jubilado de la empresa eléctrica y un nieto, su casa es propia fruto del trabajo mutuo de juventud.

Rosario trabaja en la agricultura, también cría animales esta actividad la  realiza hace muchos años y es su sustendo, nuestra socia lleva tres años trabajando con su banco comunal  y se siente satisfecha por los logros conseguidos tanto en la compra de semillas para sus cultivos como con los gastos del hogar, el préstamo que recibirá de la fundación ESPOIR  va a invertir en el arreglo de su casa ya que quiere ponerle tumbados y comprar  semillas de maíz, haba, fréjol,etc. para incrementar sus cultivos

Su sueño es tener salud y vida para seguir trabajando en sus sembríos y con sus animalitos e ir incrementando su negocio para su vejez cuando ya no pueda trabajar.
texts.en:
The Damas Responsible Communal Bank is comprised of a group of capable women. They are fighters whose priority is to get their families ahead in spite of the obstacles they suffer from day to day. Also, they have created an excellent atmosphere and working team that always watches out for the well being of all of its members. This bank is located in the city of Cuenca in the southern part of the country in the Sierro Centro region. Rosario Q. is a member of the Damas Responsible Communal Bank. She lives in the Catamarca sector in the city of Cuenca. She is 69, married, and has six children. She does not remember the ages of each one of them. All of her children are married and living independently with their families. She only lives with her husband, who is retired from the electric company, and a grandson. Their house, which is their own, is the fruit of their mutual work in their youth. Rosario works in agriculture, and she also raises animals. She has been doing this for many years, and it supports her. She has been working with her communal bank for three years. She feels satisfaction for what she has achieved from buying seeds for her crops to paying the household expenses. She will use the loan she will receive from the ESPOIR Foundation to fix her house; she wants to put on a roof. She will also buy corn, lima bean, and kidney bean, etc., seeds to increase her crops. Her dream is to have her health and her life to keep working with her crops and her animals. She wants to keep increasing her business for her old age when she will not be able to work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put a roof on her house and buy corn, lima bean, and kidney bean seeds to increase her crops

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina tiene 53 años, es madre soltera de un hijo y vive en su casa propia.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, ya que no sólo se conforma con sembrar papas y arvejas, sino que también, dos veces por semana, viaja a la ciudad de Lima llevando hortalizas como: lechugas, espinacas y zanahorias para venderlas allá.
Pero lo que más le gusta es dedicarse a sus cultivos y aunque muchas veces, debido al clima helado perdió sus cosechas.
A raíz de eso, aprendió a viajar para vender sus productos, los cuales transporta hasta la carretera con su dócil asno llamado “Panchito”, su fiel compañero por muchos años, y una vez allí lleva su carga en algún carro hacia la ciudad, de esta manera logra cubrir los estudios superiores de su único hijo.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, donde se viene comprometiendo a pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas. Con el dinero que esta vez solicita comprará fungicidas para sus plantas de arveja y también para incrementar su mercadería en verduras.
texts.en:
Valentina is 53 years old and lives in her own home. She is a single mother with one child, a son.

Valentina is a hardworking woman. In addition to planting potatoes and peas, she travels to Lima twice a week carrying with her vegetables to sell such as lettuce, spinach, and carrots. She enjoys devoting herself to farming, although sometimes she has lost her harvest because of freezing weather. Valentina discovered that she could sell vegetables in other places. Her obedient donkey named “Panchito” has been a faithful companion for many years. He pulls the carriage bearing her load of vegetables to sell. Her revenues go toward paying for her only son’s higher education.

This is her second loan with MFP. Valentina is committed to making her payments on time. She will use the money to buy fungicides for her crop of peas and also increase her inventory of vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fungicides & vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson A. is from the village of Purok Pisces, Barangay Suarez, Iligan City. He is 59 years old. Nelson is married. To make a living, Nelson owns & operates a business repacking and selling health & medicinal products in the local community. Nelson has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nelson joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelson has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Nelson is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Nelson from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Sulaimon

texts.en:
M. Sulaimon is 39 years old. He is married and is the father of 6 children. Sulaimon lives in Shahristan, Tajikistan. He grows and sells vegetables, such as potatoes, onions and carrots. Since the income generated by his work is always meager, he would like to use this loan from Kiva to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer to increase the productivity of his farm. This will allow him to earn a better return on his investment. The profits from his business will enable him to pay for household needs. Sulaimon and his family sincerely thank you for you support and encouragement. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: http://www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Lucila Saida

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Saida pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE” D. la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 50 años, es divorciada y tiene cuatro hijos D. los cuales uno depenD. D. ella. Su hijo Victor tiene 18 años y estudia en la universidad la carrera profesional D. ingeniería civil. Ellos viven en el departamento del Cusco,  provincia del Cusco. 
 
Saida es profesora en la localidad D. Chincheros. Saida hace 22 años que enseñanza en la escuela D. chicheros, ella también se dedica a la confección D. chompas utiliza lana D. alpaca y hace a pedido del cliente. Ya son 30 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Saida requiere el préstamo para comprar más lana D. alpaca para confeccionar chompas con figuras representativas  D. la región.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Saida, 50, is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “COMUZONE” communal bank. She is divorced and has four children, one of whom is still dependent on her. Her son, Victor, is in the university studying to become a civil engineer. They live in Cusco department, Cusco province. Saida has been a teacher in Chincheros for 22 years. She also makes alpaca sweaters to order. She has been in this line of work for 30 years and has done well thanks to the effort she puts into it. Saida needs funding to buy more alpaca wool to continue making her sweaters that have figures woven into them that represent the region. She is grateful for the help granted through this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy alpaca wool.

loans.name: Ana Marcela

texts.es:
La Sra. Ana es una persona responsable, dimanica y muy trabajadora su familia que esta compuesta por ella y sus 5 hijos quienes estan etapa escolar, Ella actualmente se  encuentra separada de su esposo situacion de la que se esta sobreponiendo poco a poco ya que es una situacion dificil para ella.

La Sra Ana atiende un pequeño almacen o tienda de barrio en la zona de Sopocachi donde vende todo tipo de productos e insumos para el hogar, es una tienda bien surtida y esta actividad se convierte en la prinipal fuente de ingreso para la manutencion de su  hogar ella tiene que trabajar duro para poder mantener a sus 5 hijos

El destino del credito es para aumentar su capital de trabajo, compra de productos par surtir su almacen por la temporada de navidad ya que ella tendra bastande demanda en esas fechas.

La Sra. Ana esta agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Ana is a responsible, dynamic, very hard-working person. Her family is made up of herself and her five, school-age, children. She is currently separated from her husband; a situation that has been very difficult for her but that she is overcoming gradually. Ana has a small, neighborhood grocery store in the Sopocachi neighborhood where she sells all kinds of household items. Her store is well-stocked and the store produces her main source of income to support her household; she has to work very hard to support her 5 children. She will use this loan to buy items to stock her store, especially during the Christmas season, because she will have high demand during this time. Ana is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for trusting her enough to grant the loan. .

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory items.

loans.name: Nelma

texts.en: Nelma T. is a married woman who supports her family by operating a general store and a fish vending business. She lives in Brgy 4, Menez St., Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental, with her husband, Romeo, and their three children, all of whom are school age. Nelma has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. By working hard in her general store and fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Nelma is now borrowing 19,500 PHP so that she can buy additional inventory for her businesses. This will be her 10th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 19,000 PHP (which she paid off well within its term) was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. Nelma hopes to improve her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Armando Jose

texts.es: Don Armando vive en el barrio Sol de Libertad,  de edad de 37 años trabaja como técnico de pista desde hace  tres años, pues anteriormente había trabajo en lo mismo pero por lo horarios renuncio ya que se hacia turno día por medio y era agotador, lo cual con su liquidación la invirtió en ropa y cosméticos y comienza a vender ambulante por lo que depende solo de sus ventas. Su esposa procreo tres hijos  los cuales son estudiantes de primaria, lo que mas desea es poder darles una buena educación. Pasado los años regresa a buscar trabajo por lo que los horarios habían cambiado y comienza a laborar otra vez, ya que las venta abecés eran bajas y le quedaba poco ganancias es por eso regresa a buscar un trabajo fijo, lo cual no se le hizo dificultoso por el buen record de su labor Con el préstamo lo que quiere terminar  de cerrar bien su casa,  pues a un falta repellar paredes, embaldosar, poner las verjas y las puertas para una mejor seguridad ya que tiene tapado con zinc las ventana y de gran necesidad lo cual no ha terminado por falta de capital, muy contento por el financiamiento ya que lograra  hacer estas mejoras en beneficios de su familia.
texts.en:
Don Armando lives in the Sol de Libertad neighborhood. He is 37 years old and has worked for three years as a repairman. He used to do the same job before but the hours were brutal and, worn out, he resigned. With a payment that he then received, he bought supplies of clothes and cosmetics and began working as a street vendor, his sales being his sole source of income. His wife has had three children, all now in elementary school, and what Armando most wants is to give them a good education. He decided to go back to work as a repairman after some years because his sales were often too little to justify his hard work and the terrible hours he had to work before have improved. He will use this loan to improve his house. The walls and floors are unfinished, so he will finish those and add bars to the window and doors to make the house more secure. He has needed to make the improvements, especially those to the doors and windows, for some time but he hasn't had the cash to do it. He is very happy about this loan because it will allow him to make improvements that will help his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for house repairs.

loans.name: Florencia Arminda

texts.es: LA SEÑORA FLORENCIA SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION D. MANDILES D. COCINA Y ROPA D. BEBE Y A LA VENTA D. LOS PRODUCTOS QUE REALIZA LLEVA CON EL NEGOCIO  MAS D. 30 AÑOS  DESD. QUE QUEDO HUERFANA D. MADRE, LA SRA. SUFRIO BASTANTE  A UN PRINCIPIO YA QUE NO SABIA  COSTURAR Y NO SABIA HACER NADA GRACIAS A DIOS UNA SEÑORA LA AYUDO BASTANTE LE ENSEÑO A COSTURAR Y TEJER DESD. ESE ENTONCES ELLA LLEVA CON ESTE NEGOCIO. AHORA LA SRA. ES  MUY FELIZ PORQUE TIENE MUCHOS PEDIDOS YA QUE SU MERCADERIA ES D. BUENA CALIDAD, ESTA CASADA Y NO TIENE HIJOS POR EL MOMENTO, TIENE MUCHOS DESEOS D. SALIR ADELANTE ES MUY TRABAJADORA Y RESPONSABLE SIEMPRE VIENDO QUE PRODUCTOS MAS REALIZAR PARA DESPUES VENDERLOS, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Florencia makes aprons and infants clothing to sell. She has been in this line of work for over 30 years, ever since she lost her mother. At the beginning, she suffered much because she didn’t know how to sew; in fact, she didn’t know how to do much of anything. Thanks to God, a woman helped her out teaching her to sew and knit. Since then, she has supported herself through this work. Now, she is very happy because she has many orders to fill because her merchandise is high quality. She is married but has no children at present. She very much wants to get ahead in life; she is very hard-working and responsible, always looking to make more items to sell. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and wool.

loans.name: Yesenia Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Yesenia T. tiene su propio establecimiento de venta de especies en el Mercado Mayoreo donde vende todo tipo de especies tales como canela, duilces, tamarindo, pimienta, mostaza, salsas, entre otros.

El crédito que ella está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de las especies para ser comercializadas y de esta manera obtener los ingresos pertinentes para el sustento de su negocio y de su hogar que ella posee.
texts.en:
Yesenia T. sells spices like, cinnamon, tamarind, pepper, mustard, sauces, etc. in the Mayoreo market. She is asking for funding to buy spices to sell so that she can continue to earn income to maintain her business and her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spices.

loans.name: Kyegwisa Bakyara Twimukye, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
A determined K. Ovia has, over the last six years, been successfully plying her spare-parts business in Ibanda town. With a monthly net profit of 80,000 shillings, this married lady has enjoyed the good graces that have come with running this lucrative business. Consequently she has made enormous progress in educating her six children.

Ovia’s first priority after acquiring this loan is to purchase more hardware stock with the sole objective of turning her business into a wholesale operation.

Ovia belongs to a group of members who hold each other accountable and insure one another in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To restock and expand her business

loans.name: Aïchatou

texts.fr: Née en 1980 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, A. Aïchatou est mariée à MIWAKOUNOU Frédéric, un commerçant. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Aïchatou vit avec ses enfants et son mari à Agblangandan, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis sept ans environs. Aïchatou vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges de la famille. Aïchatou a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Aïchatou vend divers produits (savons, pâtes alimentaires, bombons, biscuits, galettes d'arachide, sachets, etc.) à son domicile. Aïchatou achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Aïchatou exerce cette activité depuis quatre ans et est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Aïchatou sollicite un nouveau crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui lui permettra de renforcer son activité et d'augmenter sa part de marché.
texts.en:
Born in 1980 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Ms. A. Aïchatou is married to Mr. MIWAKOUNOU Frédéric, a merchant.  The couple has three children, some of whom are in school.  Aïchatou has been living with her children and husband in Agblangandan, in the town of Sèmè-Podji, for about seven years.  She helps out her husband and, along with him, ensures that the various family expenses are covered.  Aïchatou dropped out of middle school. To meet her needs, she sells various goods (soaps, pasta, candy, cookies, peanut cakes, little bags, etc.) out of her home.  She purchases her goods at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She has been in this business for four years and is a former ALIDé client who indeed repays her loans.  Aïchatou is requesting a new loan from ALIDé that will enable her to bolster her business and to increase her market share. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying various goods (soaps, pasta, cookies, matches, etc.)

loans.name: Yaya's Group

texts.en:
Meet with the teachers of The SLC (Sierra Leone Church) Primary School, Makeni. The school was built by the Anglican Mission in 1914 and is the oldest school in Makeni City.

This is the second loan that teachers of SLC school will be accessing from SMT/Kiva. With the help of their previous loan, some of these borrowers were able to invest their loans into businesses, others bought pieces of furniture, some paid school fees, etc. Having repaid their previous loan successfully, they are now seeking a second loan.

Yaya M. (who is pictured on the left in the first row) is the headmaster at the school. He has been a teacher for twenty-nine years now. He is age forty-two. He was born in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone and is married with five children: one is already grown-up, two are in primary schools, one is in secondary school and the other one is in college. 

Mr. M. will invest this loan in his business. He sells local produce like palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice, beans, groundnuts (peanuts), etc., and has been selling local produce for thirteen years now. He will use this loan to buy palm-oil, rice, beans, groundnuts, etc., wholesale to add to his business.

Mr. M. depends on the income from his small business to supplement his monthly salary.

loans.use: To buy palm-oil, rice, beans, groundnuts, etc., wholesale to add to his business

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. lives with her husband, a farmer. She has been through junior high school.

Ama prepares rice porridge at Abura for sale. She requires the loan to buy sacks of rice to use for her porridge. She normally buys in small quantities, which is expensive some times. Also, she wants to build a better table whereby flies will be prevented from coming close to her food.

Ama intends to use the new profits which she expects from her expanded business to invest in other types of business.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice to use for her porriadge

loans.name: 02.03.04-Hoang Dong-Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Lan N. T. (24) is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Hoang Dong- Hoang Hoa.  Lan is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 02.03.04 (02.03.04).


Lan is married and has 2 very young children.  To make a living, Lan operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  The main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale.  Lan has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 700,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2006, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Lan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  This will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Lan plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Thang (26) is a 27-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Du (64) is a 35-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  Oanh (62) is a 47-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  Quan (63) is a 53-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Lan N. T. (24) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Dong- Hoang hoa.  Lan là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.03.04 (02.03.04).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Lan thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Lan kiếm được khoảng 700,000 VND.  Vào 2006, Lan đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Lan đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Thang (26) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Du (64) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Oanh (62) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Quan (63) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Мирзоева Саломат проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 25 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж в России на заработках. Сама Саломат не имеет высшего образования. После отъезда мужа ей пришлось работать и прокормить семью. Сейчас она арендует помещение, где открыла дилерский центр. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 4 года. Кредит просит на приобретения сим карт и карт для пополнения счетов. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить больше прибыли.
texts.en:
Salomat M. lives in Hamadoni. She is 25 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is working in Russia. Salomat does not have a higher education. After her husband left, she had to work to support her family. Now she rents a space where she has opened a cell phone kiosk. She has been doing this work for four years. She is taking out a loan to buy more SIM cards and cards that add minutes to phones. She wants to expand her business and earn greater profits.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying new SIM cards

loans.name: Djekafo  Iii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djekafo III est  constitué par six femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 38 ans, 3 enfants et vivant  dans des familles polygames à Dramanebougou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées par les membres du groupe sont entre autres le petit mil, l’arachide, le sésame, le pois de terre et le haricot. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SELIMATA D. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare de sésame et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée de revendeurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 50.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The Djekafo III group is made up of six married women with an average age of 38, 3 children, and they live in polygamous families in Dramanebougou, one of the villages in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region, the second administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their rainy season activities. They grow, among other crops, pearl millet, peanuts, sesame, peas, and beans. They are on their third seasonal loan and all of their previous loans have been repaid in full. With this new loan, Selimata D. plans on buying fertilizer, small farming equipment, and paying for the labor costs involved in maintaining approximately 1 hectare of sesame and peanuts. The harvested crops are sold in Dioïla to a client base made up of merchants. She hopes to make a profit of approximately 50,000 francs CFA by the end of the season.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and small farming equipment

loans.name: Vilma Sobeida

texts.es:
Vilma Sobeida, tiene 56 años.  Es casada y vive con  la esposa y el hijo.  Tiene 1 hijo, Danilo.

Vilma es un socia de la ventanilla rural “San Jose de los Amarillos”. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Vilma se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener un terreno propio para construir una casa. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas y enfermedades como la langosta en el cogollo.

Le gusta dedicar tiempo a Dios.
texts.en:
Vilma Sobeida is 56 years old. She is married and she lives with her husband and their son named Danilo. Vilma is a member of the rural village of San Jose de los Amarillos. There are 23 members in her group and the majority of them are agriculturists. This is the second loan they request through the San Jose Cooperative (Kiva Field Partner). Vilma is an agriculturist, having corn plantations. She carries out her purchases and sales in the city of Ventanas. She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of corn seeds. She sees this loan as an opportunity to get ahead. Her dreams are to have a plot of land where to build her own home. The challenges she faces are langosta infestations and blights in her fields. She enjoys dedicating her time to God.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn seed.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza D. is from Gala, Ozamiz City. She is 40 years old and is married with four school-aged children. Liza owns and operates a business planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Liza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. Liza is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her fifth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Jenny Marisol

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

La señora Jenny  esta casada y tiene dos hijos, su esposo se dedica a labores del campo sus hijos aun se encuentran en el colegio. Lleva varios años en el Banco Comunal dice que está casi desde sus inicios y que siempre le ha gustado por sus pagos que son muy cómodos y los intereses bajos en relación a otros lugares de crédito.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y dice que le ha ido muy bien ya que son varios años que se encuentra en este negocio, los productos que mas vende son interiores, y pantalones  de damas, pero que también vende bastantes ropas de niños. Trabaja todas las tardes de lunes a sábados, día que se encarga de ir a cobrar ya que deja a crédito. Su mercadería la compra en Quito y Guayaquil porque allá hay mas variedad.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar mas mercadería en especial ropa interior y pantalones ya que tiene varios encargos.
 
Sus sueños son llegar a tener una gran boutique
texts.en:
The Quiroga communal bank meets every 15 days in the Quiroga parish, located in the city of Calceta, a place where the many people work in farming, raising animals, and selling their products.

Jenny is married and has two children. Her husband works in the fields and her children are still in school. She has been with the communal bank for several years, almost since it began, and says that she has always liked the loans because they are very convenient and have low interest rates in comparison with other loan institutions.

She works selling all types of clothing from door to door. She says that it has always gone well for her and that she has been in the business for several years. The products that she sells most are underwear and women’s pants, but she also sells a lot of children’s clothing. She works in the afternoons Monday through Saturday, when she goes to collect what she left on credit. She buys her merchandise in Quito and in Guayaquil because there is much more variety there.

She will use this loan to purchase more merchandise, specifically underwear and pants since she has several orders.

Her dream is to eventually have a large boutique.

loans.use: To purchase women's pants and underwear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock more beans to sell

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 57 years old. He is married with 14 children who are between the ages of 17 and 34. Three of his children are currently attending school. Paul is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. He has been farming for 30 years and employs four farmhands. His mixed farm produces maize, sugarcane and nappier grass, which he sells to the local market. He also operates a butchery in the same location. His biggest challenges are lack of sufficient funds to expand his business and drought, which affects his sugarcane production.
Paul has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This dairy cow will enable him to provide enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra income from the sale of milk will help him pay school fees for his children. In the future, he would like to expand his dairy farming by adding more quality dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Seema's Group

texts.en:
Seema lives in an industrial city of Pakistan called Faisalabad. She lives there in a 2-room brick house in the area called Anwer colony. She is 44 years old, married to P. M. and has five sons. She couldn’t educate her children due to financial constraints. All of her sons except the youngest one work to financially contribute to the family. 

Her eldest son is a sweeper. Her second and third sons work in a factory, and the fourth one is a watchman. Her youngest son is 9 years old, and he stays at home.  Her husband runs a small restaurant in the market where he offers different kinds of food and tea to his customers. He has  been doing this business for the past 28 years, and his restaurant is well known among local people for its tastiness and the quality of his food.  Seema herself is a housewife, who stays at home and does her household chores. 
  
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s restaurant business. He will invest the loan in purchasing of different items such as cooking oil, spices, tea, sugar and milk in bulk quantities to maintain the quality of his restaurant and  making a good quantity of food to sell.  She hopes that this investment will be profitable for her husband’s business and her family's standard of living will be better.  

Seema is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application. 
  
Note: In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Seema.

loans.use: To buy required items for restaurant business

loans.name: Mairamkul Kazakbaeva's Group

texts.en:
Mairamkul K. is the leader of this group. She is 43 and married. In order to earn money her husband works in construction. Together they are raising a daughter and a son. Their daughter works as a nurse, and their son is at school.

Mairmakul is a nurse, too, but she is also engaged in cattle breeding. She started doing so five years ago with an initial investment of 15000 KGS. Reselling cattle after fattening them brings Mairamkul 5000 KGS a month. She applied for this loan because she needs the money to purchase two bulls for breeding.

In the near future Mairamkul plans to start building a new cattle shed.

About Mol Bulak :

This loan is being presented by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious, socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.
