Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en: Celerina A. is from the town of Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old, married, and has six adult children. Celerina owns and operates a coconut business, planting and harvesting coconuts for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Celerina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Celerina is requesting a new loan of 2,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase her crop yield. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase her crop yield

loans.name: Rodelie

texts.en:
Rodelie M. is from the village of Paglaum, Dumalinao, ZDS. She is 20 years old. Rodelie is married and has one infant. To make a living, Rodelie is starting a business venture in the retail sector operating a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general clothing services to local community members. Rodelie is just starting this business.

In 2008, Rodelie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodelie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. Rodelie is requesting a new loan, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rodelie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Samuel Mugambi

texts.en:
Samuel W. has been selling DVDs and tapes for the last five years in Naivasha town. He is 30 years old, married to Ruth Wambaire, and they have two children. Samuel was introduced to KADET by his friend, and this is his first loan with the organization. He plans to buy more tapes and DVDs to sell from the proceeds of this loan. This will increase his stock and enable his customers to have a wide variety to choose from. In the future, he hopes to move into a more permanent place where he can sell his wares both retail and wholesale.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more DVDs and tapes to sell

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La señora Rosa M. de 41años de edad, casada, reside junto con su familia en el barrio Sabana Grande en la capital de Managua, su esposo trabaja en una empresa privada, tiene dos hijos de 12 y 18 años de edad que cursan la secundaria, su negocio es la venta de ropa usada que inicio hace dieciséis años para sobresalir adelante con los gastos de la familia,  comenzó con ahorros y prestamos el cual le ha sido de mucho beneficios por lograr mantener las ventas, este es su octavo ciclo en Afodenic el cual con este comprara pacas de ropa y uniformes de estudiantes ya que se acerca las fiestas patrias de Nicaragua y los padres comprar uniformes bastante. Espera poder tener su propia tienda. Da las gracias a la institución por los logros alcanzados el cual se ha beneficiado en mantener su clientela y ganancias la cual ha sastifacido sus necesidades personales.
texts.en:
Rosa M. is 41 years old, married, living with her family in the Sabana Grande neighborhood of Managua. Her husband works for a private enterprise and they have two children: a 12- and an 18-year-old, who are in secondary school. She sells used clothing, a business she has been involved with for the past 16 years and which earns her funds with which to help pay household expenses. She began with her own savings as well as loans that have allowed her to maintain her sales. This is her 8th cycle with Afodenic and she intends to use these funds to buy wholesale bales of used clothing as well as school uniforms since Nicaragua's national holiday is fast approaching and this is when parents traditionally purchase school uniforms. She hopes to have her own store and thanks the institution for the growth attained to date which has allowed her to keep her client base and earn profits that have helped her meet her personal needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase school uniforms and bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Help Yourself #2 Group

texts.en:
Help Yourself #2 is a group of five borrowers who live in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia. The group leader is B. K., a single 31-year-old mother of three children, aged 5-12, all of whom are in school. B. also cares for three children orphaned in the war. She was unable to attend school because, although she enjoyed it, the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide, and therefore school was considered unnecessary. B. lives in remote Kolahu city in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia. 

B. has a retail clothing business, selling slippers, blouses, pants, skirts, headware, etc. She buys clothing wholesale from nearby Guinea and sells at a temporary market stall alongside approximately 100 other vendors of various trades. She has run her business for 10 years and is successful because her customers like her personality and work ethic. B. is requesting a loan to increase her inventory of clothing, which sells well in the rainy season. Her dream is to grow her business so that one day she can have the biggest table in the market. With the profits from her business, B. dreams of building her own house and continuing to educate her children.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of clothing

loans.name: Amilyn

texts.en:
Amilyn A. used to work as a domestic helper in the United Arab Emirates with her dream to provide for the needs of her family, especially for her child.  After finishing her contract, she decided to return to her family for good and start her own business.  Her husband is employed at the  Evergreen Cereal Company as a delivery man. He is working away from them and he only come home every two months.

Amilyn is now engaged in selling processed foods like longganisa, pork tocino, chicken tocino and other frozen foods.  She is also planning to put up a small canteen near the school campus to be able to improve her business and for them to have a stable source of living.  

Amilyn would like a loan amounting to PHP5, 000  to pursue her business plan.  She wants to start managing her school canteen as soon as she has enough working capital.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap N., 30 and her husband, Mr. Chorn Chea, 33, live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married since 2000 and have two sons. All of them are still young. 

Sopheap has been a silk weaver since she was young, a skill she learned from her mother. She also taught her husband to become a silk weaver. They sell their finished products to a middleman, who then in turns them to sell in Phnom Penh market. 

Sopheap doesn’t have enough capital to purchase weaving materials (raw silk and cotton thread), that’s why she is requesting her first loan of $250 to in order to make the purchases.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Ralph

texts.en: Ralph D. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 26 years old and is single. Ralph owns and operates a business providing transport services to local community members using his "habal-habal" (a motorcycle with an extended seat that carries 2-6 passengers). He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ralph joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Ralph is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Lory

texts.en: Lory N. is from the town of Aloran. She is 57 years old, is married, and has six adult children. Lory owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Lory joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use this amount as startup capital for her new business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as startup capital for her new business

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: "Doña Martha, tiene 37 años de edad, esta casada con don Bernardo, la pareja tiene tres hijos, viven en casa de la mama de la Sra. Martha, donde ellos ya cuentan con sus propios cuartos. El esposo es cerrajero trabaja con fierro forjado, es muy requerido por su obra fina. La esposa tiene su negocio  en su domicilio, pero  tambien vende ambulando (sin puesto fijo). El crédito solicitado es para comprar más mercaderia, ropa interior y juguetes en la ciudad de Oruro, donde existe una feria grande  por  Navidad y fin de año antes que los precios suban."
texts.en:
Doña Martha is 37 years old. She lives at her mother’s house with her husband, Don Bernardo, and their three children. They have their own separate living quarters. Her husband is a blacksmith who works with forged iron to make his finished products. He operates his business out of their home while she works as a traveling street vendor (without a permanent location).

Martha is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise, such as undergarments and toys, before prices go up. She plans to acquire these products in the city of Oruro where a large fair is held for the Christmas and New Year’s seasons.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase undergarments & toys for the holiday season

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza R., 41, was born on February 14, 1968.  She is married to Antonio R. and both are blessed with two children. Born in the province of Masbate, a province just South of Manilas, he now lives in Dasmarinas, Cavite together with her family.

Riza has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than two years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow  seven times in the CCT’s Cooperative.  The reason why she was consistent in paying her loans was because she used all most all the money she loaned to buy and sell various personal products and office supplies to her clients.

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 18,000 loan. This amount will be mostly used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying additional stock and as payment for the monthly amortization of their motorized tricycle.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that when the time comes, they will have the resources to send their children to college. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: additional capital for buying and reselling personal products and office supplies

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence Y. is married and has two children. She has received senior high education.  Florence is an agent for the leading producer of ice cream in the country, Fan Milk. She sells a variety of ice cream products like Fan Milk and Fan Yogurt at Damanboh near Elmina in Cape Coast, which she has been doing since 2008. Her husband is a trader. Florence uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Florence will use the loan to buy more ice cream (Fan Milk and Fan Yogurt) for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Florence plans to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more ice cream (Fan Milk and Fan Yogurt) for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase special mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Calceteras” desde hace 2 años, vive en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y tiene 04 hijos. Ella estudió hasta quinto de primaria, se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores.

Juana nos cuenta que el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella requiere un crédito  de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar una vaca.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener ganado mejorado, también dedicarse a la elaboración de bloquetas (material de construcción). 

Lo que más le gusta de Manuela Ramos es la facilidad en que brinda los préstamos
texts.en:
Sra. Juana has been a member of the Communal Bank “Las Calceteras” for two years. She lives in the District of Juliaca, San Román Province, Department of Puno. Juana is 47 years old, married, and has four children. She has a fifth grade education and is dedicated to buying and selling small animals.

Juana says the first loan she requested from Manuela Ramos was in the amount of 300 soles, which was used to increase her operating capital. She is now seeking a loan of 1000 soles in order to buy a cow.

Her dream for the future is to improve her livestock and also start a business manufacturing building blocks. Juana enjoys the loan services provided by Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cow

loans.name: Liberto

texts.en: Liberto P. is from the village of Colupan Alto, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. He is 58 years old, married, and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Liberto owns & operates a business manufacturing & selling hollow block products to local businesses and community members. Liberto has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Liberto joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liberto has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Liberto is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Liberto from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Edit Soledad

texts.es:
Edit Soledad es una mujer proactiva, a sus 27 años es una mujer luchadora, es conviviente tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 11 años, trabaja con EDAPROSPO prosperidad desde hace 5 años, se dedica a la venta de cereales, carne de cerdo y carnero que trae desde Huánuco personalmente o también le envía mediante encomiendas sus familiares de dicha zona, realiza esta operación desde hace 6 años y además hace servicios de lavado de prendas de vestir, con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria ha logrado comprarse un terreno para construir su propia vivienda ya que vivía en casa de familiares.
El gran sueño de Edit, es mejorar el acabado de su vivienda y tener un negocio grande.
El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido en la compra de prendas de vestir para comercializar en campaña escolar. Edit se encuentra muy agradecida por todo el apoyo brindado, porque le ha ayudado  a mejorar su calidad de vida y el de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Edit Soledad, 27, is a proactive, tenacious woman. She lives with her life partner and their two children, who are 9 and 11 years old. She has collaborated with EDAPROSPO PROSPERIDAD for 5 years. She sells cereals, pork and mutton that she personally brings from Huánuco or that she has her relatives in that area ship her. She has been in this line of work for 6 years and she also takes in washing. With the fruits of her daily efforts she has managed to buy a lot to build her house because she had been living with her relatives. Edit's great dream is to improve the finishings of her house and to have a big store. The latest loan will be used to buy school clothes to sell. Edit is very grateful for all the help she's gotten because it has helped her improve the quality of life of herself and her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy articles of school clothing.

loans.name: Trinidad Susana

texts.es:
La  microempresaria: Trinidad C. B. tiene 35 años de edad, es casada con 3 hijos todos menores de edad y actualmente se encuentran estudiando. La microempresaria C. se dedica desde hace 7 años a administrar una pulpería con el fin de aportar a los ingresos de su hogar y en dicho negocio tiene variedad de productos por lo cual cuenta con una muy buena clientela.

La microempresaria C. ya ha sido beneficiada con un préstamo por parte de Kiva el cual cancelo en tiempo y forma, aprovechando este espacio para agradecer a Kiva por la oportunidad de haberla beneficiado con este programa y principalmente a esos  prestamistas que confiaron en ella dándole dicho préstamo.

Sin embargo aun necesita de otro préstamo para ir creciendo poco a poco ya que las ganancias de una pulpería no son las mejores y requiere diversificar más aun sus productos.

Por tal razón esta solicitando para comprar: 2 quintales de Maíz a US 26 cada quintal, 1 quintal de  Frijoles a US 44, 6 cajillas de  huevos a US 5 cada cajilla, 2 quintales de  azúcar a US 35 cada quintal, 2 quintales de arroz a US  45 cada quintal, 80 libras de  carne de res a US  2 cada libra, 2 docenas de café presto a US  25 cada docena, 3 cajas de pasta dental a US 6 cada caja, 100 libras de pollo a US 1.50 cada libra y 12 unidades de leche la lechera a US 3 cada unidad.
texts.en:
This micro-entrepreneur, Trinidad C. B., is 35 years old and married with three young children who are all currently studying. Ms. C. has been running a general store for the past 7 years with the goal of support her family's income. In this business, she offers a wide variety of products, so she has a good, faithful clientèle. Ms. C. has already been granted a loan through Kiva, which she repaid on time and fully, and she would like to advantage of this new space to thank Kiva for the opportunity to have benefited her through this program and she would principally like to thank the lenders that had the faith in her to give her that loan. Despite the success of her last loan, she needs another loan to continue, bit by bit, to grow her income. The profits of a general store are not the best, and she needs to further diversify her products. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy: 200g of corn at $52 US, 100g of beans at $44 US, 6 cartons of eggs at $5 each, 200g of sugar at $70 US, 200g of rice at $90 US, 80 pounds of beef at $2 US per pound, 2 12-packs of pressed coffee at $25 US per pack, 3 boxes of toothpaste at $6 US per box, 100 pounds of chicken at $1.50 US per pound, and 12 cartons of milk at $3 US per carton.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, beans, eggs, sugar, rice, beef, chicken, coffee, toothpaste, and milk

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 57 años, está casada y vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, su casa está ubicada en un populoso barrio llamado “Villa El Salvador” al cono sur de la ciudad de Lima.

Antes de migrar a la capital del país se dedicaba a criar vacunos en una comunidad de la selva, donde hasta ahora esporádicamente viaja su esposo. Actualmente, María se dedica a la venta de comida rápida (papa rellena) en la puerta de su casa, actividad que realiza desde hace 8 años. 
Desde las 5 de la tarde se le encuentra laboriosamente friendo y atendiendo con amabilidad a sus comensales, cada porción la vende entre 1.50 y 2.50 soles, por lo que le está yendo muy bien. Ella se siente muy satisfecha y comprometida con su labor, debido a los buenos resultados que está obteniendo. Sus planes a futuro son de instalar una fuente de soda en su casa, con la finalidad de diversificar los platillos de comida y aumentar sus ganancias.

Este es su quinceavo préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en las fechas establecidas.  Con el dinero que esta vez solicita comprará los ingredientes para la elaboración de sus platillos y por ende atender la demanda de sus comensales.
texts.en:
María, 57, is married and lives with her husband and three children in a densely populated neighborhood, called ‘Villa El Salvador,’ located in the southern part of Lima. Prior to migrating to the nation’s capital, she raised cattle in a jungle community where her husband still sporadically goes. She now prepares fast food (stuffed potatoes) at her doorstep; she has been in this line of work for 8 years. You can find her laboriously frying and kindly tending to her customers from 5pm on. She sells her dishes for between 1.50 and 2.50 soles each so she does quite well. She feels satisfied with and committed to her work thanks to the good results she has attained. Her future plans are to install a soda fountain in her home in order to diversify her menu and increase her profits. This is her 15th loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She will use the requested funds to buy the ingredients needed to prepare her dishes thereby meeting her diners’ demand.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meals.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena D. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis oriental. She is 39 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Lorena has a sari-sari (variety) store selling both food and daily use products. She has done this for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Lorena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorena is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lorena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sope Dabakh Group

texts.fr:
SOPE DABAKH est un groupement de 5 femmes commerçantes. Il est dirigé par Madame Ndondy B. âgée de 35 ans. Et il a été créé, il y’a tout juste 5 mois. Ces femmes se sont regroupées pour développer leur relation et s’entraider.
La présidente Ndondy B. est mère de deux enfants. Elle est commerçante de légumes au marché et gère également une table de légumes chez elle depuis 10 ans. En fait c’est un métier qu’elle a copie de sa maman qui vend jusqu’à présent des légumes au marché central de Thiès. Pour Madame Ndondy B. cette vente est prise pour aider son mari à la charge de la maison régler ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants.
Les autres membres du groupement sont :
-Madame Seynabou W. la trésorière vend des tissus Wax, Basin, Khartoum…… Elle est marchande ambulante depuis 10 ans.
-Madame Awa N. née en 1967 vend de l’huile, pâte d’arachide, poudre d’arachide (naflay) depuis 12 ans. Elle fait également la marchande ambulante.
-Madame Maguette W. est marchande ambulante de produits cosmétiques, parfums, sacs, chaussures depuis 4 ans 
-Madame Salimata L. âgée de 39 ans vend des produits cosmétiques et chaussures chez elle depuis 5 ans.
texts.en:
SOPE DABAKH is a group of 5 businesswomen. Its leader is Mme Ndondy B., 35 years old, and it was formed just five months ago. The women formed the group to develop their relationship and to help each other. Ndondy B. is the mother of two children. She sells vegetables in the market, and has also been selling them for ten years from a table at her home. She learned the trade from her mother, who still sells vegetables in the central market at Thiès. She engages in this business to help her husband manage their household and to take care of her famiL.'s needs. The other group members are: - Mme Seynabou W., the treasurer, who has been selling cloth (Wax, Basin, Khartoum……) door-to-door for ten years. - Mme Awa N., born in 1967,has been selling oil, peanut butter and ground peanuts naflay) for 12 years, also door-to-door. - Mme Maguette W. has been selling cosmetics, perfumes, bags and stockings door-to-door for four years. - Mme Salimata L., 39 years old, has been selling cosmetics and stockings from her home for five years.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
El Señor Edwin R. P. tiene 31 años de edad, el vive con su mujer  y una  hija pequeña de casi 1 años. Ellos viven en inmediaciones de ivirgarzama en una zona agrícola del Trópico, Carrasco, quinta sección, municipio de Puerto Villarroel. 

El Señor Edwin R. P. se dedica a la cría de peces, los cuales vende a los diferentes  restoranes en Ivirgarzama y Valle Sacta el vive en un cuarto en alquiler con los servicios necesarios, ya que el esta empanzando recién una vida familiar, el proviene de una familia muy humilde el trabaja todos los días para el bienestar de su hija y su esposa. 

Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de alevinos para ampliar sus piscinas de peces, y así poder incrementar más sus ingresos y poder ofrecer a su familia un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Sr. Edwin R. P. is 31 years old and lives with his wife and young daughter who is almost a year old. They reside in the vicinity of Ivirgarzama, an agricultural area of Trópico Carrasco in the fifth section of the town of Puerto Villarroel.

Edwin raises fish to sell to different restaurants in Ivirgarzama and Valle Sacta. He lives in a rental apartment that has all the basic services for his new family. Edwin was raised in a very humble family and works every day for the welfare of his wife and daughter.

He is requesting a loan to buy fish hatchlings so that he can restock and grow his fish pond. This will allow him to generate more income so that he can offer his family a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fish hatchlings

loans.name: Las Canasteras Group

texts.es:
Doña Loida Isabel Z. C. D. treinta nueve años D. edad, es una persona que ha superado criando animales tales como, gallinas ponedoras, cerdos, con este trabajo que ella realiza a podido mantener a su familia y cubrir sus gastos D. su hogar, por tal razón ella tomo la idea D. formar un grupo D. señoras, para que ellas puedan también superar este grupo está conformado por doce integrantes,  mujeres que se dedican en diferentes funciones como crianza D. animales, venta D. ropa, venta D. artículos D. consumo diario, elaboración D. canastas. Las integrantes del Banco Comunal “Las Canasteras”, del Paraje Chocaman Barrio Santa Isabel, Momostenango, están conformados por MUJERES todas se conocen bien desD. hace más D. doce años, el cual

Han decidido solicitar un crédito en ASDIR para poder mejorar sus condiciones D. vida y la D. su familia, ya que estas personas son D. escasos recursos y es D. gran ayuda para ellas ampliar su capital D. trabajo, mejorar sus ventas como también sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Loida Isabel Z. C. is thirty-nine years old. She is a person who has gotten ahead in life by raising animals, including pigs and laying hens. By doing this work, she has been able to support her family and cover her household expenses. For this reason, she had the idea to form a group of women so that the others can also make progress. The group has twelve members, all of them women, who work in different fields such as raising animals, selling clothing, selling staple goods, and making baskets. The members of the "Las Canasteras” communal bank of Chocaman, in the Santa Isabel area of Momostenango, are women who have known each other well for more than twelve years. They have decided to request a loan from ASDIR so that they can improve their living conditions and those of their families. The members are people with few economic resources, and it is a great help to them to expand their working capital, so that they can increase their sales and their income levels.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila C. is from the village of Sepaloc. She is 37 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Nila owns and operates a general store, selling household items and dry goods in the local community. Nila has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Nila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Nila is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Nila from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for the business

loans.name: Seak

texts.en: Mr. L. is an older man and the father of a child who is already married. L. is a local farmer who has been planting a variety of crops for years. His wife works on the farm with him. In addition to this job, L. owns a few ponds where many small fish grow. He estimates he will catch the fish to sell when they come to maturity, but unfortunately they are not very big due to the lack of food. Because he doesn’t have money, L. decided to seek help from Kiva lenders in the amount of $500 to purchase many sacks of fish food to fatten his fish.

loans.use: To purchase many sacks of fish food.

loans.name: Sope Naby Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE NABY est créé le 30 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 34 femmes toutes mariées. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, mères d’au moins de 02 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux. Ces femmes se sont organisées par voisinage et affinité et sont toutes issues du même village.

Dans l’intention d’augmenter leur pouvoir d’achat, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution CAURIE MICRO FINANCE. Elles sont à leur deuxième expérience avec cette dite institution et tous leurs prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Madame Aya F., debout à l’extrême de la photo, de noir  vêtue, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 38 ans. Elle fait un petit commerce de tissus, d’ustensiles de cuisine, de téléphones portables, etc. elle s’approvisionne à Nouakchott capitale de Mauritanie. Sa clientèle est composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt elle compte renforcer sa marchandise énumérée ci-dessus qu’elle vendra dans son village.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice qui lui permettra de participer aux différents besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The SOPE NABY solidarity group was created on December 30, 2009. It consists of 34 married women. On average, they are 40 years old and have at least two children. They live in nuclear families with their spouses and children. They were brought together by affinity and proximity, and they are all from the same village. In an attempt to increase their purchasing power, they decided to join the CAURE MICRO FINANCE organization. This is their second experience with this institution and their previous loans were repaid without incident. Mrs. Aya F., standing at the far right of the photo and dressed in black, is the head of the group. She is 38 years old. She has a small business selling fabrics, kitchenware, mobile phones, etc. She gets her stocks in Nouakchott, the capital of Mauritania. Her clientele consists mostly of women. She plans to use her loan to boost her stocks of merchandise, which she will sell in her village. She expects to make a profit that will allow her to provide for the various needs of the family.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acheter des tissus, des ustensiles de cuisine et des téléphones portables

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
El Sr Marcelino López Jiménez es conviviente con la señora Basilia Castellón Higuera hace 25 años atrás, tienen 5 hijos dependientes que estudian, viven en Segunda Candelaria Central Kury Mayu zona rural Colomi.

El Sr. Marcelino y su esposa se dedican a la agricultura, el cultivo de tuberculos, como papa, de donde perciben ingresos anuales, cosecha y comercializa en los días de feria de Colomi, Es así que logra mantener a su familia económicamente también abastecer para que sus hijos sigan estudiando hasta salir profesionales.

El Sr. Marcelino está solicitando préstamo a CIDRE, para compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza) y un ganado vacuno, con esto velar los intereses de estudio de sus hijos, de este modo sembrar en mas superficies y tener mayor movimiento económico en bien de su familia durante el año, seguridad alimentaria.
texts.en:
Sr. Marcelino L. Jimenez and his partner, Sra. Basilia Castellon Higuera, have been together for 25 years. They have 5 school-age children, all living at home. They live in a rural area near Colomi in Bolivia. Sr. Marcelino and his wife are farmers. They grow potatoes and other tuber crops that are common here. Selling the crop is their main source of income. They go to nearby Colomi on market days and sell the crops there. The income is how they support their family and save for their children's schooling. Sr. Marcelino is applying for a CIDRE loan so that he can buy organic (chicken) manure and a single head of cattle. The money will allow him to plant crops on more land and ensure that he can continue to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Dedicacion

texts.es: Dedicación, de 44 años, viuda, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de sus 3 jóvenes hijos, quienes le ayudan en las labores agrícolas. Se dedica en la siembra y cosecha de productos naturales y en la actualidad sus tierras producen papa, olluco y oca. Confiesa que luego de días de esforzada labor en el campo, pues debe madrugar todos los días a lado de sus hijos para cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas de insectos y de las variaciones climáticas. Se siente recompensada cuando recoge toda su buena producción y carga los pesados sacos de sus productos naturales hasta el mercado mayorista de su ciudad para comercializarlos a sus compradores, y como sus productos son de calidad obtiene regulares ganancias, que le permiten vivir cómodamente. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que lo realiza en compañía de sus hijos, y pasan trabajando gran parte del día. Como es una mujer bastante emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, además de comprar un terreno más, pues tiene el anhelo de dejar muy bien a sus hijos cuando ella les falte. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete ser puntual en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas, pues quiere devolver la confianza que depositan en ella, además esta muy agradecida no solo con las personas que hicieron posible el préstamo, si no también con los miembros de su grupo comunal que demostraron ser muy responsables y solidarios cuando trabajan juntos. Tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de abono para mejorar la productividad de sus campos, de esta manera espera continuar adelante.
texts.en:
Dedicación, 44 years old and a widow, lives in her own house with her three young children who help her with her agricultural work. She plants and sows produce. Her land currently produces potatoes, "olluco" (a starchy tuber similar to potatoes) and "oca" (a small waxy crinkled tuber). She confides that she works hard in the field. She must wake up very early every day and start taking care of her produce remediating blights and weather variations alongside her children. She feels rewarded when she has a good crop and takes the heavy bags of produce to her town's wholesale market to sell it to her buyers. Since she has good quality produce she obtains a regular income which allows her to live comfortably. What she likes the most about her job is the fact that she does it alongside her children and they spend good part of the day working. Being an entrepreneurial woman, she wants to buy another lot of land to leave to her children once she passes away. This is the second credit she has with MFP and she promises to make her payments on time. She wants to reward the trust that has been deposited in her. She is also very thankful not only to the people who made the loan possible but also to the members of her community group who have proven to be responsible and caring when they work together. She plans to invest the loan in the purchase of fertilizer to increase her fields' productivity. She hopes this will help her continue to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Virgilia Lagrio Group

texts.en:
Virgilia L. is from the town of Tigdok, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old and is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Virgilia L. Group.

Virgilia is widowed and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Virgilia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store, selling clothing and shoe products in the local community. Virgilia is just starting this business.

In 2010, Virgilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her 1st loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Patrocenio

texts.en:
Patrocenio P. is from the village of Mialen Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 30 years old. Patrocenio is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Patrocenio owns and operates a tricycle transport service. Patrocenio has been engaged in his business for more than five years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Patrocenio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Patrocenio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from GDMPC. He is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP, which will be used to repair his vehicle for better service. This will be the seventh loan taken by Patrocenio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul is a 60-year-old pepper producer and father of three who lives in the region of Upala in the Northern region of Costa Rica, minutes from the Nicaraguan border. Raul is a dedicated farmer. He plans to focus his efforts on the planting and harvesting of Cayenne and Habanero peppers. He works in cooperation with his family to strike a balance between accomplishing the daily tasks associated with agricultural production and the completion of domestic responsibilities. The land he works is his own. In addition to his agricultural activity, Raul feels it is important to be an active member of his community. As a result, he dedicates a significant portion of his time to community meetings, groups and events. The rural zone where Raul and his family live is sparsely populated with infrequent bus service and a general lack of infrastructure. Raul is working hard towards the sustenance of his family, striving to reap the maximum benefits from his land and his labor. 

Although this is an individual loan, the community in which Raul and his family live is very close-knit and interdependent. Neighbors help and support one another by sharing experiences and expertise acquired over the years. All individual members of the Upala community are dedicated to the improvement of living conditions for the region as a whole.

This loan will be used to finance the production of Cayenne and Habanero peppers. Specifically, the loan will be used to finance the purchase of a variety of necessary agricultural nutrients, fertilizers and chemicals in order to ensure a healthy harvest. All labor and logistical tasks associated with production will be carried out by Raul, with the help of his family members in the region of Upala. The production cycle (from planting to harvest) for these types of peppers is roughly one year. Raul planted his peppers four months ago and will expect to harvest in the next eight months. Typically, he dedicates the hours from 6:00 AM to 4:00 PM everyday to his agricultural activities. 

Piper and Capiscum Processors Compañía Agrícola Industrial (PROPICA) is an international buyer and seller of chili pepper and ground pepper products. In cooperation with Fundación Mujer, PROPICA has guaranteed to purchase the agricultural products (the peppers) that are to be produced with the help of this loan. PROPICA acts as a guaranteed client for small agricultural producers in the area of Upala, thus ensuring that their products will reach market. 

The main obstacle Raul and other producers in the Upala community face is a lack of access to working capital funds. The collaboration of Fundación Mujer and PROPICA represents a unique opportunity to Raul, his family and community. By offering a source of start-up capital and a guaranteed client to purchase what is produced, this is a chance to improve family and community standards of living. Above all, Raul wants to take advantage of the current opportunity that has been presented. He wants to profit from this collaboration and see improvements in his home and neighborhood.

loans.use: For the purchase of agricultural nutrients and chemicals.

loans.name: Shafiqullah

texts.en: Shafiqullah is son of F. R.. He is a resident of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and the father of three children. He needs the loan to purchase house construction supplies and build a new room because his house is very small and two rooms are not enough for his family to live in.Shafiqullah hopes that through this loan process he can solve the problem of his family.

loans.use: to purchase house construction supplies

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: José Antonio O. A. de 50 años de edad, reside en Concepción de Ataco, ubicado en el departamento de Ahuachapán, en donde vive junto a su hijo de 10 años de edad, el cual se dedica a estudiar. José se dedica a la venta ambulante de productos lácteos tales como: queso, crema, requesón, y otros tipos de quesos los cuales son típicos de este país. Él cuenta con una ruta trazada en la cual posee varios clientes fijos, a pesar de esto José desea obtener clientes nuevos, es por esto que solicita un préstamo a Integral por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos lácteos y de esta forma aumentar sus ventas lo cual es muy beneficioso para el como para su hijo.
texts.en: José Antonio O. A. is 50 years old.  He lives in Concepción de Ataco, in Ahuachapán department together with his 10 year-old son who is still in school.  José sells dairy products such as cheese, cream, 'requesón' (a ricotta style cheese) and other types of traditional cheese in the streets.  He has a route which he follows where he has a number of regular customers.  In spite of this, José would like to attract new customers.  This is why he is requesting a loan from Integral.  He would like to be able to buy more dairy products and, in this way, increase his sales which will be very beneficial both to himself and his son.

loans.use: To buy dairy products to sell

location.town: Concepción de Ataco, departamento de Ahuachapán

loans.name: Genilda

texts.en: Genilda A. is from the village of Kandiis, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old, married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Genilda owns and operates a business buying and selling medicinal ointment from medicinal suppliers in the local community. Genilda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Genilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Genilda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Genilda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 35 years old and married with two children between seven months and three years old.  Her husband sells clothes. For the past eight years, Florence has owned a boutique business that sells variety of items. She will use her loan to buy more merchandise to sell. Florence hopes to use her profit to re-invest in her business and renovate her house. In the future, she dreams of seeing her business quickly expand.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: H. Julienne

texts.fr: H. Julienne est mariée à un électricien et est mère d'un enfant, scolarisé. Le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge, en dehors de leur enfant. Il y a cinq ans que la famille s'est installée à Agblangandan dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Julienne n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Depuis environs quatre ans, afin de subvenir à ses besoins, Julienne mène comme activité la vente de boissons (alcoolisées et non alcoolisées) à Sèkandji. Parallèlement à cette activité, Julienne fait de la restauration (vente du riz). Julienne se ravitaille à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Julienne est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant obtenu trois crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Afin d'élever le niveau de son activité en cette période de fête de fin d'année et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Julienne sollicite à nouveau un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: H.Julienne is married to an electrician and has one child, who goes to school. In addition to their own child, they also have another child in their care. Five years ago, the family settled in Agblangadnadan, in the community of Sèmè-Podji. The spouses jointly take care of various family needs. Julienne never attended school. About four years ago, in order to support herself, Julienne has been selling beverages (both alcoholic and non-alcoholic in Sèkandji. In addition, Julienne cooks food for sale (rice). Julienne stocks up in Dantokpa, at the international market of Benin. Julienne is an old-time client of ALIDé, having had three prior loans, all duly repaid. In order to expand her business in this holiday season at the end of the year and to better meet her clients’ needs, Julienne is seeking a new loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: Purchasing beverages (canned and bottled) and rice

loans.name: Esperlita's Group

texts.en:
Esperlita L. is from the town of Mansabay Bajo ,Lopez Jaena. She is 57 years old. Esperlita is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Esperlita is widowed and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Esperlita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as canned goods, noodles, milk, coffee, spices, sugar,  shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Esperlita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Esperlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esperlita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Esperlita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional daily use products to sell

loans.name: Adriano

texts.es:
Adriano es un padre de familia de 59 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus cuatro hijos en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona se cL. semitropical que se caracteriza principalmente por du producción de frutas como mango y limón. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicado a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno. Él cría a su ganado en algnos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio, las alimenta en base a granos y pastos naturales y cuando han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de sustento, por ello siempre trata de mantenerla del mejor modo posible. 

Actualmente Adriano desea mejorar la crianza de sus animales adquiriendo alimento balanceado con esta inversión él espera lograr que sus animales se desarrollen de un mejor modo para poder ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Adriano is the father of a family, he is 59 years old and he lives together with his wife and their four children in the community that makes up the agricultural district of Tambogrande. It is a semitropical region primarily known for fruit production such as mangoes and lemons. It belongs to the region of Piura and it is located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo. 

He raises and sells livestock. He keeps his livestock in some corrals located near his house and he feeds them grains and natural grasses. When they have reached a good level of development he puts offers them up for sale to the merchants who visit the region where he lives. This business is his primary source of income which is why he always tries to manage it in the best way possible. 

Adriano wishes to improve his livestock business with the acquisition of balanced feed. This investment will help him raise his livestock in a better way and it will improve his sales and his earnings. In order to reach his objective he approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To purchase balanced livestock feed.

loans.name: Lateefa

texts.en:
Lateefa is a mother of two daughters and two sons. Lateefa and her husband started a small grocery store two years ago. The store is giving the family decent returns. Lateefa took a loan from FATEN to purchase more variety of goods to enrich the grocery store and attract more clients.

Lateefa's children are still very young, but she wants to enlarge the business and be able to save enough to secure her children's education money for the near future.

Lateefa's husband appears in the picture here, as Lateefa is a conservative woman.

loans.use: To purchase a larger variety of goods for their store

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe es chofer y trabaja en el sindicato de Transportes Laja ocupando el cargo de secretario general en dicho sindicato; su esposa tiene un puesto de venta de salteñas tucumanas (en ingles  es turnovers), el crédito lo quiere para comprar aceite, harina, condimentos y demás para continuar elaborando las mismas. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención de su familia.
Vive  en anticrético  ubicado en la zona de villa Tunari de la ciudad de El Alto, tiene cuatro hijos. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que se le otorgaron.
texts.en:
Felipe is a driver and works as General Secretary of the Laja Transportation Syndicate.  His wife has a stand selling Tucuman style salteñas (turnovers).  He wants the loan to buy oil, flour, condiments and other ingredients to continue making them.  This is his main source of income for family support.

He lives under the anticrético modality (a transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract) in El Alto’s Villa Tunari area.  He has four children.  He is very satisfied with the loans he’s been granted.

loans.use: To buy oil, flour, condiments and other ingredients to continue making salteñas (turnovers).

loans.name: Lenah

texts.en:
Lenah is a farmer from the town of Kitale in western Kenya. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last nine years and employs one farmhand. Her mixed farm produces milk, maize and beans which are all sold locally. She is also employed as a teacher in one of the local schools.

Lenah is 53 years old and a divorced mother of six children who are adults. Two of the children are still attending school. 

She has requested for a loan of 30,000Kes through Juhudi Kilimo for poultry farming. The proceeds from this loan will help in the education of her children. She hopes to expand her poultry farming and if possible own a breeding farm in future.

loans.use: Poultry farming

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses M. L., 47, has been in the business of farming and selling sugar cane for the last four years in Kagera-Kakira-Jinja. Before that, Moses, who is happily married and has six children, was involved in a cattle keeping business. 

He started growing and selling sugar cane after a foreign investor established a sugar making factory around his village. Moses, like many of his fellow villagers, decided that was an opportunity they had to rise up to, given the ready market that was going to avail itself. 

Moses also has a modest milk sales business on the side. He says he is able to make profits to the tune of 1.5 million shillings monthly. 

With this loan, Moses says he is going to purchase more manure to improve his sugar cane gardens.

loans.use: to purchase manure to improve his sugar cane gardens

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora. Ana C. es socia del banco comunal en Sueños, vive en la comunidad de San Marcos en la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es de clima frió, tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica, su gente se dedica al comercio, es una ciudad que tiene muchos lugares para visitar.

La Señora. Ana tiene 23 años, casada y  un hijo de 1 año y 4 meses de edad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un bus, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de su mamá que es propia y comparten los gastos del hogar.

Doña Ana trabaja en un almacén en donde venden ropa deportiva, esta actividad la realiza hace 8 meses y labora de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito y fue invitada por su hermana quien es socia activa del banco comunal, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su hogar.
 
Su meta es tener un local de venta de ropa deportiva.
texts.en:
Ms. Ana C. is a member of the Banco Comunal En Sueños (In Dreams Communal Bank). She lives in the San Marco neighborhood of the town of Azogues. This is a town with cold climate and of great architectural beauty, rich in places to visit and whose inhabitants engage in trade.

Ana is 23 years old, she is married and has a child aged 1 year and 4 months. Her husband is a bus driver. As they do not have a house of their own, they live in her mother’s house contributing to the household expenses.

Ana works in a sport clothes department store. She started 8 months ago and she works there Mondays to Fridays form 8 am to 6 pm.

This is her second loan cycle. She has been invited in the group by her sister, who is an active member of the communal bank. She will invest the loan amount in the purchase of provisions for her family.

She aims at running a sport clothes shop.

loans.use: To buy provisions for her family.

loans.name: Carmen Araceli

texts.es:
Carmen de 58 años, es Directora de la Unidad Educativa Ciudad de Playas desde hace 10 años, es un puesto que lo heredo de su familia. 

Actualmente sigue encargada de la escuela ya que ha estudiado para mantenerla. labora desde las 7H00 am a 15H00 pm hasta que no haya alumnos dentro de la institución y tiene una gama de profesores asignados para diferentes áreas. Con el préstamo ella va a comprar implemento de construcción. Ella espera poder seguir al mando de su escuela y adecuarla para darle un mejor servicio a la población y enseñar a más alumnos.
texts.en:
Carmen is 58 and has served as principal of the Ciudad de Playas School for 10 years, a position she gained through her family ties. 
She manages the school and has trained to maintain it, working from 7 a.m. to 3 p.m. with students and a crew of teachers assigned to different areas. Carmen seeks credit to buy construction materials, to expand the school and improve conditions to benefit local students and families.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Galdys

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHURA 5TO PARADERO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Galdys; ella tiene 42 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de preparación y venta de chicha, ella vende en forma ambulatoria llevando a lugares como Quillabamba y lo distribuye a bares y otras picanterías, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de chicha. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como maíz y leña para preparar la chicha. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Galdys is a member of the "San Isidro de Yanahura 5to Paradero" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Galdys is 42 years old, married, and has five children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business making and selling 'chicha' (a traditional, corn-based drink).  She does not make her sales from a fixed location.  She sells her product in places such as Quillabamba.  She sells to bars and restaurants.  Galdys would like to expand and improve her 'chicha' business.  She is requesting this loan to buy supplies such as corn and firewood for making 'chicha'.

Galdys is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as corn and firewood for making 'chicha'

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en:
This Kiva client trades in electrical and bathroom accessories for home construction. The income generated from his business is the main source of income for the client’s family, including his wife and pensioner parents. 

He would like to increase sales and develop his business. With the requested loan, he plans to purchase a new stock of merchandise, thus increasing working capital.

loans.use: to purchase a new stock of merchandise

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
Israel, tiene 26 años de edad, es un joven que se dedica a la siembra de café,  a su corta edad ya es todo un experto en la siembras, el es originario de Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí, es soltero . El inicio esta actividad hace 10 años este oficio se le enseño su padre, quien lo ha venido entrenando en el negocio de siembra y compra- venta de ganado. Hace 6 años es Israel quien se encarga de dirigir la crianza de animales y de las siembras ya que su padre tiene 80 años y ya no puede trabajar con el  en  la finca.  
El solicito el préstamo para sembrar 1 manzana de café orgánico y cubrir costos de producción tales como pago de mano de obra, compra de abono, insumos y plantas de café. El espera sacar una producción con altos rendimientos, desea poder vender a un buen precio su café directamente al mercado que le ofrezca una buena oferta, así dar a conocer su producto.
Su próxima meta es mejorar la calidad de sus reses para sacar una buena producción de leche, hacerles mejoras a la finca.
texts.en:
Israel is 26 years old.  He is a young man whose business is growing coffee.  At his young age, he is already a real expert in growing his crops.  He is from Pueblo Nuero, in Estelí and is single.  Israel started out in this business ten years ago.  His father taught him the trade and trained him in the business of growing crops and also buying and selling livestock.

For six years now, Israel has been in charge of raising his animals and growing his crops since his father is 80 years old and can no longer work with him on the farm.  He is requesting this loan so that he can sow one 'manzana' (1.68 acres) with organic coffee and cover production costs such as paying laborers and buying manure, supplies and coffee plants.  He hopes to receive a high yield from his crops and would like to be able to sell his coffee directly on the market for a good price.  This will enable him to make his product known.  His next goal is to improve the quality of his cattle so that he can enjoy a good milk production and make some improvements to his farm.

loans.use: to sow one 'manzana' (1.68 acres) with organic coffee and to cover production costs such as paying laborers and buying manure, supplies and coffee plants

loans.name: Maura Elizabeth

texts.es: Maura Elizabeth de treinta y dos años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una sala de belleza en un local alquilado cerca de su residencia. Para Maura aquella persona que se esfuerza en su trabajo, no tiene rival alguno, es por eso que ella siempre da lo mejor de sí a los clientes que la visitan, trabaja los cortes de cabello con mas estilo, planchados, lavados, pistoleados entre otros a precios accesibles. Se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente ya que su trabajo es inigualable; está dispuesta a seguir mejorando es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita la compra de artículos para su trabajo como tintes, peines, cremas para peinar, cosméticos, esmaltes, etc. Así podrá mantener la calidad de su trabajo y vender productos a sus clientes. Además Maura le ofrecerá a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una seguridad económica para su hogar.
texts.en: Maura Elizabeth is thirty two years old and she lives with her life partner and their three children in their own house. She has a beauty salon in a rented space close to her residence. For Maura, a person who works hard at their job has no rival. That is why she always gives her best to the customers who visit her. She cuts hair with more style, and washes and straightens hair with flat irons and blow-outs, all at affordable prices.  She has gained a lot of customers lately since her work is unparalleled. She is willing to keep improving, and that is why she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy items for her work such as dyes, combs, styling creams, cosmetics, nail polish, etc. In this way, she will be able to maintain her work quality and sell products to her customers. In addition, Maura will offer her family a better quality of life and financial security for the home.

loans.use: to buy dyes, combs, styling creams, cosmetics and nail polish.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace, 25 years of age, is married to a policeman. They have no children yet. She has had a retail store for almost 11 years and she sells a variety of different products. Her net income is 6,000 PHP, monthly. She's asking a loan for 12,000 PHP to purchase canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee to sell. She hopes to continue to avail loans and achieve her dream for her family through patience and hard work.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
El Sr. Valentin tiene 50 años de edad, esta casado con el Sra. Elena de 54 años de edad, ellos tienen cuatro hijos, Liz de 20 años de edad, actualmente trabaja en Argentina, Ever de 22 años de edad, vive y trabaja en Ciudad de Este, Rogelio de 18 años, y Leidy de 12 años que esta cursando el 7mo grado. 
Don  Valentin trabaja como comerciante ambulante hace más de 16 años. El empezó vendiendo caramelos, y luego de juntar su dinero comenzó a salir mas lejos con mas mercaderías a vender, en la actualidad tiene su clientela formada por zonas aledañas a la ciudad, y con las ganancias de su trabajo siempre pudo mantener su  hogar y salir adelante con su familia.
El Sr. Valentin solicita el crédito para la compra de ropas de  temporada invernal, frazadas, sabanas y demás para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Valentín is 50 years old and married to Elena, 54.  They have four children: Liz, 20, who currently works in Argentina, Ever, 22, who lives and works in Ciudad del Este, Rogelio,18, and Leidy,12, who is in 7th grade.

Valentín has worked as a street vendor for over 16 years.  He started out selling candy and once he gathered some money together started to go further afield with more merchandise to sell.  Currently, he has an established clientele in areas surrounding the city.  Profits from his work always made it possible for him to support his household and get ahead with his family.

Valentín is asking for the loan to buy seasonal winter clothes, blankets, sheets and others to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing, blankets, sheets, etc.

loans.name: Jerelyn

texts.en: Jerelyn, aged 32, is single and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. To earn a living, she has a general store business. She has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 4,000. Jerelyn has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase more stock for her general store. She has been a member of PMPC for over one year. In the future, Jerelyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Patricia Maricela

texts.es: La señora Patricia Maricela es soltera, tiene 24 años de edad, cursó los 4 años de educación primaria, se dedica a la confección de tejidos para un negocio, ella es operaria en la elaboración de chumpas, inicio este trabajo cuando trabajaba en una fábrica de textiles y ahora lleva 5 años de experiencia trabajando para otro negocio y quiere aumentar su volumen de producción para mejorar sus ingresos, por esta razón decide solicitar un prestamos que servirá para comprar una maquina cerradora de tejidos, ya que con estos será más productiva y tendrá una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Patricia Maricela is 24 years old, single, and finished four years of her elementary school education. Her business involves producing woven articles. Patricia is skilled at making sweaters. She started this business when she worked at a textile factory and now she has five years of experience working in her own business.

Patricia wants to increase her production volume so that she can improve her income. For this reason, she decided to request a loan to buy a machine for making seams in her woven items. This will allow her to be more productive so that she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a machine for making seams.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is a married woman whose husband works in a travel agency. He offers his customers services related to Hajj and Umra, which are Muslim religious festivals. 

Shazia has a job as a teacher in a nearby school. She is very talented in her profession and puts all of her effort into transferring her knowledge to her students. 

She also operates a business of selling clothes to make extra income. She sells clothes to her neighboring clients. Due to her good collection of clothes she receives a good number of orders every month. 

She is the mother of five children, all of whom are getting their education by attending school nearby. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her clothes-selling business. With the loan, she will buy clothes in bulk, which will allow her to offer more variety to her customers and increase her profits. 

She has been operating her business for many years and is confident that this investment will be a profitable one for her. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Shazia.

loans.use: To buy clothes for selling

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 56 years old, married, and has four children.  They live in Turod Norte Cordon. She sells fish while her husband manages their rice fields. He also helps her with selling fish within their village.  Elvira uses her income to pay the electric bill and for her family's daily needs. 

Due to high cost of basic commodities, Elvira is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase fish such as tilapia and milkfish to sell. Elvira hopes to  increase her profits so that she can sustain the financial needs of the family and save money for the future. She believes that through her patience in managing her business she will be able to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to  buy tilapia and milkfish for her fish selling business.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Estela has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, noodles & beverages. She has had this business for 30 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Estela has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Estela hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Edwin Alexander

texts.es:
A sus 23 años de edad y como padre de1 niño, Edwin se dedicó a trabajar incansablemente para sacar adelante a familia, día a día se rebusca la manera de generar ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida, por ello, desde hace 5 años se dedica a la cría, engorde y venta de cerdos.

Para continuar con este negocio y esperando ampliar sus clientes, Edwin necesita un préstamo para comprar 20 bultos de cuido para los cerdos y una hembra de cría, de esta manera se mejorará la producción y generar mayores ingresos ya que se aproxima la época de diciembre. 

Este emprendedor sueña con tener una casa propia, por eso trabaja con gran dedicación y esfuerzo, para lograr una mejor calidad de vida para el y su familia.
texts.en:
At the age of 23, Edwin is the father of 1 boy and he works tirelessly to provide for his family. Day after day he looks for ways to generate an income in order to improve their quality of life. For this reason he has been working for the past 5 years in raising, fattening and selling pigs.

In order to continue on with this business and with the hopes of increasing his clients, Edwin needs a loan to purchase 20 sacks of food for pigs and a reproductive sow. This way he will improve production and generate a better income, especially because the December season approaches.

This entrepreneur dreams of having his own house. To this end he works with great dedication and effort. He wants to achieve a better quality of life for himself and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his pigs and to purchase a sow.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a widow and 32 years old with 3 children.

Annie owns and operates a business venture, selling chips.  She has 2 years of experience in this business. Annie needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her loan to improve the business.

In 2009, Annie joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Annie's 3rd loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.
