Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score.""  For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
THIS BORROWER IS FROM IRAQ.  SHE IS 35 YEARS OLD, MARRIED, AND A MOTHER of FIVE CHILDREN.

HANAN is a tailor. She started working in 1995. She  professionally makes, repairs, or alters clothing, such as suits, coats and trousers for women. She has more than four years experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is well-known in the surrounding areas.

She decided to apply for a $2200 loan in order to purchase a sewing machine and to add more goods. She is aiming to gain more profits to improve her family’s life.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and to add more goods.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora teresa cuenta con 31 años de edad y está casada con el señor Vicente, quien es campesino con el cual tiene 5 hijos, ana Isabel, laureliano, Jennifer, luz Elena y yamilet, de los cuales todos estudian, la mayor esta cursando el tercer año de secundaria, tres mas están en cuarto y quinto año de primaria y la mas pequeña segundo año de preescolar año de preescolar, se dedica a la alfarería desde hacen 15 años.
Ella dice que decidió iniciar con este pequeño negocio, ya que quería buscar la manera de apoyar a su esposo, con los gastos de la casa y para la educación de sus hijos, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas trastes como son: cómales, ollas, cazuelas, vasijas, cantaros y leña, para así tener un poco más surtido su negocio.
Doña teresa dice que uno de los sueños que tiene, es el de hacer crecer aun mas su pequeño negocio, puesto que quiere construir un local, para poner su tienda y así tener un amplio surtido y variedad de productos, puesto que así obtendrá mejores ingresos, para poder apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios superiores.
Está muy contenta por esta gran ayuda que FRAC y los prestatarios de kiva le están brindando, ya que gracias a eso, ahora goza de un mejor nivel de vida y un buen negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Teresa, 31, is married to Vicente who is a farmer.  They have five children, Ana Isabel, Laureliano, Jennifer, Luz Elena and Yamilet, all of whom are in school.  The eldest is in her third year of high school, three are in fourth and fifth grades and the youngest is in preschool.  For fifteen years she has been in the pottery business.

She decided to begin her small business as a way of helping her husband with the household expenses and educating the children.  She plans to use the loan to buy items such as comal pans, pots, casseroles, earthenware pots, pitchers and firewood, so she has more variety at her business.

Teresa says one of her dreams is to grow her small business and open a store.  This will allow her to increase her stock and variety of products aimed at obtaining more income to support her children in their upper education.

She is happy about the support received from FRAC and the Kiva lenders since it has improved her lifestyle and helped the business.

loans.use: To buy comal pans, pots, casseroles, earthenware pots, pitchers and firewood.

loans.name: Teodora Zoraida

texts.es:
La señora Teodora es de la ciudad de Encarnación, ella es soltera y tiene 3 hijos.  Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas, y comenta que tiene un puesto de ventas en una empresa.
Dice que hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de comidas,  lo cual le ayuda a contar con muy buena clientela e ingresos. Nos comenta que todos sus hijos la ayudan en el trabajo para que de esa forma todo sea más llevadero.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, verduras, condimentos, panificados y otros, los cuales son necesarios para la elaboración de los alimentos que vende. Esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que la fundación y Kiva les está brindando.
texts.en:
Teodora is from the city of Encarnación.  She is single and has three children.  She works selling food, and comments that she has a stall in a company.

She says she has been selling food for four years, which helps her to have good customers and income.  All her children help her in the work so that everything is more bearable.

Teodora is requesting the loan to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, bread, and other products that are necessary to make the foods she sells.

She is very grateful for the opportunity that the foundation and Kiva are offering them.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, bread, and other products to make food.

loans.name: Hermilia

texts.es: Hermilia, de 58 años es una mujer responsable. Vive en compañía de Alejandro, su esposo desde hace 29 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Edson y Emerson, a los que cuidan en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Ataura. Ella cuida a su papá que es anciano, juntos administran los terrenos que posee, ahí siembra maíz, papa y habas, en grandes cantidades. Con sus ganancias puede solventar los gastos que le genera cuidar a su papa, que tiene una salud delicada, pero no solo a ello se dedica, también cría animales como: 7 vacas, 8 ovejas, 4 cerdos y 40 cuyes, los cuales enseba para luego vender a un mayor precio a los carniceros que visitan la zona. También abrió una pequeña tienda de comestibles, donde vende productos de primera necesidad y bebidas de toda variedad. Mientras su esposo trabaja con un auto haciendo taxi y administra los otros 2, que adquirieron con mucho esfuerzo. Ahora tiene que trabajar con más esfuerzo, pues sus hijos estudian en una universidad reconocida y tiene que solventar sus gastos. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario, “palomitas”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde agradece al apoyo de todos ustedes, pues hace posible que continúe con su trabajo. Además promete ser puntual en sus cuotas, ya que le agrada trabajar con personas responsables y solidarias. Hermilia de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado, en convertir a gas el funcionamiento de su auto; que es a petróleo. Con ello podrá minimizar los costos.
texts.en:
Hermilia is 58 years old and a very responsible woman.  She lives with Alejandro, her husband of 29 years.  They have 2 children together, Edson and Emerson, who they care for in their own home in the Ataura locality.

She tends to her father, who is elderly, and they both manage the lands that he owns.  There, they plant corn, potatoes and beans in large quantities.  With the earnings, she can meet the expenses of caring for her father, whose health is delicate.  She doesn’t dedicate herself only to farming, but also raises animals such as:  7 cows, 8 sheep, 4 pigs and 40 guinea pigs, which she then sells at a higher price to the butchers who visit the zone.

She also opened a small food store where she sells basic needs items and beverages of all types.  While her husband works as a taxi driver, she manages the other 2, which require a great deal of effort.  She now has to work harder, since her two children are studying at a well-known university and she has to meet those expenses.

She belongs to the “Palomitas” cooperative bank, and this is her second loan with MFP.  She is thankful for all of your help, as it has made it possible for her to continue with her work.  In addition, she commits to being punctual with her payments, as she enjoys working with people who are responsible and supportive.  Hermilia, at receiving your funds, will invest in converting her car to gas, as it is currently petroleum.  With this change, she will be able to minimize costs.

loans.use: convert her vehicle from petroleum to gas.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma, 49, is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has a 23-year-old child.

Gemma is engaged in farming. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Gemma also sells feeds, fertilizers and gasoline to her community. She does her best to improve her family income.

Gemma has requested a loan to buy more feeds, fertilizers and gasoline to sell. Gemma hopes to continue supporting her family financially. She also plans to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to buy more feeds, fertilizers and gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther, de 31 años, es una mujer buena y amable, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos de 13, 9 y 6 años. Ella junto a su pareja trabajan mucho pues su deseo es brindar una buena educación y dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, viven en su casa propia todos juntos. El trabajo de Esther consiste en la venta de abarrotes en su tienda que esta ubicado en una calle muy concurrida de la ciudad y a donde van todos los días muchas personas en busca de productos que tienen la seguridad que ahí encontraran. Su tienda esta en su casa y trabaja sola desde hace tres años, cuando empezó no sabia nada del negocio pero con el tiempo fue ganando experiencia y así pudo aprender. Le va muy bien ahora, ya que genera buenos ingresos a través de sus múltiples ventas, además de tener tiempo para poder realizar algunas otras actividades. Esta tranquila trabajando ya que sabe que no solo depende de los ingresos de su pareja sino que también ella aporta en la economía del hogar. Espera poder seguir trabajando y lograr así agrandar su negocio para tener mejores ingresos. Este será el crédito número 4 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete en seguir siendo una socia puntual y cumplida como en los créditos anteriores que tuvo, además desea seguir trabajando con los socios de su banco comunal ya que todos son muy amables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará abarrotes y otros productos más para implementar mejor a su negocio.
texts.en:
Esther is 31 years old.  She is a kind and friendly woman who lives with her partner.  The couple have three children who are 13, 9 and 6 years old.  Esther and her partner work hard as their wish is to provide their family with a good education and a better quality of life.  The family live together in their own home.  Esther's work is selling groceries from her store which is located in a very busy street in her town.  Many people go there every day in order to locate products which they know they will find there.  Esther's store is located in her home and she has been working there alone for three years.  When she first started out she didn't know anything about the business but she gained experience over the years and was able to learn.  Her business is now doing well and she is able to make good income through her sales.  She also has the time she needs to carry out other activities.

Esther is happy working as she knows that she doesn't depend solely on her partner's income but also contributes to her household finances herself.  She hopes to be able to continue working and to manage to increase her business in order to make better income.

This will be Esther's fourth loan from MFP and she hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can continue achieving her goals.  For her part, she pledges to continue being punctual in making her repayments as all the members of her community bank are friendly and supportive.  Esther will use the 1,000 soles she has requested to buy groceries and other products with which to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy more products with which to stock her store

loans.name: Melde

texts.en:
Melde is from Sinara Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 47 years old and married with three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Melde owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, selling charcoal in the local community. Melde has been in her business for four years and earns 4,500 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2007, Melde joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melde is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase coconut shells for charcoal making. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase coconut shells for charcoal making

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oil, lard, rice, sugar, beans, eggs and bread.

loans.name: Khurshaid Bibi

texts.en:
Khurshaid is 39 years old. She is married and lives in his own home along with her husband, son and young daughter. They live in the Multan district in the province of Punjab, Pakistan. Her husband involved in animal business. Both his personal and professional references from area inhabitants are very good. Most people in the area work in agriculture, business and livestock. He raises and sells cattle, and has had experience doing this for 15 years. 

He markets his cattle on Sundays in the livestock market in the Multan district, where breeders and buyers from throughout the district and its villages come to bid on the cattle.
Khurshaid is applying for the loan from KIVA’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for the purchase of cattle. In addition her husband works in construction helping build buildings. The loan will be to invest in the purchase of cattle and in their care. This way he will earn better income and improve his quality of life.

Khurshaid is a recurrent member with BRAC Pakistan. She is signing with a guarantor.
Khurshaid and her family will be thankful to the KIVA’s lender and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy animals for her husband's Business

loans.name: Alba

texts.en: In our town, most people have very few economic resources, so they perfer to buy second-hand clothing.  My business is to sell second-hand clothing imported from the United Status.  I have been running this business for 8 years and I have regular customers.  Thanks to my business, I have been able to build my little house, and now my two children are in school.

loans.use: Buy inventory of two clothing loads.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.en:
My name is Juan Francisco, and my main economic activity is as a taxi driver in my city. I have one taxi with the operating number 373. I have done this job for many years in order to cover family expenses and maintain my car in good condition. However, due to many car problems that I recently discovered, I need your help.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Juan Francisco, mi actividad principal es el transporte de Taxi en mi ciudad, cuento con una unidad de taxi con numero de explotación No. 373, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos cubrir los gastos familiares y darle el mantenimiento al vehiculo, pero en vista que actualmente se le detectaron varios fallas me veo en la obligación de solicitar su apoyo.

loans.use: to buy 4 tires, a fan, bolts, and rear shock absorbers

loans.name: Osarumwense

texts.en: 35 years old, Mrs. Osarumwense O. learnt trade on selling of food items for 2 years before she started her own business in the year 1996. She is married with two (2) children and lived in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. According to her if the amount $250 get to her, she will be able to expand her business

loans.use: To buy more goods for sales

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 24 years old. He is single and lives with his big family in Kirkuk. He applied for a loan from AL-Aman to get $1000 for his mobile shop. He wants to bring new and modern mobile types to the shop and sell them. He wants to increase his sales, develop his shop, earn more money and enhance his family's living standard.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Bring new and modern mobile types

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy the fruit and equipmment necessary to make and sell fruit juices

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase maize, sugar, and additional stock, and to renovate her retail shop to prevent leaks

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata is 23 years old and married with 2 children.  Her husband is a local mechanic who has an irregular income.  Fatmata sells firewood and she has been running the business for two years.  Her income supports the family expenses.  She transports wood from the source by cart, which she said is very slow and expensive.  To use vehicles for transporting wood, Fatmata needs to purchase the wood in a large quantity, but she does not have sufficient capital to do this at present.  She is therefore requesting a $275 loan to expand and increase her stock.

loans.use: To purchase her firewood stock in bulk to increase her profits.

loans.name: Moa

texts.en: Mrs. Moa M., 63, is a mother of nine children. She is a housewife, while her husband is employed at a private company, earning up to $10 each day. Two of her children are grocers, three work at a garment factory making collectively over $300 per month, and the rest are married and live with their own families. Mrs. Moa M. hopes to use this loan to purchase more grocery products to expand her children's businesses and inventory. It is important to mention that with additional grocery items added, it enables her children to meet growing customer demands and generate more income for the household.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to expand her children’s business inventory

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.en:
Shahodat is 49 years old. She and her husband have raised three children. Shahodat's husband is pictured as she was not well that day and her husband is assisting her in the business.

Shahodat sells oriental sleeves jackets and national dresses. In Tajikistan, it is a tradition about one week after a wedding party to invite the young couple and their closest relatives to visit the bride's parents. During this family occasion the bride is dressed in the beautiful national dress and oriental sleeves jacket with national hat. Shahodat has been in this business for 7 years. Her customers are happy with the goods and services she provides. Her business is the main source of income for her family and generates stable profit.

Today Shahodat requests a US$1,000 loan for a term of 6 months. She is planning to increase the range of goods she sells by purchasing new oriental sleeves jackets and national dresses for sale. Shahodat has received previous loans from IMON and proven herself a reliable client. She thanks all for their support and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: To purchase new oriental sleeves jackets and national dresses for sale.

loans.name: Azad

texts.en: K. Azad is a 29-year-old farmer who sells milk and yoghurt to the local bazaar traders. He started his business in 2002 in the small village of Saatli where he has lived for his entire life. He is going to purchase two additional cows and for this purpose he applied for 1200 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase two additional cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use:
Invertir en viveres para su negocio con la meta de poder empezar a construir un restaurante en su domicilio
Invest in supplies for her business with the aim of being able to begin to construct a restaurant in her house.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica H. is married and her husband works as a salesman. She has 3 children, Angel 8, Jazmin 6, and Alondra 4. They are all students. Three years ago she began the sale of shoes through a catalog. She began that from the recommendation of her mother when her husband got sick and could not work. Her mother gave her the catalog so that she could offer the shoes for sale. Since she has been successful she has continued this business.

Now she needs a loan for $500us that she will be able to pay back in 5 months so that she can buy products

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Jessica H. esta casada y su esposo trabaja como agente de ventas, tiene 3 hijos Ángel de 8, Jazmín de 6 y Alondra de 4 años, estudiantes. Hace 3 años empezó con la venta de zapatos por catalogo, lo hizo por recomendación de su madre cuando su esposo enfermo y no podía trabajar, entonces su mama le regalo el catalogo para que ofreciera los zapatos. Como le ha ido bien continua con esta actividad.

Ahora solicita un préstamo por US $500 que esta dispuesta a pagar en 5 meses para comprar mercancía.

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Yamileth

texts.es:
Ms. Yamileth Mejia is a 35-year-old married mother of 4 children ages 4, 16, 16, and 18. They live in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. Her husband is an industrial electrician who helps with the household expenses.

Ms. Mejia has been selling clothing and cosmetics for a living for 4 years. She started the business with her own money. She needs this loan for home improvement; she wants to build a kitchen in order to be more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Yamileth tiene 35 años de edad, es casada, y habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, y tiene 4 hijos de 4, 16, 16, 18 años de edad, su esposo es electricista industrial y ayuda en los gastos del hogar.

Doña Yamileth su negocio es la venta de cosmético y ropa, lleva cuatro años de experiencia y comenzó con la venta de cosmético con dinero propio. El préstamo lo quiere para hacer mejoras a su vivienda construyendo una cocina para estar más cómoda.

loans.use: Finish building a kitchen in her home

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
Ban H., 47, is a married with seven children and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh. Four of her children are married; two are employed by the garment factory; and the rest are students. Ban has business bringing the clothes from the factory and to sew at home. Normally she makes $1 per day. The majority of the income is from her husband, named Chan Lim. He is a motor-taxi driver and earns $6 each day.

Now Ban is requesting a loan to help her to create another business to earn more income in order to support her family. She wants to set up a small stand selling vegetables, beef and pork in front of her house.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for her business and to set up a small stand selling vegetables, beef and pork in front of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase stocks of medicine and a suction machine

loans.name: Teymur

texts.en: Teymur A. is 24-year-old man who sell fruits and vegetables in the central bazaar of the Saatli region. He has 4  years of experience in this field. He lives with his parents, and his business is the only income source for his family. Teymur applied for $1200 USD to improve the conditions of his store.

loans.use: To improve conditions of his store

loans.name: Bartola

texts.es:
Bartola es socia del Banco Comunal Legión.

Bartola es casada, tiene 45 años y 4 hijos, Bartola junto a su familia tienen un taller textil D. elaboración D. tejidos artesanales como alfombras, pasadizos, individuales, carteras, correas, actividad que realizan también sus hijos en sus horarios libres y cuenta con el apoyo D. varios empleados, sus ventas lo realizan en el mercado artesanal D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho en donD. tiene 2 puestos en donD. expone sus bellos trabajos, además su esposo viaja a las diferentes ferias del país y también en algunas oportunidades viaja a países vecinos.

Bartola necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. hilos y lanas. Bartola sueña con tener una empresa más granD., D. exportación en mayor volumen y que sus hijos terminen D. estudiar sus profesiones.
texts.en:
Bartola is a member of the Communal Bank "Legión". Bartola is married, is 45 years old and has 4 children. Together with her family, Bartola owns a textile shop where they make artisan tapestries like rugs, table runners, table mats, wallets, and keychains. Her children help out in the business during their spare time, and she also has the help of a few employees. She sells her products at an artisan market in the city of Ayacucho, where she displays her beautiful work in her two shops. In addition, her husband travels to different fairs in the country and in some cases to neighboring countries to sell her products.

Bartola needs a loan of $375 USD. This money will be used to purchase thread and wool. Bartola dreams of owning a larger company, to export greater quantities of products, and hopes her children finish studying their respective majors.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bartola needs a loan of $375 USD to purchase thread and wool

loans.name: Morn

texts.en: Mrs. Morn C. is a villager in Vihea Village in Kandal Province. Morn is 25 years old and the mother of two children who are all attending the local school. She is a farmer who owns 1.3-hectares to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Ban Nhock, is a fisherman who can gather only a little fish because he now has insufficient fishing tools. In order to improve their businesses, his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy a new boat for her husband to catch fish and she will use the rest of the money to buy more fishnets.

loans.use: Morn would like to buy a new boat for her husband's fishing business.

loans.name: Hien

texts.vi: Chị Hiến năm nay 42 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2007. Gia đình chị hiện có nghề làm bánh cuốn truyền thống nên với mức vốn vay qua các vòng chị đều đầu tư vào mua nguyên liệu phục vụ cho công việc sản xuất bánh cuốn của gi đình. Hiện nay với mức thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị .Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 9 triệu đồng để đầu tư mua 2 tấn lúa dự trữ để làm bánh cuốn
texts.en:
Ms. Hien is 42 years old, and joined TYM fund in 2007. Her family has a traditional profession of making rice crepes, and so she has been investing her prior loans in buying supplies for their business of crepes production. Presently, with income of 183 USD per month, this business is their family's main source of income. For this loan, she wishes to borrow 550 USD to buy 2 tons of rice to reserve for making crepes

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Godspower

texts.en: Godspower C. is 37 years old and married with 2 children. He owns a phone booth where he makes phone calls. His wife is a hair stylist. He hopes for the loan amount of $350 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. Godspower says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty N. is 24 years old. She is married and the mother of two children, one of whom is in school. She has been a local manufacturer of palm oil and palm kernel for five years. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits, and the palm kernel is a by-product of palm oil, which is produced first. The palm kernel is processed through various stages to obtain the palm kernel oil. 

Gifty produces and supplies her product to food vendors, who use it to prepare their meals. She even treks to the villages to purchase the finished goods when demand is very high. She wants to use the loan to buy more palm nuts, and gallon containers to store the oil, so she can increase her efficiency and produce in larger quantities. 

Fortunately, the government of Ghana has provided the community with a machine that most women use to manufacture the oil in bulk, saving them from using antiquated methods of getting the oil. She believes this will help her to expand her business, and to raise more income to support her husband, to provide food for her family, and to finance her children’s education. 

Gifty belongs to the community trust group called "Nyame Nhyira," which means "God's Blessing," and her picture was taking during their group meeting. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: Gifty wants the loan to buy more bags of palm nuts

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four people led by Mrs. S., who was born in 1962 and has been making brooms for more than two years from her home. Daily, she normally makes about 10 or 15 brooms which she sells to villagers and the market seller.

She is the mother of four children, two of whom are employed; all are single. Her husband, Nary, 50, is a local fisherman who currently catches fish from Tunle Sap Lake and sells them at the market. His ability to catch fish has recently been compromised due to aging equipment, so Mrs. S. is requesting a loan to buy more fishing tools.

The other three borrowers are: P., a fisherman who needs a loan to buy nets and traps; P., a fisherwoman who is requesting a loan to purchase fishing tools; R., a fisherwoman who is requesting a loan to buy additional fishing equipment. The borrowers all live in Chong Kneas Commune in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy more fishing equipment.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: María Auxiliadora S. Calderón tiene 47 años, está soltera, y tiene tres hijos. La actividad económica de Doña María es la venta de mercadería en general, y la ubicación de su negocio está en el  mercado municipal. Doña María empezó con este negocio hace tres anos, y poco a poco, ella le convirtió un negocio de perfumes, cremas, y otros productos del hogar a un negocio de ropa y calzado. En este sentido, sus propósitos son de ampliar su negocio para comprar otros lugares en donde pueda vender sus productos. Doña María lleva solicitando tres créditos con Fundación León 2000 y estos han sido de ayuda para la inversión de su negocio. Con el financiamiento de Kiva, destinado Doña María invertir en un amplio inventario de ropa, calzado y pequeños electrodomésticos. El monto que solicita es de C$ 14.500 a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora S. Calderón is 47 years, single, and has three children. María sells general merchandise, and her business is located in the municipal market. María began this business three years ago, and little by little, she converted her business from one selling perfumes, creams, and other home products into a business selling clothing and shoes. She proposes expanding her business to buy other places where she can sell her products. María has had three loans from Fundación León 2000 and these have been a help investing in her business. With Kiva’s financing, María will invest in an ample inventory of clothing, shoes and small electrical appliances. She is seeking C$ 14.500 which will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.en:
For the past 4 years, Zarrina has sold children’s clothing. She is a married mother of four children. She is determined to provide a better living for her entire family. Zarrina is hard-working and kind, giving her the ideal blend of entrepreneurial determination and service. Skilled in trade and abounding in character, Zarrina has a strong business base. Currently, she is seeking a loan of 1000 USD to purchase a new vending facility and expand her business. With the increased income, Zarrina plans to continue growing her business and to improve the financial situation of her family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing her working capital with the purpose of business development

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en:
Chorn M. was born in 1950, and he lives in Krang Roung village, in Takeo province. He is a teacher in the local school. His wife, Ung Sovan, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice.

The couple has a child who is a motorbike repairer. Even though Chorn’s family members have different careers, they still earn less income than needed to provide a better house for their family.

Chorn decided to ask for a loan to add to his savings to buy sand, cement, and the other construction supplies to build a house for his family. His wife is shown in the picture with him.

loans.use: Buy supplies to build a house for his family.

loans.name: Victoria Pascuala

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Ayni que significa Ayuda en Quechua.
Victoria es separada,  tiene 43 años y 3 hijas, Victoria tiene un restaurante polleria en la ciudad de Pichary que se ubica a 8 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de 5 personas. Además Victoria tiene carros con los cuales realiza transporte interprovincial.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de bebidas y carne.
Victoria sueña con comprar otro carro mas y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Ayni Community Bank. Ayni means “help” in Quechua. She is 43 years old, separated, and has 3 daughters. Victoria has a chicken restaurant with 5 employees in Pichary city, located 8 hours from the city of Ayacucho. She also owns vehicles which she uses for long-distance transportation. Victoria needs a loan for 3000 soles that she will invest in drinks and meat. She hopes to buy another car and dreams of seeing her children finish school and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: drinks and meat

loans.name: Elie

texts.en: Elie is twenty-nine years old and married with one child. He lives in Hauch A. Oumara in Zahle. He started working with his father eight years ago to become the electrician he is now. Elie is requesting a loan to purchase a new toolkit so he can work more efficiently.

loans.use: To purchase a new toolkit.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, or “Josie” as she is commonly known, is a resident of Barangay Inaban, Dupax del Norte of Nueva Vizacaya. She is the industrious wife of Ricardo Villoria. The couple aims to improve their standard of living and support the studies of their three children, especially now that they are about to enter college. They want them to finish their studies in college so that someday they will find good jobs.

Josie keeps on developing her general store as best she can, while her husband patiently cultivates their farm. Josie also sells vegetables. Since she is lacking working capital, she is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to further develop her business and maintain a hog-raising business. She is hoping that with the financial support of lenders, she will increase her daily income to help her husband even more with their daily expenses and contribute to the education of their children.

loans.use: To invest in a store

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora María de Jesús vive con sus 2 hijos, ella es divorciada, y por sus hijos recibe una muy gratificante pensión alimenticia, motivo por el ella no trabaja ya que solo se dedica al hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos. 
Tiene el proyecto de realizarle unas mejoras en el techo de la casa que le heredo su abuelito, y esto es para lo que la señora esta tramitando el rédito.
texts.en:
Señora María de Jesús lives with her two children. She is divorced and she receives very generous family support income for the children. That's why she doesn't work now that she is single and devotes herself to her home and caring for her children. She has a plan for making some improvements to the roof of her house which she inherited from her grandfather, which is why she is arranging for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the roof of her residence.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia M. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 53 years old. Lilia is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Lilia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from this activity.

In 2008, Lilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Lilia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Lilia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Охунова Рано занимается продажей детской одежды. Она торгует на вещевом рынке, находящимся в районе Пачшанбе города Худжанда. Каждую неделю она ездит за товаром в город Истаравшан. Рано в период кредитования расширила свой ассортимент товара и тем самым привлекла много клиентов. На следующий займ она хочет приобрести подростковые футболки и шорты.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Rano O. sells children's clothing. She sells on the clothing market which is located in the Panschabe region in the town of Khujand. Every week she goes for merchandise to the town of Istaravshan. Rano has increased the assortment of her inventory during her credit history and by this has attracted many customers. Her next loan she will use to buy t-shirts and shorts for teenagers.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy t-shirts and shorts

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is married to Reynaldo B.. The couple works very hard for their family and especially for their children. They want them to live a progressive, comfortable, and happy life by giving them the best education and hoping that they can have a successful life in the future. They live in the rural barangay of Inaban in Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. 

To earn an income, the couple is patiently cultivates their farm by planting rice and vegetables. Aside from helping her husband in their farming business, Juliet also buys and sells vegetables in the nearby villages for additional income.  Juliet hopes to borrow a loan of PHP 7,000.00 from Kiva lenders for their rice farming businessand eventually to improve her vegetable business. She hopes that their business will become productive and fruitful for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
Don Angel tiene 50 años de edad, el se dedica a la venta de productos plasticos como ser pailas, baldes, papeleras, canastas tortilleras, ganchos para ropa, rayadores, pascones etc.
tiene varios años de vender su producto en un mercado de la ciudad de comayaguela, los dias que vende es de lunes a sabado. desde muy temprano se levanta para ir a su negocio.
el vive con su esposa y su hija de 8 años, su hija esta en la escuela cursando el 2 grado de educacion primaria.
su esposa lo apoy a a vender el producto cuando es temporada alta.
a don Angel desde niño le han gustado las ventas, el necesita el credito para surtir mas su negocio y asi obtener mejores utilidades.
texts.en:
Don Angel is 50 years old and sells plastic products such as basins, buckets, wastebaskets, hampers, clothes hangers, storage containers, etc. He has been selling these products for several years from a market in the city of Comayaguela. His business is open Monday through Saturday. He wakes up early in the morning so that he can leave for work.

He lives with his wife and 8 year old daughter, who is a 2nd grade student. His wife helps him sell products during the tourist season. Since he was a young man, Don Angel has enjoyed sales. He is requesting a loan to restock his business so that he can generate higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock his business

loans.name: God Gift #1 Group

texts.en:
God Gift #1, led by Maijai S., is a group of five borrowers living in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia.

Maijai is 31 years old and is single with three children, age 7 to 13, all of whom are in school. Maijai was unable to attend school because, although she enjoyed it, the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide, and therefore school was considered unnecessary. She lives in remote city of Kolahu in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia.

Maijai’s business is retail clothing, including slippers, shirts, pants, underwear, etc., which she buys wholesale from nearby Guinea and sells in a temporary market stall on the Kolahu-Foya highway. She has run her business for three years and is successful because of her business and financial skills.

Maijai is taking the loan to increase her inventory of clothing which sells well in the rainy season. Her dream is to grow her business so she can one day have the biggest table in the central market. With the profits from her business Maijai dreams of building her own house.

loans.use: To purchase slippers, pants, and shirts for her inventory

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thy Y., 41, replaced by her husband and daughter in the photo, has been married since 1980 and has six children: four sons and two daughters. One of them is married but lives in the family home. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn City.
 
Thy has been selling flowers since she was young, a skill she leaned from her mother. She buys them from her villagers for resale at Central market located in Phnom Penh. She is able to earn a profit of 70,000 riel (perhaps $17.50) per week. Her husband, Mr. An Some, 43, has been a blacksmith for 28 years. He works in Phnom Penh. 

Thy is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Kosal Iv’S Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kosal I. (on the right of the picture) was selected to be a group leader for a loan from Maxima. In the group are two families including her. All the group's members are living on an island in Mekong River approximately 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

1-Mrs. Kosal I., 47, is widow with two sons. One of her sons is an electrician and another one weaves silk at home. She is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

2-Mrs. Sok-heng P., 19, is a silk weaver, has been married Mr. Yeun Yun, 28, is a silk weaver since 2008. The young couple has no children yet. Sok-heng is also requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Redelma

texts.en: Redelma S. is from the village of Catibac, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old, is married, and has school-aged children. Redelma owns and operates a variety store, selling finger food products, refreshments and other daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Redelma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta has been involved in a hog-raising business for almost seven years. She says she already sold two hogs thus only one hog is left. She is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 as her capital in purchasing piglets to raise and a supply of hog feed for their food. She wants to access her requested loan to pursue her business again. She uses her income for the needs of their family. She hopes that her business will again be supported by generous KIVA lenders for the welfare of her family.

Marietta is 39 years old and married to Rizaldy, a classifier of rice and corn grain. They are blessed with two children namely; Raymart, 17 years old, a first year college student, and Jennifer, 12, a first year high school student. The family resides near the barangay (township) hall in the village of Calaocan, Cabatuan.

loans.use: hog feed and a pig to raise

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Al señor Juan José S. tiene poco tiempo que le adquirió su vivienda por medio de un crédito gubernamental, con ahorros que tenia le pudo hacer algunas mejoras pero le está haciendo falta el vitropiso en toda la casa. 
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el vitropiso y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de colocarlo. 
Don Juan José es empleado de una compañía de trasportes en el departamento de descargas de la mercancía de los camiones, con una parte de este ingreso planea pagar el crédito.
Ya que sesea que su pequeño hijo tenga un mejor lugar donde vivir.
texts.en:
Not long ago, Juan José S. was able to buy his home by way of a government loan. He was able to use savings to make some improvements, but is still missing tile flooring throughout the entire house. He is requesting a loan so he can buy the flooring and pay an installer. Juan José is an employee at a transportation company, working in the area in charge of unloading the trucks. He plans to use part of his income from this job to repay the loan. His goal is to provide his young son with a better place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase and install flooring in his house.

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Shoe-making is a trade that requires much hard work and dedication because one needs to have a vast amount of experience to make shoes in all types, styles and sizes for both genders. 

In the city of Gaza, Islam makes shoes for a living. He needs this loan to purchase raw materials used in the manufacture of shoes.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials used in the manufacture of shoes

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is the owner of a grocery store in Gaza, Palestine. He is 33 years old and single. He lives with his parents and helps pay for his three younger siblings' education. Mohammed is well known in the area. But his main handicap remains the lack of working capitA. to supply his store with food items and other goods to satisfy his customers. Having the capitA. would enable him to increase his income and to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To supply his shop with grocery items

loans.name: Nuevo Oriente Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nuevo Oriente está integrado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras que han laborado desde muy jóvenes. Una de ellas es Rosa Virginia F. quien se dedica a hacer sartenes con la ayuda de su esposo y un nieto que vive con ellos.

Por su parte Ángela S. vende dulces, chiverías y tortillas, Ana Paulina C. vende cosméticos y Elivee Torrez M. vende perfumes de la Avon y prendas de oro laminado de la graco.
texts.en:
The "Nuevo Oriente" group is made up of four, hard-working, women who have worked from a very young age. One of them is Rosa Virginia F., who manufactures frying pans with her husband's help and the help of her grandson, who lives with them. Ángela S., on the other hand, sells candies, tortillas and yoghurt snacks. Elivee Torrez M. sells Avon products and Graco gold-plated jewelry items.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy metal.

loans.name: Yanaturo Alto (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Yanaturo Alto esta ubicado al oeste de la ciudad de Cuenca  a unos15 minutos fuera de la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, sus habitantes se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, crianza de animales, existen fábricas de velas, sombreros etc., nuestras socias se dedican a diferentes actividades las cuales les han permitido salir adelante e ir buscando días mejores para sus familias.

Esperanza S. vive en la comunidad de Yanaturo bajo con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, su esposo trabaja como mecánico industrial en su propio taller, no tienen casa propia por lo que se encuentra viviendo en casa de su hermana.

Esperanza tiene 32 años y  se dedica a la elaboración de ropa deportiva de mujer, hace dos años,  ya que antes trabajaba en una fábrica de jeans luego que salió de allí estudió en una academia de corte y confección para montar su propio taller, trabaja bajo su propio horario ya que cuando no tiene tiempo en el día trabaja en la noche.

Se encuentra en su segundo ciclo y fue motivada por su amiga María José una socia del banco comunal, los préstamos recibidos los ha invertido en su negocio y con el  nuevo credito que reciba de la institución  va a adquirir telas de varios colores, hilos, cierres y más acabados para sus confecciones de esta  manera tener un mayor surtido para sus clientes.

Su sueño es llegar a comprarse un carro y una casa.

La señora María Jiménez  es otra de las socias nuevas  de  éste banco, este es su primer crédito y espera mejorar su situación económica de su hogar,  fue invitada por su amiga Angelita I. integrante antigua del banco comunal.

Ella tiene 35 años, vive con sus cuatro hermosos hijos de  17, 15, 12, 10 años, su esposo viajo hace 9 a los Estados Unidos para darles un mejor futuro a su familia y es quien aporta económicamente a su hogar  logrando  construir su casa propia.

Con el préstamo que reciba de la fundación va  a invertir la terminación de su casa ya que aun le falta closets, baldosas en los pìsos, etc,  su mayor sueño es que regrese su esposo.
texts.en:
The Yanaturo Alto Communal Bank is located to the west of the city of Cuenca, which is 15 minutes outside the city of Cuenca. Its inhabitants mostly work in agriculture and raising animals. There are some factories that make candles and hats, etc. Our members work at different activities that have allowed them to get ahead and look for better days for their families. Esperanza S. lives in the Yanaturo Bajo community with her husband and their four children. Her husband works as an industrial mechanic in his own shop. They do not have their own house; they live in her sister’s house. Esperanza is 32, and for two years she has been making women’s sportswear. Previously, she worked in a jeans factory. Then she left there and studied in a seamstress academy to establish her own workshop. She works on her own schedule. When she does not have time during the day she works at night. She is in her second cycle. She was motivated by her friend, María José, a member of the communal bank. She has invested the loans she has received in her business. With the new loan that she will receive from the institution she will get various colors of fabric, needles, zippers, and more finishings for her creations. This way she will have a better inventory for her customers. Her dream is to buy a car and a house. María Jiménez is another new member in this bank. This is her first loan, and she hopes to improve the economic condition of her household. She was invited by her friend, Angelita I., who has been a member of the communal bank for a long time. She is 35, and she lives with her four lovely children. They are 17, 15, 12, and 10. He husband traveled to the United States nine years ago to give his family a better future. He contributes economically to the household, and they were able to build their own house. With this loan from the foundation she will invest in finishing her house. It still needs closets and tiles on the floors, etc. Her biggest dream is for her husband to return.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, needles, zippers, etc. tiles and closets

loans.name: Rorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Rorn K. is 55 years old, married and lives in Thnuoh village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Chin Mao are farmers who own a piece of land to cultivate rice. Although, they work hard with in the fields they earn a very low income with which they support their family. Thus, Mrs. Rorn K. began a new business is grocery seller. In order to support this business, she is requesting a loan of 1,600,000 Riel from AMK to buy groceries to support this  business. With this loan she hopes to increase her income and improve the family living. 

Mrs. Rorn K. is a mother of six children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory and another one in construction. The other children are at home and supported by their parents. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy groceries for resale

loans.name: Sausales De Rio Seco Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “Sausales de Rio Seco” está conformada a partir de la iniciativa de una mesa directiva activa: la señora Teresa, Sonia y Maria Juana, son 8 integrantes en la asociación, 7 mujeres y 1 varon.

Los negocios que llevan adelante son:  venta de cosméticos, venta de flores, compra – venta de polleras, venta de ropa y mercadería de acuerdo a la época.

La presidenta María Juana Q., de 35 años de edad, casada con un solo hijo,  se dedica a la venta de frazadas en la feria de la Zona 16 de Julio.  La Feria de la Zona 16 de Julio es la más grande de la ciudad de El Alto, se extiende por todas las calles y avenidas de la zona, los dìas jueves y domingo, desde muy temprano en mañana hasta el atardecer. 
Las Frazadas y flores plásticas que vende la señora María Juana Q. son compradas por ella en el 
departamento de Oruro, en los últimos tres meses está viajando a chile.
texts.en:
The communal association, "Sausales de Rio Seco," started from an active managing committee composed of three women: Teresa, Sonia, and Maria Juana. There are 8 members in the association: 7 women and 1 man. They conduct the following businesses: the sale of cosmetics, the sale of flowers, the purchase and sale of skirts, the sale of clothing and other seasonal products. The president, Maria Juana Q., whom is 35 years old and married with one son, sells blankets at the Zona 16 de julio Fair. The Zona 16 de julio Fair is the largest of its kind in the city of El Alto. It extends down all of the streets and avenues of the area on Thursdays and Sundays, from really early in the morning until sunset. Maria Juana Q. buys the blankets and plastic flowers that she sells from the city of Oruro. She has been traveling to Chile these past three months.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Blankets and plastic flowers.

loans.name: Jenny Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra.: Jenny del Socorro R. C., actualmente se desempeña como profesora de secundaria, también cuenta con un taxi que maneja un cadete en la capital lo cual le genera otras fuentes de ingresos este crédito lo solicito para la compra de materiales de construcción para terminar un cuarto y cambiar algunas laminas del techo ya que se acerca la temporada de lluvias y no quiere seguirse
texts.en:
Señora Jenny del Socorro R. C. currently works as a teacher at a secondary school. She also has a taxi that a driver drives in the capital, which generates another source of income for her. She is requesting this credit to buy construction materials to finish a room in her house. She will also replace some metal sheets on her roof because the rainy season is approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement, gravel, and sand.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine E. is from the village of Dullan. She is 52 years old. Josephine is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a fish-vending business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling ocean fish caught by her husband. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2000, Josephine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC, a Kiva partner. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. This will be the 15th loan taken out by Josephine from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets

loans.name: Adela

texts.en: Mrs. Adela C. is from Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 50 years old and a widow with four children. To make a living, she operates a restaurant also known as a carenderia. She has operated her business for more than three years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos a month. Her main source of income comes primarily from her business. She joined PMPC to gain access to financial support, to help improve her living situation and to engage in other business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 6,000 PHP taken from PMPC, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to expand her business. This new loan of 10,000 PHP taken from PMPC is for additional capital and also to expand her business. This will be the fifth loan cycle for Adela. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses opened his retail business seven months ago.  He sells dry foods in small quantities in an open air shed.  They include cereals such as beans, sugar, flour and salt.  He also sells a small amount of fruit.  He is 25 years-old, married to Faith Odhiambo and they have three school going children.

Moses was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by a friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to buy more products in bulk which he will sell in small quantities to his customers. The products include maize, beans, flour and sugar.

In the near future, he plans to move into a more permanent structure.

loans.use: To buy food to resell.

loans.name: Líderes De Pepin Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal los Líderes de Pepin está ubicado en la comunidad de Yananaco, provincia de Huancavelica, departamento de Huancavelica, inicia su segundo ciclo con 10 socias.
Gladys pertenece a la Junta Directiva del bancomunal, su cargo en este ciclo es de fiscal, es casada, tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 18 años de edad que estudian en la escuela de la comunidad. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general como arroz, azúcar y alimentos de primera necesidad, le gusta tener mercadería surtida en su tienda, los préstamos que recibe los invierte siempre en su negocio. 
Gladys asiste a sus reuniones de bancomunal porque le gusta las capacitaciones y compartir momentos de alegría y tristezas con sus compañeras, es su segundo hogar según nos manifiesta, ha aprendido a ahorrar.
Con el préstamo que ha solicitado comprará frutas de la estación para implementar en su negocio. El sueño de Gladys es que sus hijos tengan una profesión, actualmente con su negocio les apoya en sus estudios, quiere hacer crecer más su tienda y así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Los Líderes de Pepin Communal Bank is located in the Yananaco community in the Huancavelica province, Huancavelica department. They are starting their second cycle with ten members. Gladys belongs to the Governing Board of the communal bank. Her office this cycle is finance advisor. She is married and has two children; 11 and 18 years old. The children go to the community school. She sells general groceries like rice, sugar, and basic needs foods. She likes to have her merchandise stocked in her stO.. She always uses the loans she receives for her business. Gladys attends the communal bank meetings because she likes the trainings. She also likes to share happy and sad moments with her colleagues. According to what she tells us, it is her second home. She has learned to save. She will use the requested loan to buy seasonal fruits for her business. Gladys’s dream is for her children to have a profession. Now, with her business, she can support their education. She wants to make her stO. grow mO. in order to get greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit for her business

loans.name: 8 De Septiembe Group

texts.es: El grupo “8 D. Septiembre” esta representado por Maribel y conformado por 12 miembros 2 varones y 10 mujeres, todos son muy trabajadores y responsables, todos se conocen muy bien ya que residen en la misma zona y confían plenamente en su grupos. El señor Rail que es el secretario del grupo es padre D. familia D. tres niños y es casado el y su esposa se dedican a la crianza D. pollos en su granja la cual fue construida desD. los cimientos por el señor Raúl, el es muy trabajador y es por eso que es el socio destacada del grupo, el requiere del préstamo para poder comprar alimento para sus pollos ya que el capital con el que contaba fue invertida en la adquisición D. alimentadores automáticos y camas para las ponedoras D. huevo, en este caso el se encarga D. la crianza y su esposa D. la venta D. los productos por lo que trabajan muy unidos. El resto D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. cosméticos, comida, abarrotes, ropa, asaditos y refrescos, bebidas y al servicio D. empleo doméstico y albañilería. En cuanto al entorno competitivo las socias afirma que es alta pero que ellas saben como cambiar sus productos a artículos D. mayor demanda o cambian D. lugar D. venta para terminar con sus productos el resto D. los socios que prestan servicios tiene clientela. El préstamo será destinado a la adquisición D. mercadería, insumos, herramientas D. trabajo y para la inversión D. nuevos negocios como es el caso D. la señora Maria Eliane que se dedica al empleo domestico y desea poder tener un ingreso adicional con la venta D. anticuchos en la puesta D. la casa D. su suegra. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias ya cuentan con la misma ya que van cursando un segundo ciclo con la institución demostrando que saben como administrar sus negocios y tendiendo responsabilidad con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
The “8 D. Septiembre” (September 8th) Group is represented by Maribel and maD. up of 12 members, 2 men and 10 women. They are all very hard-working and responsible, they all know each other very well since they live in the same area, and they trust their group members completely. Raúl is the secretary of the group. He is the father of three children and is married. He and his wife raise chickens in their barn, which Raúl built from the ground up. He is very hard-working, and this is why he is the featured group member. He needs the loan to buy feed for his chickens since the capital he had was invested in acquiring automatic feeders and beds for the egg-laying hens. In this case, he is responsible for raising the chickens, and his wife sells the products, so they work together very closely. The other members work selling cosmetics, food, groceries, clothing, barbecued meat, soft drinks and beverages and work in domestic service and masonry. As for the competitive environment, the members agree that competition is high, but they know how to change their products to items in greater demand or change their selling location to sell all their products. The other members who offer services have regular customers. The loan will be used for the acquisition of merchandise, supplies, work tools, and to invest in new businesses as in the case of Maria Eliane, who works in domestic services and wants to have additional income from selling kebabs at a stand at her mother-in-law's house. With regard to loan experience, the members have some since they are now in a second cycle with the institution, showing that they know how to run their businesses and being responsible with their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Ray

texts.en: Mrs. Ray P. is 32 years old and married. In order to help meet her family's needs, Ray P. sells some grocery items, both retail and wholesale, at the local market. She has five years experience in this sector and earns approximately $4 per day. Her husband assists her in operating the business. They have been married for years and have six young children who attend school. Ray P. hopes to enlarge her business and is applying for a US $600 loan to be used to accumulate a larger number of necessary grocery items to sell. With any remaining cash from the loan, she will repair her old house.

loans.use: to accumulate a larger number of necessary grocery items to sell

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim C. is 62 years old and is a villager who lives in Angk Svay Chek village, Takeo province. Mrs. C. and her husband, Mr. Chin Chea (who is shown in the photo with her), own 4.2 hectares (10.5 acres) of land upon which they work hard to cultivate rice. This couple has a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory.

In order to support their farming, Mrs. Sim C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a trailer to transport her harvest.

loans.use: To buy a trailer to transport her harvest

loans.name: Munh-Erdene

texts.en: Munh-Erdene B. is 23 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Arhangai province, central Mongolia. Munh-Erdene operates a retail clothing business which he began in 2008. He has proved to be a very hard-working entrepreneur with a lot of business and customer-service experience. He hopes to expand his business as well as enlarging the house in which the family currently lives. Munh-Erdene is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more clothing for his business from Ereen, a border city of China, and grow his working capital.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua N. is married and has three children. Her husband is a mason. She has acquired a junior high level of education.

Ekua sells smoked fish at Takoradi and uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Ekua will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Luz Veane

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Veane;  La socia  tiene 39 años de edad y tiene 4 hijos, ella  trabaja en su propia imprenta desde hace 12 años y  es madre soltera, la socia sola educa y se hace cargo de todos los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus menores hijos, La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en el capital de la imprenta y comprar papel y tinta para las maquinas y aceites.   

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Luz Veane is a member of the Communal Bank “Unidos Para El Triunfo” (United for Victory), which is located in the district of Huanchac in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 39 years old and has four children. Sra. Luz Veane has managed her own printing business for the past twelve years. Being a single mother, she is solely responsible for all of the household expenses and the education of her young children. Luz Veane is requesting this loan to invest as capital in her printing business. She will buy paper and ink for her machines, as well as oils.

Luz Veane appreciates and values the loan that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase paper, ink, and oils

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar M. has been a rice farmer for 20 years. He is 43 years old from Sto. Niño, Surallah. The previous harvest season has been good to him, and so he is looking forward to a better income this time around. 

He applied for a loan due to limited money at hand. He will use the money for fertilizer, seedlings and land preparation before the planting season. The additional income will go to his aging parents’ needs and his family’s daily needs.

loans.use: farm supplies such as fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia lives in a city called Borewala which is famous for its shrines in Pakistan. She lives in the area of 447-EB with her family. Her house consists of 2 rooms. 

A very caring lady, Nazia stays at home, manages the household chores and takes care of her family.  Her husband's name is S. M.. He  is painter by profession and paints walls and homes. He has a business place in the market where he advertises his services to people and other construction companies. 
 
People and construction companies make contracts with him and he meets their work on time to earn good income.
 
Nazia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount her husband will buy paint boxes of different colors for his painting business.  The paint boxes will enable him to finish the painting work on time and build up his regular customer base. 

Nazia is hopeful that this investment will prove beneficial for her husband’s business and he will be able to grow his business on a larger scale by increasing his clientele base. 

Note: “In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Nazia”.

loans.use: To buy paint boxes for painting business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 52 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo José de 55 años, que es mecánico y de sus jóvenes hijos, juntos trabajan cada día en busca del progreso. Desde hace 5 años, instaló en su casa una tienda de comestibles y con el tiempo ha ido surtiéndola de a poco. En la actualidad ofrece golosinas, comestibles, gaseosas, cervezas y también algunos útiles de escritorio; sin lugar a duda es una de las tiendas mejor abastecidas de la zona, es por esta razón que se siente muy orgullosa de su negocio. Dice que le gusta mucho su trabajo porque le permite obtener buenas ganancias, sin descuidar las labores de su hogar; pero lo que no le gusta es que muchas veces no puede salir muy seguido, pero cuando lo hace sus hijos la apoyan en la atención del negocio. Además manifiesta, con mucha convicción, que para el futuro quiere mejorar las instalaciones de su negocio, pues quiere ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Es el sexto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Rosa tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para surtir mejor su tienda.
texts.en: Rosa, 52, lives in her own home in the company of her husband, José (55, a mechanic), and their young children. They work together each day in search of progress. 5 years ago Rosa installed a grocery store in her home, and little by little over time she stocked it with goods. She offers lollies, groceries, soft drinks, beer, and some stationery items; without doubt it is one of the best stocked shops in the zone. Rosa feels very proud of her business because of this. She says that she really likes working as it allows her to obtain good earnings without neglecting her household work; but what she doesn't like is that often she can't go out. However, when she does, her children help her attend to the business. She affirms with much conviction that in the future she wants to improve her shop fittings so she can offer greater comfort to her customers. This is Rosa's sixth loan with MFP and she promises to punctually make her repayments, as she doesn't want to have a bad relationship with the people that have made possible the money which she uses to continue working in search of progress. Rosa plans to invest the loan in the purchase of a greater quantity of merchandise to better stock her shop.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to stock her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell to his customers

loans.name: Perise

texts.en: Perise M. is currently in the business of selling clothes at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of clothes to sell. Perise is 40 years old. She is Married and her husband is a businessman. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To stock more bags of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Daniel Eduardo

texts.es: Daniel Eduardo A. G. de 26 años de edad, es una persona muy responsable y trabajador, quien reside en el departamento de San Vicente, junto a su esposa y dos hijos de: 8 y 1 año de edad. Daniel trabaja arduamente vendiendo: sabanas, edredones, cortinas, hamacas y otros artículos más para el hogar, los cuales comercializa de forma ambulante por diferentes pueblos, así mismo su esposa le ayuda a vender desde su casa de habitación. Daniel solicita un préstamo, con el enorme deseo de poder invertir en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de productos, de manera que sus ventas puedan incrementarse en gran manera. De esta forma Daniel espera mejorar su economía familiar y contar con una vida mejor.
texts.en:
