Daniel Eduardo A. G. is 26 years of age and is a very responsible and hardworking person. He lives in the department of San Vincente with his wife and two children who are 1 and 8 years of age. Daniel works extremely hard as a street vendor, selling sheets, eiderdowns, curtains, hammocks, and other articles for the home. He sells these articles in different villages, while his wife helps him sell the same items from their home.

Daniel has a great desire to invest in his business, which is why he is requesting a loan to purchase a large quantity of products so as to increase his sales accordingly. In this way Daniel hopes to improve the economic situation of his family. He also hopes to have a better life.

loans.use: Purchase curtains, sheets and other articles to sell

loans.name: Agustina Alexandra

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Américas.
 
En este lugar encontramos a la señora Agustina, ella tiene 37 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 15 – 10 y 7 años, la mayor esta en colegio y los menores están en escuela. Su marido es mecánico. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que ha recibido de parte de la Fundación Espoir.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa,  también tiene un restaurante en la casa de su mamá, trabaja de lunes a sábado,  prepara deliciosos platos y el preferido de sus clientes es el viche de mariscos, además en su restaurante aprovecha  para vender la ropa a la mayoría de sus clientes. Su mercadería la compra en Guayaquil. En su negocio le ayuda su mamá.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, pantalones, camisas, blusas, etc. Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the Las Américas communal bank meets every two weeks.

Here we find Agustina, 37.  She is in a common law relationship and has three children who are 15, 10 and 7 years of age.  The oldest is in secondary school and the younger two are in elementary school.  Her husband is a mechanic.  She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because of the help she’s gotten from Fundación Espoir.

She sells clothes.  She also has a restaurant in her mother’s house.  She works from Monday through Saturday.  She prepares delicious dishes.  Her customers’ favorite is seafood ceviche (marinated seafood cocktail).  Besides, she takes advantage of the restaurant to sell clothes to most of her customers.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil.  Her mother helps her with the business.

This loan is to buy clothes: pants, shirts, blouses, etc.  Her dream is to have a great restaurant.

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, blouses, t-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Theresah

texts.en: Theresah D. is a baker living in Takoradi. She is married and together with the husband they take care of five dependents. Her husband is a fisherman.  Theresah uses her income to assist her husband to educate, feed and clothe their children.  She will use the loan to buy more ingredients to be able to bake in larger quantity for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Theresah plans to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to bake large quantities for sale

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es:
María Esther es una madre de familia de 37 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el sector El Sandial, una centro poblado rural del distrito de Pítipo, un distrito agrícola de la provincia de Ferreñafe, se encuentra ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza de animales menores desde hace cuatro años en su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y a los negociantes que siempre visitan el lugar en donde vive. Ella alimenta a sus animales con alimento concentrado y forraje, el cual es sembrado por su esposo de este modo garantizan el rápido crecimiento de sus animales, lo que les permite comercializarlos de mejor manera y percibir mayores ganancias.

María Esther empezó vendiendo animales menores y actualmente, con las ganancias de su negocio y con el apoyo brindado por un préstamo Capital Semilla financiado por Kiva, pudo adquirir dos cabezas de ganado vacuno, de las cuales comercializa la leche que produce con un acopiador de la zona. Actualmente ella desea seguir creciendo como empresaria adquiriedo otra vaca, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los que espera lograr su objetivo.

María Esther se encuentra muy agradecida con las personas que colaboraron con ella a través del fondo Kiva. Gracias al préstamo en aquella oportunidad ella pudo sacar adelante su negocio e implementarlo un poco más.
texts.en:
María Esther is a 37 year-old mother who lives with her huband and child in El Sandial, a small, rural village in Pítipo district.  Pítipo district is an agricultural district in Ferreñafe province, one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.

María Esther has been raising animals at home for four years.  When they have reached a good level of development, she offers them for sale to her neighbors and the traders who always visit her area.  She feeds her animals with concentrated animal feed and fodder which her husband grows.  In this way, she guarantees the rapid growth of her animals and is better able to sell them and make more profit.

María Esther started out selling small animals and currently, with the profits from her business and the support offered her by a seed money loan financed by Kiva, she was able to acquire two heads of cattle whose milk she sells to a trader in the area.  She would currently like to continue growing as a businesswoman, acquiring another cow.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa with which she hopes to achieve her goal.

María Esther is very grateful to the people who work together with her through Kiva.  Thanks to her last loan, she was able to get ahead in her business and make a little more progress in it.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Edeliza

texts.en:
Edeliza T., 48 years old, is a resident of Malibay, Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Eduardo T. and are blessed with three children who are currently go to high school and college.

Edeliza operates a rug-making business having her husband as business partner. She primarily sells doormats but she also sells rugs, towels, braided quilts, bed sheets, and other crafts. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a Php20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional raw materials, such as fabric, thread, and newspapers for patterns. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Edeliza dreams of giving her children a good education through her hard work at her business. She always prays for good health and able to enjoy life to the fullest along with her family.  As CCT community partner, she faithfully attends to their weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups meet each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: Purchase materials needed for rug-making

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Redecorate the shop, buy an air conditioner and increase inventory

loans.name: Las Marías Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Las Marías, se conformó el 10 de junio del 2.008, gracias a que la presidenta del grupo, la Sra. Mary B., ya participó del programa en otro grupo anteriormente, y decidió formar su propio grupo.
La misma contactó con la asesora y logró  juntar a 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 8° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria.
L sra. Mary se dedica a la venta de leche, posee dos vaquitas y con ellas trata de sustentar a su humilde familia, por ello desea un crédito con el que pueda comprar otra vaca y aumentar sus ingresos y sacar a su familia de la pobreza.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común.
Participan activamente en las reuniones semanales y tienen un trabajo solidario impecable.
texts.en:
The “Las Marías” women’s committee was formed on June 10, 2008 thanks to the group’s President, Mrs. Mary B., who had participated previously in another group and decided to start her own.  She herself contacted the adviser and managed to get 17 women together who are now comfortably working in their 8th cycle in a unified and mutually supportive way.

Mary sells milk.  She has two little cows with which she tries to support her humble family.  This is why she needs a loan to buy another cow to increase income and move her family out of poverty.

All of them undertake activities to generate income; they help each other mutually to reach common objectives.  They participate actively in weekly meetings and they have an impeccable mutually supportive work.

loans.use: To buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more chicks.

loans.name: Doeuk

texts.en: Doeuk is a married woman born in 1976. She and her husband, Leng are construction formers. Now they face some problems, because they do not have enough construction supplies to support it. Thus, Doeuk would like to ask for a loan to purchase construction supplies to support her business activities. This couple is working hard with their business to support their six children: three are attending in the local schools and the others are not in school yet. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe tiene 38 años de edad, ella esta casada con el señor José Juan el cual es empleado y tienen 2 niños de nombres Marina la cual estudia la secundaria y Juan estudiante de primaria. Doña Lupita como es conocida en su población se dedica a vender ropa interior por catalogo y también vende colchas, ella tiene con este negocio hace 3 años aproximadamente y dice que lo emprendió para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Ella vende y ofrece su ropa interior y colchas en las casa y a sus conocidas y dice que las surte en la población de Zitacuaro, ella las vende en pagos como para que se les haga a sus clientas mas fáciles de comprar.
texts.en: Guadalupe is 38 years old and is married to Señor José Juan, who is employed.  They have 2 children, Marina, who is in high school, and Juan, who is an elementary school student.  Doña Lupita, as she is known in her area, sells undergarments by catalog as well as bedspreads.  She has had this business for about 3 years and says that she started it to help her husband with the household expenses.  She sells her undergarments and bedspreads from home in the town of Zitacuaro to people she knows. She sets up payment plans for her customers in order to make it easier for them to buy.

loans.use: to purchase women's undergarments for her business.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda es una mujer soltera de 41 años, tiene casa propia con servicio sólo de agua, ubicada en el acentamiento humano (comunidad donde viven pocas personas porque recien se está formando) 9 de febrero a unos 15 minutos del distrito de Morrope y a una hora aproximadamente de la provincia de Chiclayo.  Este distrito tiene como actividad  principal la agricultura, ganadería y festividades religiosas muy bonitas .
Hilda se dedica a la crianza de animales  (gallinas, pavos y chanchos), su corral donde viven sus animales se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con maíz molido, polvillo de arroz y purina.  Posteriormente vende sus animales una vez que hayan llegado a su desarrollo óptimo para poder venderlo en los diferentes mercados de la provincia de Chiclayo para poder incrementar sus ingresos y obtener cosas que le hacen falta en su casa.
El crédito que ha solicitado Hilda es de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme  Alternativa, será destinado  para la compra animales y su respectivos  alimentos, con la finalidad de que sus animales engorden y pueda venderlo a buen precio para poder pagar su préstamo y al mismo tiempo esos ingresos le ayuden a mejorar su calidad de vida.
Hilda es una mujer que siempre ante los retos que le ha puesto la vida, siempre ha sabido salir adelante para mejorar en la vida.
texts.en:
Hilda, 41, is single.  She has a house of her own.  It’s only utility is water.  It’s located in the Asentamiento Humano 9 de Febrero (a community with few residents because it’s barely being formed) located about 15 minutes from Mórrope District approximately an hour from Chiclayo Province.  This district’s main activities are farming, cattle raising and very beautiful religious festivals.

Hilda raises animals (chickens, turkeys and pigs).  The corral where her animals live is located outside her house.  She feeds them ground corn, rice powder and Purina.  She then sells her animals, once they each optimal development, at the various markets in Chiclayo province to increase income and obtain things she needs for her home.

She asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy animals and their respective feed with the goal of fattening up her animals so that she can sell them for good prices and be able to repay her loan while at the same time using this income to improve her quality of life.

Hilda is a woman who has always knows how to overcome life’s challenges; she’s always known how to get ahead to improve in life.

loans.use: to buy more animals and their respective feed.

loans.name: Living

texts.en:
Living is a 27-year-old married man with three children. He rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been charging batteries for two years. He started with 600,000 shillings and now has 2,000,000 shillings. His vision is to have an electronics shop plus an educated family. Living intends to use the credit to buy a photocopier.

loans.use: To buy a photocopier.

loans.name: Veronica Roxana

texts.es:
Verónica, vive con su esposo y un hijo, ella tiene un ciber y también venD. productos varios, tiene cuatro años D. estar al frente del negocio, ella es una profesional en computación, por lo que se le hizo fácil montar el negocio.
Ella solicita un préstamo para actualizar y dar mantenimiento a las maquinas, ya que con este proceso estará mejorando el rendimiento y el servicio del ciber.
Su objetivo es mantenerse en el negocio, poco a poco ir aumentado el número D. computadoras y D. igual manera mejorar los ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Verónica lives with her husband and son.  She owns an Internet cafe and also sells a variety of products.  She has been running her business for four years.  Verónica is an IT professional and so she found it easy to set up her business.

Verónica is requesting a loan to upgraD. and have maintenance work done on her machines since this will help improve their performance and thereby the service she provides in her Internet cafe.

Verónica's goal is to keep running her business and gradually increase her number of computers.  She also hopes to improve her family income.

loans.use: to have maintenance work carried out on her machines

loans.name: Angel Brady

texts.es:
Ángel de 30 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de sus abuelos; cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Chepén que pertenece al departamento de la Libertad.  Los pobladores de ésta zona se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Ángel  se dedica a manejar su mototaxi (transporte utilizado por las personas en rutas pequeñas), movilizando pasajeros a los diferentes caseríos de la zona, cuenta con su propia clientela e incluso lo contratan para llevar a niños en edad escolar por lo mismo que vive en el mismo lugar, ésto le permite tener mayores ingresos para poder ayudar  a solventar sus gastos personales.

El crédito que a solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1000 nuevos soles y su destino será para brindar mantenimiento a su unidad móvil, para tenerla en buen estado y pueda seguir brindando un buen servicio, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.   Ángel es una persona trabajadora y empeñosa, que con esfuerzo desea salir  adelante y superarse.
texts.en:
Ángel de 30 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de sus abuelos; cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Chepén que pertenece al departamento de la Libertad.  Los pobladores de ésta zona se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Ángel  se dedica a manejar su mototaxi (transporte utilizado por las personas en rutas pequeñas), movilizando pasajeros a los diferentes caseríos de la zona, cuenta con su propia clientela e incluso lo contratan para llevar a niños en edad escolar por lo mismo que vive en el mismo lugar, ésto le permite tener mayores ingresos para poder ayudar  a solventar sus gastos personales.

El crédito que a solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1000 nuevos soles y su destino será para brindar mantenimiento a su unidad móvil, para tenerla en buen estado y pueda seguir brindando un buen servicio, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.   Ángel es una persona trabajadora y empeñosa, que con esfuerzo desea salir  adelante y superarse.

loans.use: Mantenimiento de su mototaxi

loans.name: Abegail

texts.en:
Abegail works hard to support her family. Abegail is married and has an "abaca"-making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her abaca-making business.

Abegail has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Abegail would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her "abaca" (natural fiber) making business.

loans.name: Angela Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Angela Rosa es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien con $20 dólares inicio su pequeña venta. En un inicio solo comercializaba meneítos, cajeta, bombones…etc. luego poco a poco la fue levantando surtiéndola con más productos como huevo, fósforos, papel higiénico, azúcar, arroz…etc.
El crédito invertirá en reforzamiento del negocio con la compra de nuevos productos para surtir más la venta.
texts.en:
Angela Rosa is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who started her small sales business with just $20.  At first she only sold Meneítos (snack food), 'cajeta' (dulce de leche), candies, etc.  However, she gradually increased her business, stocking it with more products such as eggs, matches, toilet paper, sugar, rice, etc.

Angela Rosa will invest her loan in strengthening her business by purchasing new products to further stock her store.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, snacks, soda, etc.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia, age 51, operates a "sari sari store" (a common name for variety stores in barrios). She retails different kinds of grocery items in her store, such as spices, bottled goods, and canned items. She has been running her store for 15 years now, which has allowed her to help her husband, a farmer, to provide for the basic needs of the family. She earns an average of P1,500 net income monthly from her store.

She is requesting a loan of P8,000 to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, canned goods, ingredients, biscuits, and oil to offer for sale. She is confident that the loan will enable her to increase her profits, thereby allowing her to sufficiently meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, canned goods, biscuits, and oil to sell in her store

loans.name: Armine

texts.ru:
Армине 27 лет, она родилась в городе Капан, где окончила среднюю школу, а затем  Ереванский Университет им. Ачаряна, по специальности прикладная математика и информатика. Армине замужем и имеет двух дочерей: старшей 7 лет, а младшей  3 года. Муж Армине работает на Капанской птицефабрике бухгалтером. Сама Армине занимается куплей-продажей  одежды начиная с 2006г. Она арендует помещение, где продает женскую, мужскую и детскую одежду, белье и обувь. Раз в месяц Армине приобретает товары из Еревана для своего бизнеса. Армине работает без выходных и помогает мужу содержать семью. 
Армине требуется кредит на сумму 500.000 драм для покупки сезонной одежды и обуви.
texts.en:
Armine is 27 years old. She was born in the town of Kapan where she graduated from high school, and then she graduated from Yerevan University of Acharyan where she majored in applied mathematics and computer science. Armine is married and has two daughters, a seven-year-old and a three-year-old. Armine's husband works at the Kapan poultry farm as an accountant. Armine has worked buying and selling clothes since 2006. She rents a shop in which she sells women's, men's and children's clothes, underwear and shoes. Once a month, Armine purchases goods from Yerevan for her business. Armine works seven days a week and helps her husband support the family.

Armine needs a loan of 500,000 drams to buy seasonal clothes and shoes.

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothes for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy mobile phones & accessories for resale

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr:
Monsieur Daouda est un homme marié de 42 ans et père de 3 enfants, qui vit dans une famille traditionnelle, avec sa femme, ses enfants  et ses parents à Faraba, des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni.(région de Sikasso)
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école moderne, dès son jeune âge il commença les activités génératrices de revenus, avec l’apprentissage du métier paternel à savoir les activités de fabrication de marmites et autres objets utilitaires auprès de son père dans une forge. Nanti de plus de 20 ans d’expérience dans le domaine, Daouda maîtrise son activité et est  beaucoup sollicité. Ayant fait la connaissance de Soro Yiriwaso à travers un autre client de l’institution, il décida de rejoindre la structure afin de renforcer d’avantage son pouvoir d’achat.
En effet il compte acheter avec son prêt, 50 kg d'aluminium et 20 sacs de charbon  de bois.Il est à son deuxième prêt avec avec Soro Yiriwaso et le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.                                                                                                                                                                              Il s'approvisionne en aluminium à Bougouni et à Bamako (capitale de république du Mali). La vente de sa production se fait au marché de Bougouni et dans les villages environnants les jours de marchés hebdomadaires.  La plus part de ses clients sont des femmes
Il  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et réutilisé dans l’entreprise.
texts.en: Mr. Daouda is a 42-year-old married man with 3 children, who lives in a traditional family with his wife, his children, and his parents in Faraba, neighborhoods in the city of Bougouni (Sikasso region). Having not attended modern school, he has been working for a living since he was young, having trained in his father’s occupation, namely the production of cooking pots and other practical objects with his father in a forge. With more than 20 years of experience under his belt, Daouda has mastered this business and is very much in demand. Having met Soro Yiriwaso through another of their clients, he decided to join the organization in order to increase his buying power. Indeed, he plans to buy with his loan 50 kg of aluminum and 20 bags of charcoal. He is on his second loan with Soro Yiriwaso and the previous loan was repaid. He stocks up on aluminum in Bougouni and in Bamako (capital of the republic of Mali). He sells his merchandise in the Bougouni market and in neighboring villages on weekly market days. Most of his customers are women. He hopes to earn 60,000 FCFA monthly, which will be used to repay the loan and put back into his business.

loans.use: to buy aluminum

loans.name: Omari

texts.en:
Omari is 38 years old and a married father of 3 children, ages between 3 and 24 years old. He is a livestock farmer in Mariakani. His business has been in operation for 5 years and is doing well.

This marks his third borrowing to finance his business. With this loan he plans to purchase more goats. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to expand his business.

Omari's dream is to become a very successful businessman and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more goats

loans.name: Policarpio

texts.es:
El señor Policarpio  vive en una  localidad la que es muy bonita  ya que tiene una iglesia grande  que está en el centro del pueblo, el  vive en unión libre con la señora Dicsi Zenaida y  con quien procreo cuatro hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad.
    Don Poli como le dicen de cariño se dedica a  sembrar milpas, frijol para tener sus ingreso y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la actividad de compra y venta de mantas bordadas para salir a venderlo en otro lugar y está contento  ya que le va bien.
 
    Su motivo a esta actividad fue su familia  para así mejorar cada día sus ingresos  y con un dinerito que  tenía guardado comenzó a comprar mantas y bordaros luego se asocio con sus vecinos y es como  está trabajando  y logrando sacar adelante a su familia.

   Lo que más desea es que con sus ganas de trabajar baya mejorando su negocio y así, continuar con el préstamo que tanto lo está apoyando y con el dinero que baya obteniendo su familia tenga mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Policarpio lives in a very pretty location that has a large church in the center of town.  He lives in a common law relationship with Dicsi Zenaida.  They have four children that are still their responsibility.

Don Poli, as he’s affectionately called, is a corn and bean farmer but to earn more income he requested the loan to buy fabric to embroider and then go sell in another location.  He’s happy because he’s doing well.

His family was what motivated him into this activity, to improve his income daily.  He used a little money he had saved up to start buying fabric to embroider.  Then, he partnered with his neighbors and this is how he’s working and managing to move his family ahead.

What he most desires is that his dedication to work will lead to his business’s improvement and continue with the loan that is so helpful to him and use the money he’ll be earning so that his family will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric to embroider and sell.

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia is married and she's 32 years old with 5 children.

Telesia owns and operates a business venture, selling fish & chips.  She has 1 year of experience in this business.    Telesia needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 220 talas or $92 per week) to improve the business.

In 2011, Telesia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score.""  For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 23-year-old Lebanese singe man living with one parent and three siblings. In 2008, he invested in a children's amusement park. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional leisure games. He notes that these acquirements will help him attract more customers of different ages. In the future, he is planning to add a small space where customers can enjoy quick snacks.

loans.use: buy games of amusement park

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Ceprodel está velando por el desarrollo y mejora del nivel de vida de los maestros nicaragüense, en este caso, Martha Lorena se ha destacado como excelente maestra en el municipio de Telica dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace 23 años.

Como en toda familia, atraviesa dificultades en su vivienda por lo que ha estado en malas condiciones producto de los fenómenos naturales y para ello está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción como, bloque, cemento, hierro, cerámica, tabla, clavadores  y pago de la mano de obra para realizar las mejora en un cuarto de su vivienda que tanto requiere de pronto apoyo.
texts.en:
Ceprodel is looking out for the development and the improvement of the standard of living of Nicaraguan teachers. In this case, Martha Lorena has stood out as an excellent teacher in the Telica Municipality. She had been teaching for 23 years. 

As with every household, she comes across difficulties in her house because it has been in bad condition due to natural events. She is requesting a loan to invest in construction materials such as cinder blocks, cement, iron, ceramic tiling, planks, nail-drivers, and payment for labor to carry out the improvements on a room in her home that badly needs attention soon.

loans.use: purchase construction materials such as cinder blocks, cement, iron, ceramic tiling, planks, nail-drivers, and payment for labor

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a 20-year-old single man. He has been offering taxi services with his motorbike for the last year in Machakos town. 
Philip was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be Philip's first loan. He intends to use the loan amount to top up his savings to buy another motorbike.
In the future, Philip hopes to expand his business and increase the number of motorbikes.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Juana  Aracelly

texts.es: Doña Juana , habitante de la ciudad de León, casada, madre de tres hijos, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y comida. Esta muy feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindo el crédito Kiva ya que lo utilizo para comprar ropa usada e invertir en su negocio de comida, logro vender toda la paca de ropa de usada, sus ganancias fueron muy buenas, le permitió comenzar hacer mejores a su tramo y su hogar. Ella solicita un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en comprar una paca de ropa usada mixta. Ya que se acerca la temporada  navideña donde las ventas son muy buenas y desea tener productos para ofrecer. Su próximos planes acondicionar el tramo para poner comideria al mismo tiempo vender ropa usaday seguir haciendo reparaciones a su casa.
texts.en:
Juana lives in the city of León.  She is married and has three children.  Juana is a saleswoman by trade.  She sells used-clothing, and food.  She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity she was given with her previous Kiva loan as she used it to buy used clothing and invest in her food business.  She managed to sell the whole bundle of used clothing, her profits were very good and they allowed her to start making improvements to her sales location and her home.

Juana is requesting a new loan to invest in buying a bundle of mixed, used clothing.  The Christmas season is approaching and this is when sales are very good.  She would therefore like to have products to offer.  Juana's plans for the near future are to work on her sales location so that she can set up an eatery which she can run at the same time as she sells her used clothing.  She would also like to continue making repairs to her home.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a 58-year-old married woman with with children. 

She has been engaged in farming for six years. Nida primarily grows rice crops to sell. Nida earns 6,000 PHP per month doing this farming. She works hard to support her family financially.

Nida has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Nida hopes to own a bigger farm in the future. For now, she hopes to continue earning and be able to pay her obligations.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Jhim

texts.es: Jhim, de 33 años, es un hombre amable, bueno y trabajador. Convive con su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos de 15, 5 y 3 años. Juntos habitan en su casa propia y comparten el deseo de poder progresar y sobresalir en lo que hacen. Jhim pasa sus días manejando su taxi moto, no importa si es de día o de noche, él sigue recorriendo las calles en busca de clientes que deseen llegar sanos y seguros a su destino. Su animo es alegre y sus dotes de conversador hacen que los clientes lo busquen para que le haga el servicio. Además que conoce muy bien las calles de la ciudad de Pucallpa y siempre brinda un servicio rápido. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es pasear por las calles, además que el trabajo le brinda buenas ganancias y se distrae mucho, aparte de trabajar como mototaxista también trabaja como agente de ventas de una conocida distribuidor de gas de la ciudad. Lleva 6 años realizando este trabajo y aunque es un poco pesado sabe que tiene que realizarlo. Espera más adelante comprar otro mototaxi y hacerlo trabajar para mejor sus ingresos. Este será el crédito número 4 con MFP, esta muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete en seguir siendo un cliente puntual y pagar sus cuotas tal como le programen. Esta muy contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará repuestos para su mototaxi que necesita refaccionar ya que por el mal estado de las pistas se deterioro, además pagará al mecánico que le hará el trabajo.
texts.en:
Jhim is 33 years old, and a kind, good, and hard-working man. He lives with his partner and together, they have three children who are 15, 5, and 3 years old. They all live in their own home and share the desire to progress and get ahead through what they do. Jhim spends his days driving his moto-taxi. It does not matter if it is day or night, he keeps on riding along the streets looking for customers who want to arrive safe and sound to their destinations. His happy spirit and conversational gifts make it so the customers look for him to provide transportation service. He also knows the Puccallpa city streets very well and always provides fast service.

His favorite part of his job is traveling the streets, and he also likes that this job provides a good income and is good entertainment. In addition to working as a moto-taxi driver, he also works as a salesman for a well-known gas company in the city. He has worked there for 6 years, and even though it can be a difficult job, he knows he has to do it. In the future, he hopes to buy another moto-taxi and use it to increase his earnings. This will be his fourth loan with MFP, and he is very happy knowing he will have financial support. This way, he feels safe advancing in his work. He is committed to continue being a punctual client by making his payments on time. He is very happy to belong to his community bank because everyone is very responsible and there is a lot of solidarity. With the requested amount of 2000 soles, he will buy parts for his moto-taxi that needs repairs after falling into disrepair from the bad quality of the roads. He will also pay the mechanic to do the repair work for him.

loans.use: buy parts for his motorcycle and hire a mechanic to do the maintenance work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase mayonnaise 4 cartons @ Le240,000, milk -5 cartons @ Le210,000, ketchup - 7 cartons @ Le60,000, beans 1 bag @ Le520,000 and cocoa 1  dozen @ Le50,000.

loans.name: Bersatu Mandiri Group

texts.en:
Khusnul is a widow. She does not have any children. She has had a grocery store since 2008. Her business is going well. But she does not have a complete inventory in her store. Now she also sewing clothes as ordered. 

She is taking out her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia to buy sewing supplies such as thread and needles and she also wants to add more goods to her store. From her income she can buy daily food and pay rent. She likes sewing and she likes having income from her store. In the future, she hopes she can open a boutique.

Other group members are selling eggs, "ketoprak" (an Indonesian dish) and "gado-gado" (an Indonesian dish of  vegetables mixed with peanut sauce.)

loans.use: to pay for sewing supplies such as thread and needles and to pay for more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación. Actualmente se encuentran  en el 10º ciclo, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2009. Las mujeres de este grupo son muy unidas y siempre realizan actividades juntas para poder de esa forma fomentar su compañerismo.
Una de las miembros es la señora Marta, quien cuenta que se dedica a la venta de frutas de estación, como ser sandias, piñas, manzanas, naranjas, uvas y demás tipos. Por medio de este trabajo ella ha sacado adelante a su familia y les ha dado todo lo que necesitan. Su meta es poder tener una tienda grande donde vender no solo frutas, sino también otras cosas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de sandias, melones, manzanas, uvas y demás tipos de frutas. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
This group from the city of Encarnación came into being through one member's contact with the foundation.  Currently they are in their tenth loan cycle.  They have been doing business with the foundation since 2009.  The women of this group are very close and they always do things together to be able to promote their companionship.

One of the members is Marta, who says she works selling seasonal fruits like watermelon, pineapple, apples, oranges, grapes, and other types.  With this work she has gotten her family ahead and given them everything they need.  Her goal is to be able to have a large store to sell not only fruit but other things as well.

She is requesting the loan to buy watermelon, cantaloupe, apples, grapes, and other types of fruit.  She is grateful to the foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity they are getting.

loans.use: to buy watermelon, cantaloupe, apples, grapes, and other types of fruit.

loans.name: Daria

texts.es: LA SEÑORA DARIA,   SE DEDICA A TRABAJAR EN LA AGRICULTURA JUNTO A SU ESPOSO QUE SE ENCUENTRA EN ESTADO DELICADO DE SALUD Y EN TIEMPO LIBRE  A REALIZAR TRABAJOS DE CUIDADO DE ANIMALES DOMÉSTICOS Y ASÍ PODER MANTENERSE EN LA ANTERIOR COSECHA TUVO PROBLEMAS CLIMÁTICOS  DE SEQUÍA Y HELADAS, POR EFECTO, LAS AGUAS  DE RIEGO BAJARON DE CAUDAL AFECTANDO AL RENDIMIENTO DE LA PRODUCCIÓN, ESTE DESASTRE HIZO FRACASAR EN SUS INGRESOS ECONÓMICOS A LA FAMILIA QUE SE MANTENÍAN CON LA PRODUCCIÓN AGRÍCOLA. CADA AÑO PRODUCEN PRINCIPALMENTE PAPA, CEBOLLA, ZANAHORIA Y MAÍZ, COMO EL MAIZ SIRVE DE FORRAJE ES IMPRESCINDIBLE PARA LA ALIMENTACIÓN DEL GANADO VACUNO SIN EMBARGO  CUANDO ESTABA SU MAÍZ DE UNA ALTURA DE 15 CENTÍMETROS  HA SUFRIDO EL DAÑO DE LA SEQUÍA DEJANDO EL CULTIVO TOTALMENTE SECO. DOÑA DARÍA ES UNA PERSONA  MUY QUERIDA, CONOCIDA Y RESPETADA EN EL LUGAR DONDE VIVE, POR LO DEDICADO AL TRABAJO AGRÍCOLA Y LA CALIDAD DE PRODUCTOS QUE OFRECE A LOS INTERMEDIARIOS, ELLA Y SU ESPOSO HAN QUEDADO SOLOS YA QUE SUS HIJOS VIVEN EN OTROS LUGARES DEL PAÍS, SOLICITAN EL CRÉDITO PARA COMPRAR  INSUMOS AGRÍCOLAS, SEMILLA DE PAPA, DE CEBOLLA, AGROQUÍMICOS Y ABONO ORGÁNICO, DE ESTA MANERA MEJORARÁ LA PRODUCCIÓN Y EL RENDIMIENTO, LAS PEQUEÑAS PARCELAS QUE TIENE CON SU ESPOSO NO ES SUFICIENTE  POR TANTO SE ALQUILA TIERRAS PARA AMPLIAR LA PRODUCCIÓN TAMBIÉN TIENE LA CLARA IDEA DE QUE CON ESTE CRÉDITO MEJORARÁ LAS CONDICIONES Y QUE EN LAS PRÓXIMAS OPORTUNIDADES REALIZARA INVERSIONES CON CRÉDITOS MAYORES QUE LE PERMITAN EMPRENDER NEGOCIOS CON UTILIDADES DE MAYOR VALOR ECONÓMICO.
texts.en:
Daria farms with her husband, who’s health is fragile.  In her spare time she cares for her animals and supports herself in this way.  She has trouble with the droughts and frost during the last harvest and it affected production.  Each year they raise potatoes, onions, carrots, and corn.  The corn is good for feed for their cattle; however it was damaged by the drought and is completely dry.

Daria is well liked and respected in her community because of her dedication to farming and the quality of the products she sells.  She and her husband are alone now that their children have gone to different parts of the country.  They are asking for this loan to buy supplies such as potato seed, onion seed, chemicals, and compost.  In this way they can improve their production.  The small plots they own are not enough, so they rent land so they can expand production.  She also has the idea of improving her quality of life with the help of this loan.  In the future she will use loans to invest in things that will make her business more efficient.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 56 years old and has one child in school.

Elizabeth has a buy-and-sell fruits business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fruits like oranges, mangoes, apples, etc. to sell.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits like oranges, mangoes, apples, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Hernalyn

texts.en:
Hernalyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Hernalyn is 29 years old and has four children are still in school.

Hernalyn has a buy and sell recycled materials business in the Philippines. Hernalyn requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of recycled to sell.

Hernalyn has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of recycled to sell

loans.name: Ramona Suyapa Zeron

texts.en: I bake and sell bread (rosquillas and quesadillas) and receive orders from my clients, housewives or owners of small grocery shops. I have done this for the past three years and with the help of one of my sons Iâ€™ve managed to grow significantly.  My demand is now so large that I need to buy more ingredients.

loans.use: Buying flower, lard, condiments and firewood.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a charcoal producer. He produces about 7 tonnage truck full of charcoal for a community where fuel wood is the main source of domestic energy. He has learned from the TEACH lending skills program that records keeping is a very important aspect in business development. He wants a loan facility  of $625 to strenghten his operations.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Huo

texts.en: Huo P. is 41 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 2 children.  Her husband is a police officer and earns $4 per day.  Her 2 young children are currently attending school.  Huo P. runs a small grocery store and also buys rice in bulk to sell to local restaurants for retail.  She will use this loan to buy more groceries, as her business is doing very well.  She is confident that she will be able to sell these extra products, earn extra income, and make her living standard better.  In the future, she wants to continue growing her business so that she can send her children to University and so that she can make her home bigger and more beautiful.

loans.use: To buy grocery products

loans.name: Lorng

texts.en:
Mrs. Lorng S., 45 years old mother of 5 children, lives with her husband in a part of Preyveng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband sell pork to retail stores along the roadside of her village. They typically make about $6 perday in revenue. Two of their children attend school and get involved with her business whenever they are free, while the rest aremarried and stay with their own families.
Meanwhile, Lorng S. is humbly requesting the loan amount of $1000 to meet her clients' needs and maximize the size of her growing business by purchasing more pigs to invest in a small booth. She eventually hopes the loan will help her and her family. In the future, she is committed to have enough money to purchase a stand at a market, where she is able to makes additional profit from this business activity.

loans.use: To purchase pigs for a business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: "People cannot do without food" says Mrs. Victoria I. who lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. A 30 year old woman Victoria is married with 3 children. She sells rice, oil, salt and beans to her community. Victoria hopes to buy more rice, oil, salt and beans for sale with the the requested  loan.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana and her husband have two kids, and the family lives in a small place. Diana and her husband work together in the little workshop they set up after long years of hard work. They wake up very early every day to deliver orders on time, and to repair footwear and take more orders. Diana’s husband learnt the art of making footwear in the past, and now they have the tools of the trade to do a good job.

There is no electricity available to them in the area where they live, but Diana and her husband can make the repairs since they use a mechanical machine. But they lack enough supplies for their job. They need material to make and repair footwear, and care for their clientele.

Diana is asking for US$ 175, that she will repay within 6 months. With your help she may keep her shop running and be able to provide for her family. Your generosity will make possible for her to improve her small business.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Ramón, Kiva Volunteer.

Diana es madre de 2 niños y comparte las instalaciones de su pequeña morada con su esposo y sus dos únicos retoños. Ambos trabajan en el pequeño taller que pusieron fruto de muchos años de esfuerzo; se levantan muy temprano para entregar los pedidos con anticipación y seguir trabajando en la reparación y elaboración de algunos pedidos, ya que el esposo aprendió el arte fabricarlos y para su buen desempeño han adquirido las herramientas necesarias para un exitoso desempeño. A pesar de no contar con el servicio de energía eléctrica su trabajo se realiza sin ningún problema debido a que la maquinaria con la que cuentan es manual de esa manera no les afecta en nada la ausencia del servicio en la zona, la única preocupación que tienen en estos momentos es la adquisición de materiales para la reparación y fabricación de los calzados con los que podrán seguir prestando sus servicios a sus clientes y público en general sin ningún percance. La solicitud de Diana es por la suma de 175 dólares con un compromiso de devolución en un plazo no mayor a seis meses, nuestra ayuda le permitirá seguir creciendo en su taller y poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.Hagamos posible la consolidación de este pequeño espacio de fabricación con nuestra generosa ayuda.

loans.use: Buying materials to make and repair footwear

loans.name: Alie

texts.en: Alie started his business 7 years ago and has accessed several small loans from SMT. Each loan enabled Alie to increase his stock of soft drinks by 10 crates. With his last loan, Alie established himself as a supplier who purchases the drinks directly from the factory and sells them to small bars and restaurants. According to Alie, he has many orders but could not fulfill them due to lack of capital. Alie is 43 years old and married with 4 children, and his plan is to build a family house and provide the children with the best education possible.

loans.use: Increase his stock of soft drinks to meet the market demand.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Mrs. M. Kong, 44, and her husband, Mr. Soeng Kol, 50, have been married since 1982. They have one son who is a motor taxi driver. Kong and her family are living on an island of the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has been a farmer and silk weaver (a skill she learned from her mother) since 1980.   On her farm, she grows tomatoes and corn. Her husband repairs wooden houses and buildings in the village.

Kong is requesting her first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $1,000. She will use this loan to expand her farming business and repair her house.

loans.use: For expanding farming business and repairing her house

loans.name: Rafiga

texts.en: Rafiga is a 47-year-old local resident of the town of Saatli. She breeds cattle in her yard. She has been engaged in this business for more than 10 years. She raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. She also sells milk and other diary products. Rafiga wants to develop this business, to increase the number of cows. She has applied to the Normicro Saatli branch for a loan in amount of $500.

loans.use: To increase her number of cattle

loans.name: Magamgaga Est E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Monica M.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Monica is 32 years old and is married. Her husband has a maize milling business. She has 8 children ranging from age 4 to 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Monica makes approximately UGX 25000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add more capital to the business. Monica has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy more maize and the loan was paid back on time.

Monica is joined in her small group by Juliet N. and Margret M.. Juliet N. has a business selling clothes and wants to purchase more clothes for sale. Margret M. is currently operating a business in farming and wants a loan to add to her business and improve the quality of her produce.

loans.use: To purchase more shop items and boost business

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
When her children were still small, Dina sold ceramic decorations outside her house because she still had to be home to care for them. Some time later, fifteen years ago, she decided to start selling clothing as a street vendor. After she had to vacate her post, she acquired a location at the market in Huaycán. She does not utilize her space, however, and says that she doesn’t generate enough sales at the market and would prefer to sell in another market.

Despite the fact that her husband works as a construction worker, she says she must continue to work to help with household expenses given that her husband’s earnings are not sufficient to support the family. She would like to augment her merchandise and in the future obtain a post at the market where she actually works.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Cuando sus hijos estaban aún pequeños Dina estuvo vendiendo adornos de cerámica afuera de su casa, pues debía cuidar también a sus niños. Poco tiempo después, hace quince años, decidió empezar a vender ropa como ambulante. Una vez que la desalojaron de aquel puesto adquirió un o en un mercado de Huaycán Puesto que actualmente no utiliza porque dice que no obtiene ventas ahí y prefiere seguir vendiendo como ambulante en otro mercado. A pesar de que su esposo trabaja como obrero de construcción, ella dice seguir trabajando para ayudar con los ingresos a su hogar, pues con lo que gana su esposo no es suficiente. A ella le gustaría aumentar su mercadería y en un futuro conseguir puesto en el mercado en el que actualmente trabaja.

loans.use: Increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Martín Manases

texts.es:
Don Martín is 41 years old, separated, and has a son who is under his guardianship, and for whom he works day after day.

Don Martín is a driver and has a truck that he uses to transport goods, primarily construction items and timber. He currently has problems with the gearbox in his vehicle and because of this he needs a loan.

He needs to buy the part and install it in his vehicle so that he can continue working to provide sustenance to his son and to his mother, whom he supports financially.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Don Martin tiene 41 años de edad, es separado y tiene un hijo, el cual se encuentra bajo su tutela, y por el que trabaja día a día. Don Martin es transportista, tiene una camioneta que la usa para el servicio de Acarreo, principalmente en las áreas de construcción y maderas. Actualmente tiene problemas con la caja de cambios de su vehículo, por lo que requiere del préstamo. Necesita comprar el repuesto e instalarlo en su vehículo y así poder seguir trabajando para darle el sustento a su hijo y a su madre a la que él ayuda económicamente.

loans.use: To change the gearbox of his truck

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara A. is thirty one year old businesswoman. She is married and the mother of two children, who are both in school. Barbara is very industrious and helps her husband provide for their family. She is a small scale manufacturer of canned pepper. She buys both fresh and dry pepper from local farmers, mills and processes them into cans, and then supplies them to food vendors and restaurant operators.

Her production is on very limited scale because of low working capital. She therefore wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials and minor equipment to raise her production efficiency. She believes this will help her increase her income and also to support her family.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials and minor equipment to manufacture canned pepper.

loans.name: Ving

texts.en: Ving C., 52, lives with her two children and a niece in the Kampong Cham province. She typically makes $3.30 a day selling silk skirts and cotton scarves in her area. She is also supported by her two children, who work in the garment factories. Ving C. is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase more silk skirts and scarves. She believes that increasing her inventory and selling the clothes in larger amounts will increase her income and raise her standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase more silk skirts and scarves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of two dairy cows

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with one daughter. After college she had several different jobs, however, she realized that her best opportunity would be to have her own business. Today Svetlana is in business selling trendy clothing and footwear at the local market. She has been in this trade for 10 years.

Svetlana is very sociable. Her friendliness and respectful attitude have given her a good reputation at the market. Svetlana has also proven to be a good manager of her finances. She has promptly repaid all her loans from Nadiya Ukraine. Loans have enabled a gradual expansion of Svetlana's business. Currently, she has about $15,000 in inventory. Her gross income per month is about $2000. Her monthly net profit amounts to $500.

Svetlana would like to get a loan for 3000 Grivnas to increase the assortment of inventory in her kiosk. She believes the loan will be beneficial to her business by promoting its expansion. Profit generated by her business will help Svetlana cover some necessities at home to improve the quality of life for her family.

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in 2 months.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Try Hard Group

texts.en:
This group, called Try Hard, led by Rebecca S., consists of three other members: Mabinty K., Fatmata K. and Demoh S., all local entrepreneurs in Makeni, the Northern Province headquarter town. This group has been with SMT for more than four years now, always repaying its loans on time before seeking a new one. Their businesses prosper as a result of the loans they receive from Kiva through SMT, enabling them to expand and acquire items that were previously lacking in their stalls, the same objective of their current loan request.

The leader of this group, Rebecca S., 45, is married with three children, two in secondary school and the eldest in college. Her husband, a lecturer, is primarily responsible for their schooling as tradition maintains, but Rebecca also contributes greatly towards their education and welfare. She has been selling local produce including ground-nuts, palm-oil, pepper, and onions at the town's main lorry pack for the past 20 years now.

loans.use: To buy items they currently lack for their vending stalls

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
Rano U. is an active client of our program and she has been the client of MicroInvest since 2004. Mrs. U. is engaged in commerce; she sells eggs in the local market. She is married and has 2 children. She lives in Khujand.

Mrs. U. is applying to KIVA with the request for a business development loan of 2600 STJ for 4 months to expand her little business.

loans.use: to expand her little business

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar, de 45 años de edad, es padre de 5 hijos, siendo 3 de ellos independientes, vive en la actualidad con los dos últimos y su esposa quien lo apoya mucho. Él se dedica a la venta de accesorios y lubricantes, servicios de rebobinados y reparación de motos, las 24 horas del día. Esto lo viene realizando desde hace 2 años en forma independiente. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es estar en contacto directo con sus clientes. Le es muy rentable, ya que se encuentra en una zona muy transitable. Lo más difícil para él es no contar con el local adecuado. Es el primer préstamo con MFP. El dinero que solicita será usado para mandar a construir un local con los ambientes necesarios para su negocio, al que ha llamado "Lubricentro El Gordo y Servicios Técnicos Popeye Motors"
texts.en:
Oscar is 45 years old and is the father of 5 children, 3 of them are already independent, and he currently lives with the last two and her wife, who supports him on his business. He works selling parts and lubricants to repair motorcycles 24 hours a day. He has been working on this for the last 2 years. He likes to be in contact with his clients and the business is very profitable because it is located on very transited area. He doesn’t have a proper shop. With the money he is soliciting he will build a better local with all necessary items for his business, he will call his business “ Lubricant Place the Fat guy and Technical Services Popeye Motors”.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To Build a place for his body shop business

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: Jenny tiene 35 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos menores que estudian en el nivel primario. Desde muy niña se ha dedicado a la agricultura, desde que se casó siguió en esta labor, pero en menor tiempo, ya que está dedicada más a la atención de su esposo que es chofer y trabaja en la ciudad haciendo taxi  y sus hijos que estudian, pero hay temporadas donde que tienen que ir a cosechar o cultivar sus chacras, entonces, madruga a eso de las 4.00am para prepara el almuerzo y estar temprano en sus campos, a ella le agrada mucho la chacra, solo que no le puede dedicar mucho tiempo, por los estudios de sus hijos, pero en tiempo de vacaciones se dedicará de integro a su chacra, juntamente con su esposo. Es su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. El dinero solicitado será invertido en el abono de sus plantaciones de plátano, ya que empezará la preparación de sus tierras los fines de semana, para que de ese modo las hojas del plátano reaccionen y no estén amarillas.
texts.en:
Jenny is 35 years old, married, and has four young children who are in primary school. Since she was young, she has dedicated herself to agriculture and she continued in this labor after she married. She spends less time at it, however, in order to dedicate more time to her husband -- who is a taxi driver and works in the city -- as well as to her children, who are students. However, there are times when they have to go to harvest or care for their farmlands. To do this, she rises at 4:00 a.m. to fix lunch and arrive at her lands early. She very much enjoys farming, only she can’t dedicate much time due to her childrens’ studies. During vacation times, she will dedicate herself wholly to farming, along with her husband. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. The funds requested will be invested into fertilizing her banana plantings, since she will be starting to prepare her lands on the weekends so that the leaves on her banana trees will react and not yellow.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Niza

texts.es: Niza tiene 23 años, es madre de un hijo y vive con su conviviente quien la apoya en todo. Hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de comida regional de forma ambulante, y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar muy buena atención a sus clientes. Además, le es rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en un lugar muy transitado y sobre todo, cuenta con una clientela selecta y fiel que degustan de su buena sazón. Lo único difícil para ella es no contar con un local propio. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado responsabilidad en su crédito anterior. Con el dinero solicitado mandará a construir un kiosco, para vender sus platos de comida con mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Niza is 23 years old, has one son, and lives with her partner, who supports her in everything. For two years she has been a street vendor selling regional foods. What she enjoys most about her job is giving very good service to her customers. Her business is lucrative, since she works in a high-traffic area and can depend on loyal customers who enjoy her delicious food. The difficult thing is that she does not have a storefront.

This is Niza's second loan from Kiva's partner MFP, and she has been very responsible in repaying her first. With this loan, she will build a stand to offer her customers a more comfortable place to enjoy her plates of food.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kiosk for her business

loans.name: Tith

texts.en: Tith S., 40 years old, is a true entrepreneur who has business selling various kinds of fruit in a busy market. She lives with her husband and children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. As a fruit seller, S. can typically make about US$ 10 per day, while her husband works as a policeman and can make about US$ 8 per day. With the loan, the family hopes to buy more fruit in order to expand the family business. In the future, S. hopes to further expand the business and also to send her three children to university.

loans.use: To expand her fruit stand

loans.name: Dom

texts.en:
D., 30, who lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, earns a living selling souvenir items for tourists. working near Angkor Wat Temple. She has experience in this business for four years. D. is married and currently takes care of two children, both of whom attend school. Her husband works selling souvenirs as well.

D. works very hard every day and is very responsible with regard to her family. Recently, she had sold a lot of the items from her store, and because souvenir-selling is D.'s main way to earn an income to support her family, she asked for a loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase a range of souvenir items for sale. Any remaining money would be used to build additional display space.

loans.use: To purchase a range of souvenir items for sale

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is divorced and has three children. She owns a retail business that sells cosmetics and perfumes at the market in Belaya Tserkov. She started this business when her husband left her.  She has been operating this business for 14 years. Today Svetlana has one employee and many loyal clients. Her main character traits are strength, desire to work, energy and commitment.

Svetlana would like to borrow 5,000 UAH to increase the assortment of inventory. The bulk prices are low at the moment, so Svetlana intends to buy the products when they are cheap and make profitable sales. The additional income will help Svetlana pay for her children's expenses.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of products she sells

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa K., 27, is married with two young children and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province. She stays at home doing housework and cooking for her family members. Her husband has operated a taxi business for over six years and he is able to make a profit of US$10 every day. Hoa K. is asking for a loan to replace an old and unreliable taxi for her husband. (Hoa K. is pictured with her husband and two young children.)

loans.use: To replace taxi.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Mirian es una mujer muy alegre, a sus 30 años ha logrado construir con mucho esfuerzo su casa propia, vive con su único hijo, Yeron de 6 años, a quien quiere darle buenos estudios. Para Mirian las abejas en vez de causarle miedo le causan felicidad, ya que gracias a la miel que producen ella puede llevar el dinero necesario a su familia para mantener a su hogar, lleva 4 años en esta actividad y la miel que vende es rápidamente comprada por las tiendas a quienes provee con este delicioso néctar. Mirian disfruta de su trabajo, ya que cuando tiene hambre no duda en abrir unos de sus recipientes de plástico y saborear el producto que vende, pero lo que menos le gusta es tener que caminar tanto durante todo el día para vender su producto. Aun así sabe que tiene que trabajar duro y espera poder abrir un negocio más estable como una tienda de abarrotes o una librería, puesto que el barrio donde vive está recién formándose y aun carece de estos servicios. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y se siente en la responsabilidad de hacerlo, en su banco comunal es muy solidaria y preocupada. Con el dinero que solicita planea incrementar su capital de trabajo y comprar más miel para poder tener el dinero necesario para abrir el negocio propio que tanto ansía.
texts.en:
Mirian is a very happy woman and at 30 years of age she has managed with much effort to build her own house. She lives with her only son, Yeron who is 6 years old, to whom she wants to give a good education. For Mirian, bees, instead of scaring her, cause her happiness as thanks to the honey that they produce she can bring home to her family the money necessary to support her household. She has been involved in this activity for 4 years and the honey that she sells is quickly purchased by the stores to which she supplies this delicious nectar. Mirian enjoys her work as when she is hungry she does not hesitate to open some of her plastic containers and taste the product that she sells. But what she likes least is having to walk so much during the day to sell her product. Despite this she knows that she has to work hard and hopes to be able to open a more stable business such as a grocery store or a bookstore as the neighborhood where she lives is new and still lacks these services. This is her second loan with MFP and she knows that she has to pay it on time and feels the responsibility to do it. In her communal bank she acts with solidarity and concern. With the funds that she is requesting she plans to increase her working capital and purchase more honey to be able to have the money necessary to open her own business that see so much wants.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina A. is thirty years old. She is divorced and has two sons, both of whom are in primary school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Paulina works very hard as a single parent to provide for the family. She trades in smoked fish, buying the fish from the markets in the nearby communities and selling at the local market. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy smoked fish in bulk. She hopes to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish in bulk.

loans.name: Odette

texts.fr:
K. Odette est née vers 1972 à Adjarra dans le Département de l'Ouémé. Odette vend des galettes d’arachide en gros et des sachets pour divers usages. C’est aux détaillants de galettes d’arachide du marché de Sèkandji dans la Commune de Sèmè-kpodji que Odette livre ses galettes. Odette achète ses galettes d’arachide à Bohicon dans le Département du ZOU. En ce qui concerne les sachets, Odette les achète au Nigeria, État frontalier au Bénin et les revend aux détaillants de ce produit à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Pour renforcer son fond de roulement afin de bien répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, sollicite de ALIDé un crédit. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
K. Odette was born around 1972 in Adjarra in the County of Ouémé. Odette sells peanut cookies wholesale and plastic bags for various usages. Odette delivers her peanut cookies to retailers at the market of Sèkandji in the township of Sèmè-kpodji. Odette buys her peanut cookies at Bohicon in the County of ZOU.

As for the bags, Odette buys them in Nigeria, a border state of Benin, and sells them to retailers of such products in Dantokpa, the big international market of Benin. To bolster her working capital so as to respond to the needs of her clientele, she is asking ALIDé for a loan.

The significance of ALIDé in the local language of Bénin, Fon, is "there is always a pathway for the poorest of the poor". Bénin is a small country in West Africa next door to Nigeria, where the average per capita annual income stands at US$ 1,500.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 4 big baskets of peanut cookies and 150 dozen bags

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
A jeepney barker’s wife is our featured story. A resident of Calabayan, Ozamiz City, she is Mrs. Regina C. L., a 46-year- old married mother of six children who are mostly minors and still dependent on their parents for their needs. As a thoughtful and loving mother, Regina has helped her husband in supporting their children. Presently, she is engaged in snack, rice and vegetables vending, having started this business with an initial capital only of Php 2,500.00. Her business is progressing, patronized mainly by neighbors, students and friends in the village.

Regina is now requesting a loan of Php 5,000.00 under the Medal Pangnegosyo 2 program of PMPC to increase her capital for her business and to purchase school supplies needed for her children. She is very thankful for the support of her husband and the trust of PAGLAUM MPC and KIVA in micro-entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Addtional capital for snack, rice, feeds and vegetable vending

loans.name: Desiree

texts.en:
Desiree  M. is from the village of Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years old. Desiree is married and has an infant child. Desiree is just starting a business venture selling auto-loads in the local community. 

In 2008, Desiree joined PMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Desiree has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Desiree is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used used as starting capital. This will be the third loan taken out by Desiree from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Used as starting capital

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey S. is a villager in Ou Phut village in Takeo province. She owns a small general store. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more goods to increase her profits. Her husband, Mr. Kum Sarun, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Together, they have two children, one of whom attends the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for her general store to increase her profits.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria P. is 52 years old, married with five school-age children, and lives in Purok Urong Yulo, Brgy. Sto. Rosario in the town of Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. Gloria earns her living by sewing and renting out gowns. She has been in this business for the last five years since she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon, and it earns her on average, PHP 3,500 per month. Gloria wants to borrow PHP 14,000 for her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon so that she can buy cloth and other sewing materials to make new gowns which she rents out to the local community. The income Gloria earns from her business has been a big help in the day-to-day living of her young family, especially as it allows her to send all her children to school. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To buy cloth and other sewing materials and accessories

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
La señora Luz María S., es socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Progresistas, es un bankito muy sólido, solidario y unido llevan muchos años realizando prestamos y son las personas más agradecidas porque gracias a estos préstamos han logrado superarse y sacar  a sus familias adelante, brindándoles una vida digna y se encuentran muy orgullosas de sus logros, como grupo son muy alegres y extrovertidas se llevan muy bien entre todas. 

Luz vive en la panamericana norte kilómetro 7 ½  a unos 40 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 32 años de edad, su estado civil es casada y aun no tiene hijos, pero pronto los piensa procrear, viven en casa propia, su esposo trabaja como chofer y se llevan muy bien creando una relación estable y armoniosa

Estudio belleza y trabaja en su rama, teniendo su propio gabinete hace 6 años, le va muy bien por que cuenta con una buena clientela, en su gabinete trabaja sola y la mejor ventaja de ser dueña de su gabinete de belleza es que trabaja con tranquilidad  y es independiente, una desventaja es la competencia que existe. 

Luz trabaja junto al bankito hace 5 años y está contenta por las capacitaciones que le han brindado de parte de la fundación, el préstamo que la fundación le entrega lo va a invertir en su gabinete por que necesita comprar algunos instrumentos para  su negocio, su meta es comprarse un carro para poder viajar a distintas partes de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz María S. is a member of the “Progressive Women Communal Bank”, a stable bank with supportive, close members who have been making loans for several years. The women in the Bank are very thankful because through these loans they have been able to better themselves and provide a better life for their families. They are very proud of their achievements. As a group, they are very cheerful and extroverted and get along very well with one another.

Luz lives in the North Pan American Highway (km. 7 1/2), about 40 minutes outside the city of Cuenca. She is 32 years old, is married, and even though she currently has no kids she plans to have them soon. Luz and her husband live in a house they own and her husband works as a driver. They have a stable and loving relationship.

Luz studied Beauty and makes a living in this field. She has had her own business for 6 years and is doing very well because she has a good customer base. The greatest advantage of owning her own salon is that she can work peacefully and independently. The greatest disadvantage lies in the competition that exists.

Luz has worked with the bank for 5 years and is happy with the training the Foundation has provided her. Luz will use the loan the Foundation is giving her to invest in her salon as she needs to purchase some materials. Her goal is to purchase a car so that she can use it to go to different parts of the city..

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of instruments for her beauty salon such as hair dryers, curling irons, etc.

loans.name: Dib

texts.en:
Dib, a 34-year-old man living in the Bekaa with his wife and five children, works as a carpenter. He has been the owner of a small factory for nine years, producing doors, windows, kitchens, etc. Dib has requested a loan of $2000 US from A. Majmoua in order to purchase an aluminum machine for his work. This is the first time that Dib has requested a loan.

Dib is experienced and does nice work. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Dib decided on doing this business because he wanted to improve his financiA. situation. In the future, he plans on improving his business by purchasing more sophisticated machines.

loans.use: To purchase an aluminum machine for his work.

loans.name: Lucilda

texts.es: Lucilda tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo Florentino, y sus 6 hijos: José de 17, Julio de 14, Luis de 12, Raúl de 10, Kevin de 7 y Milagros de 5 años de edad, todos ellos viven en su casa propia. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta y distribución de balones de gas, sus hijos la ayudan en el negocio por ser una actividad que necesita de gran esfuerzo físico.
