De esta manera Lucilda recibe los pedidos por teléfono y su hijo mayor los distribuye en su moto. Ella está muy feliz, ya que su negocio le resulta rentable y cada vez va creciendo más, es por ello que desea ampliar el ambiente que tiene para almacenar sus balones. Su deseo a futuro es tener una distribuidora de este combustible doméstico, además de comprar más motos y contratar personal. Es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, ella siempre ha pagado puntualmente todas sus cuotas, al igual que el resto de sus compañeros de grupo. Con el dinero que viene solicitando desea comprar mayor cantidad de balones de gas para abastecer su almacén y aumentar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Lucilda is 37 years old and lives in a house with her husband Florentino and her 6 children: 17-year-old José, 14-year-old Julio, 12-year-old Luis, 10-year-old Raúl, 7-year-old Kevin and 5-year-old Milagros. For the past 4 years she has dedicated herself professionally to the sale and distribution of gas tanks. Her children help her in the business because it is a job that is physically demanding. In this way Lucilda receives the requests by telephone and her oldest son distributes the tanks on his motorbike. Lucilda is very happy now that her business is making money and growing. It is because of this that she wants to increase the room that she has to store the tanks. Her wish for the future is to have a distribution center for this gas, in addition to buying more motor bikes and contract outside workers. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She has always payed punctually as have the rest of the members of her group. With the money that she is requesting, she wishes to buy more gas tanks to stock her storeroom and increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase commodities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase used clothes in bulk

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia T. is 33 years old. She is a mother and a farmer from Kapatungan, Trento, Agusan Del Sur. She has a rice field, which she hopes will provide her family with food and income. She is also engaged in duck raising. She already has 200 ducks. She expects that number to grow so that she will be able to support all her family's needs. 

She plans to expand her business but needs additional capital to do so. She would like to apply for a loan of PHP 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farming necessities to improve her harvest and household income.

loans.use: To buy farm necessities

loans.name: Petina

texts.en:
Petina E. is a 66-year-old woman living in the town of Faleasiu Tualesolo. She is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Petina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Petina has been engaged in this business for over 1 year and earns approximately 350 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Petina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Petina is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Petina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda L. is from the village of Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Erlinda is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 24 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Erlinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
53-year-old Gemma Santurdio is a woman who dedicated her life after marriage to her husband and five children. She worked very hard at several activities just to have her own income to augment that of her husband, a fisherman. Looking back on how she painfully started her life being a mother and a wife, she has learned that getting away from poverty was never easy. However, the determination she saw in her children to attain a higher level of education and finish college gives her courage and strength to combat poverty. With the help she has found in ASHI, KIVA's field partner in the Philippines, she is certain that she will change her family’s standard of living in the near future.

Gemma believes that in scrap and junk there is wealth. Aside from her desire to help her community maintain the cleanliness of its surroundings, Gemma also wants people to realize the value of maximizing things that they thought were useless in earning money. Therefore, she thought of putting up a business buying and selling scrap and junk. Empty plastic bottles, cans, used papers and metals are examples of things she buys from people and sells to a junk shop. For two years now, this business has been Gemma’s great financial provider. Someday, she really hopes to put up her own junk shop and to increase the proceeds from it.

loans.use: To finance buying and selling scrap or junk, such as metals and plastic bottles

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina, age 30, is a client of LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization), which is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She is married with four children. She lives and works in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria, where she runs a grocery store business, selling groceries in her store at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers, and she has high hopes of eventually opening a supermarket.

Tina is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Gloria Yovana

texts.es:
La señorita Gloria  es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Bárbara 2” desde hace 6 año atrás, del distrito de Chucuito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Se dedica a la compra y venta de lencería.
Gloria nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar ropa interior al por mayor como: medias, trusas, brasieres, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es ampliar su negocio a otros rubros. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Gloria has been a member of the Santa Bárbara 2 Communal Bank for six years. It is in the Chucuito district in the Puno province and department. She is 25, single, and does not have children. She buys and sells lingerie. She tells us that she used her first loan for 500 PEN from the Manuela Ramos Movement to increase her capital. She will ask for a loan for 1,500 PEN to be able to buy wholesale lingerie like hosiery, underwear, and bras, etc. Her dream for the future is to increase her business to include other items. What she likes best about her communal bank are the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hosiery, bras, and underwear

loans.name: Noel Wilder

texts.es:
Noel tiene 33 años D. edad, es conviviente hace 7 años, vive en casa D. sus padres con 
sus 2 hijos D. 6 y 4 años D. edad. El adquirió su camioneta station wagon con su 
liquidación obtenida D. los más D. 5 años laborando en una empresa distribuidora D. 
cerveza. El tiene amplia experiencia en el servicio D. taxi, adicional a esto brinda 
el servicio D. movilidad escolar. Noel y su cónyuge sueñan con tener su casa propia.   
El tiene muy buen trato con los niños los cuales los traslada a sus escuelas, y a 
todas las personas a las cuales el les brinda su atención. El requiere el crédito para 
realizarle el mantenimiento D. su unidad, y así no tener problemas, ya que se acerca 
L. temporada escolar.
texts.en:
Noel is 33 years old and has been in a common law marriage for seven years. He lives at the home of his parents with his two children, ages 6 and 4. He bought a station wagon using the severance pay he received after working more than five years for a beer distribution company. He has extensive experience in the taxi business, and also provides a shuttle service for school students. Noel and his wife dream of owning their own home. He treats the children he drives to school very well and provides excellent service to the rest of his customers.

The loan he is requesting will be used to perform maintenance on his vehicle so that he will not experience problems for the remainder of the school term.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Olialong B Aciro Betty Group

texts.en:
A. Betty is the group representative of the eight members in this group. She is a hardworking businesswoman of thirty-eight years, married and blessed with five children schooling.

Betty sells fish and she has been doing this for over three years. She is using the loan to purchase more fish and also cassava to sell.

Betty encourages the group members to work very hard to change the standard of living of their families as well their lives. She is active and courageous. Her future hope is to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more fish and also cassava to sell

loans.name: Cenesa

texts.en:
Cenesa T. is from the village of Catibac, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 39 years old. Cenesa is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Cenesa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Cenesa has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $100 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Cenesa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cenesa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Cenesa is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gerald Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Gerald Alberto Hernández  Gutiérrez, de estado civil casado, padre de un hijo, actualmente trabaja como obrero del volante en su propio taxi, cuenta con más de cuatro años de experiencia, este crédito lo solicito para la compra de seguro del vehículo y algunas mejoras de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Gerald Alberto Hernández Gutiérrez is married and has a son. He has over four years experience providing taxi services using his own car. He will use the requested funds to buy car insurance and to make some home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy doors for his house and car insurance.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina F. manages a small rice field. She has four children; the eldest is 11 years old. Her husband is a farmer and they work together to improve their harvest to support their children more. Now, the family is preparing the farm for another planting. They need additional money to buy all the farming materials. She would like to apply for a loan of PHP 5,000 at Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Ruhini Priyadarsha

texts.en:
Ruhini Priyadarsha is a 32-year-old married woman living with her husband and three children. She has one son and two daughters. They live in the town of Hikkaduwa, in the Galle area of southern Sri Lanka. Her husband has a motor boat, which he uses daily in his fishing business. Ruhini is providing good help to her husband selling fish. She helps to handle the family expenses instead of just relying on her husband to do so. Ruhini has been doing this business for 10 years.

Ruhini has requested a 35,000 Sri Lankan rupee loan from BRAC to renovate the fishing boat.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To renovate boat

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en: Saidi O. sells shoes to make a living. He hopes to own a shoe factory in the future. He is a hard working man and he sells for long hours to support his home.  He is 29 years old, married with a child. He hopes to give his child quality education. He is requesting for a loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more shoes to sell.  He says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Leonor Consuelo

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mateo Pumacahua se reúne en la ciudad de Chichero del departamento del Cusco,  esta ciudad es más conocida por las ruinas Incas que tiene, cuenta la historia que en tiempos pasados cuando aun no era ciudad en lo que ahora son sus calles había la casa del Inca “Túpac Inca Yupanqui”.  Es también muy interesante esta población no sólo por las ruinas y el templo, si no por los trajes y costumbres; además de su colorida y concurrida feria dominical. 

Al visitar este banco comunal Mateo Pumacahua conversamos con la socia Leonor, tiene 37 años, es casada, tiene 3 hijos,  vive en la ciudad del Cusco, su actividad económica principal es brindar servicio de transportes de turistas y su actividad complementaria de administrar su agencia de viajes llamada “Dery Tours”. Ya son 10 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, el ser socio de la fundación le ha ayudado mucho a superarse y hacer que su negocio crezca, ella requiere el nuevo crédito para completar el monto que cuesta comprar una laptop para su hija.
texts.en:
The "Mateo Pumacahua" communal bank meets in the city of Chinchero in the department of Cusco. This city is well-known for its Inca ruins. The story is told that in past times, before the current city was built, it was the site of the home of the Inca “Túpac Inca Yupanqui.” The town is not only interesting for its ruins and temple, but also for its traditional clothing and customs, as well as its popular and colorful Sunday market. Visiting the "Mateo Pumacahua" communal bank, we spoke with Leonor, a member who is 37 years old. She is married with 3 children and lives in the city of Cusco. Her main economic activity is providing tourist transportation services, and her complementary activity is running her travel agency, called “Dery Tours.” She has dedicated herself to this business for 10 years, and it is going very well for her thanks to the dedication she brings to her work. Being a member of the foundation has helped her very much in getting ahead and expanding her business. She needs the current loan for to add to her savings in order to buy a laptop computer for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a laptop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand and make some changes in his business

loans.name: Khon's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khon E. is 32 years old and is the village bank president having been selected by its fourteen members. The bank is located in Ou village, Takeo province.  The members of this village bank  loan will use the loans for different purposes. 
Mrs. Khon E. and her husband, Mr. Vin Hong, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Khon E. will use their loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to buy gasoline. This couple has three children who all are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and to buy gasoline for the family's farm

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata is a dedicated and focused businesswoman. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children, who all go to school.
Aminata has a business selling jeans under the cotton tree at the central main market of Makeni. Her business location is very strategic, which has made it possible for her to attract many customers, mainly young people. She got her business capital from a daily savings club called “Osusu” and started her jeans business immediately. For the past four years, Aminata has run this business successfully.
Aminata has a good loan repayment history, and needs a loan of 4,000,000 SLL to buy a large stock of different types of jeans from neighboring Guinea, where jeans are cheaper, enabling her to make more profit. Aminata intends to use the proceeds of her loan to help her husband educate their children to university level and build a family house.

loans.use: To buy more jeans

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica M. is divorced and has six dependents. She has been through junior high school.

Veronica sells kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) and pig-feet at Takoradi. She plans to use the loan to buy additional bags of maize to prepare more kenkey and also to purchase larger quantities of pig feet for sale.

Veronica uses the income she generates from her sales to provide the basic needs of her children such as food, clothing and education. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy additional bags of maize to prepare more kenkey and also buy larger quantities of pig feet to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elizabeth; La socia tiene 46años de edad, la socia tiene 3 hijos y es casada, ella trabaja como secretaria en el hospital Antonio Lorena y también tiene su tienda de venta de velas, la socia necesita ele préstamo para comprar insumos para elaborar velas.  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la fabricación de velas.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “United for Success” this bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Elizabeth; the member is 46 years old, has 3 children and is married. She works as a secretary in the Antonio Lorena hospital and also sells candles in her store. The member needs the loan to buy materials to make the candles. The member needs the loan to buy materials to make candles.

The member is grateful and values the loan given to her through this medium and is equally committed to meet the payments of her quotas in the time period established.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member needs the loan to buy materials to make candles.

loans.name: Sovetkan's Group

texts.en:
Sovetkan H. is the leader of this group. She is forty-seven and a widow. She has five children: her daughters are twenty-seven, twenty-three, twenty-two, and twenty, and her son is seventeen years old. Her daughters are married and live independently, her elder son lives with Sovetkan and helps her, and her youngest son is studying religious studies in Turkey. 

With the help of her elder son, Sovetkan breeds cattle. She started two years ago with initial investment of 15,000 soms. She has been able to educate her children on the profits from cattle breeding and increase her income to 3,000 soms. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase cattle for breeding. In the future, she is planning to increase her cattle herd further and make  repairs to her house.

Group members:

Ainur M. is the treasurer of the group. She is forty-six and married. She has three sons of twenty-two, nineteen, and seventeen years old. Her elder son graduated from medical college, her second son is a student in an  institution of higher education, and her youngest son is expected to graduate from high school this year. Her husband is a veterinarian. She breeds cattle and resells veterinary medicines.

They started fifteen years ago with the purchase of cattle for 15,000 soms. They have been able to educate their children, open a veterinary drug store, build a house, and increase their monthly income to 5,000 soms. In the near future, they are planning to buy more cattle, marry their son, and purchase household appliances. 

Sypaiy K. is forty-nine and married. She has three children: her sons are twenty-four and nineteen and her daughter is twenty-three years old. Her elder son is a merchant, her elder daughter is married and lives independently, and her youngest son is at home. 

She farms and breeds cattle and her son and husband help her. Also, she sells from eight to nine liters of milk each morning. They started fifteen years ago with a purchase of cattle for 6,000 soms. They have built a shed, purchased a house, educated their children, and increased their income to 2,000 soms. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase additional cattle. It would increase her turnover and as a result, it would increase her profits. In the near future, she is planning to buy more cattle and purchase furniture.
 
Dinara U. is forty-six and married. She has five children: her daughters are twenty-two, sixteen, twelve and her sons are twenty and eight years old. Her elder daughter is married and lives independently, her elder son is a student at an institution of higher education, and all her other children go to school. 

She breeds cattle and her children actively help her. Also, she sells twenty liters of milk a day. She started cattle breeding three years ago with initial investment of 15,000 soms. With the profits from cattle breeding, she educated her son and increased her turnover. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase more cattle for breeding. In the near future, she is planning to buy more cattle, marry her son, and purchase household appliances. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line--People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 

MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan   Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: purchasing cattle

loans.name: Nhaet

texts.en: Mrs. Nhaet T. is a villager in Chheu Teal Phluoh village in Takeo province and she is 37 years old. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice for her family. She is also a fish seller in the local market where she is able to earn a large profit to support her family. Since her business is going well from time-to-time, she wants to expand. So, to improve her own business, Mrs. Nhaet T. is seeking a loan to buy more fish to sell. She is a widow with two children who help in their mother’s businesses.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Puebla Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama PuebL. por que las clientas se identifican por ser  el nombre D. L. ciudad, está ubicado en L. comunidad D. PuebL. en México, el grupo está conformado por 9 mujeres.

L. presidenta del grupo se llama Soledad A. L., tiene 45 años, estudió L. primaria y se dedica a L. venta D. productos para L. salud, tiene  cuatro hijos. Sus clientas opinan que doña Soledad es una persona que le gusta salir a delante y que es una mujer emprendedora e independiente por buscar un mejor D. vida para su familia, su meta es salir adelante en L. vida.

L. Sra. Maribel  tiene 29 años y un hijo D. siete años, elL. estudio sólo L. primaria, se dedica a L. venta D. comida y calzado desD. hace 4 años, a lo cual se dedica con gusto, sobre todo a L. venta D. sus variados alimentos, solicita el préstamo para comprar un refrigerador que le permita conservar en buen estado sus productos, sus clientas L. conocen como una mujer joven y emprendedora al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta por L. confianza que le brindaron sus compañeras D. grupo a pesar D. ser tan joven, el éxito para elL. significa darles una mejor educación a sus hijos para que no sufran las carencias D. que elL. tuvo D. niña.
texts.en:
This group is called PuebL. because its members are from the city of the same name. The group is located in the PuebL. community in México and is maD. up of 9 women.

The president of the group is called Soledad A. L.. She is 45, studied until primary school, has 4 children and works selling health products. Her clients believe that doña Soledad is a person who likes to improve her life and who is an entrepreneurial and independent woman for seeking a better life for her family. Soledad's goal is to improve her situation in life. 

Maribel is 29 years old and has a 7 year old son. She only studied primary school and has sold food and shoes for 4 years, which she does with gusto, particularly the food sales. Maribel is seeking a loan to purchase a refrigerator so that she can preserve her products. Her customers know her to be a young and entrepreneurial woman. She feels happy about seeking a loan because of the confidence bestowed on her by her companions in the group. Success to Maribel means giving her children a better education so that they don't suffer the shortages that she did as a child.

loans.use: Invest in the business

loans.name: Umoja Virunga Group

texts.fr: Noella B. est  présidente du groupe Umoja Virunga, âgée de 28 ans, mariée, mère de 4 enfants, son mari est vendeur des habits usagers (friperie). Tous ses enfants étudient sauf le cadet. Juste l’après l’éruption du volcan Nyiragongo, qui aurait complètement détruit la ville de Goma en 2002, elle  commença son business  avec son fond propre par la vente des  habits usagers, en exerçant la même activité que son mari (friperie). Elle expose ses marchandises dans le marché central de Virunga. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’approvisionner  son stock avec un ballon d’habits (friperie), le reste lui servira de payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants et de se constituer l’épargne pour une marge de sécurité d’affaire. En plus, elle ambitionne devenir grossiste des habits usagers. La cliente Noella B. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique.  Il sied de signaler que ce groupe Umoja Virunga est  composé de 18 femmes dont un homme  a représenté son épouse, qui fut empêchée lors de distribution de prêts.
texts.en: Noella B. is the president of the Umoja Virunga group. She is 28 years old, married, and has 4 children. Her husband is a second-hand clothing salesman. All of her children are students except for the youngest. Immediately after the eruption of the Nyiragongo volcano, which would go on to completely destroy the town of Goma in 2002, Noella started a business with her own funds selling used clothes, running the same type of business as her husband. She displays her goods at the central market in Virunga. This new loan should serve to supply her stock with one bale of (used) clothing, with the remainder being used to pay for her children's school expenses and to build up some savings for a safety net. Furthermore, she aspires to become a wholesale used clothing seller. Noella thanks Hekima (one of Kiva's field partners) for its work on behalf of the poor who are excluded from mainstream banking. It must be noted that the Umoja Virunga group is composed of 18 women, of whom one is represented by her husband, since she was unable to be there during the loan distribution.

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio B. is from the village of Brgy. Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 50 years old, married and has 5 adult-aged children. Rogelio owns and operates a business making and selling charcoal for local businesses and community members. Rogelio has been engaged in his business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Rogelio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rogelio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase tools and other equipment to expand the business. Rogelio is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Rogelio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Crispina Caaway Group

texts.en:
Crispina is from the village of Macabayao, Jimenez, She is 61 years old. Crispina is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Crispina C. Group.
Crispina is married and has two adult-aged children. Crispina owns and operates a business Agricultural Sector. The main source of income for the business comes from raising crops. Crispina has been engaged in her business for over 24 years and earns an average of approximately 2,800 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.
In March 31,2009 Crispina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Crispina is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for raising crops for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Crispina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.
About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her agriculture business

loans.name: Diana Gabriela

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Marianita de Jesús.
 
En este lugar encontramos a la señora Diana, tiene 19 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 2 años y de 4 meses. El marido es obrero, transporta material de construcción en una empresa. Está en el Banco Comunal hace tres ciclos y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos.
 
Se dedica al comercio, vende productos Avon, (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana  desde las 9am hasta las 11am y de 14h00 a 16h00, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, deja a crédito sus productos y cobra los días sábado.

Este crédito es para comprar productos como: cremas, perfumes, bisutería entre otros. Sus sueños son darles una buena educación a sus pequeños hijos para que algún día sean muy buenas personas y buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the 'Marianita de Jesús' community bank meet in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez which is known for its beaches, its good food and the warmth of its people.

Here we meet Diana.  She is 19 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  They have two children aged 2 years and 4 months.  Diana's husband is a worker.  He transports building material for a company.  Diana has been a member of her community bank for three loan cycles and she likes it because the interest rates are very low.

Diana sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She works three days a week from 9.00am to 11.00am and from 2.00pm to 4.00pm.  She sells her products door to door.  She leaves her products on credit and collects payment every Saturday.

This loan will be used to buy products such as creams, perfumes, costume jewelry, etc.  Her dreams are to provide her young children with a good education so that some day they will become good people and good professionals.

loans.use: To buy creams, perfumes, costume jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Beriakou Ama

texts.fr: Ama a 4 enfants en charge et est âgée de  36ans.  Pour contribuer au foyer, elle fait elle même la préparation   de savons et shampoing  qu’elle vend en gros. Elle cumule 11 ans dans cette activité. Elle achète les produits de préparations au grand marché de Lomé et revend  au marché d’adidogomé. Elle sollicite un prêt pour se réapprovisionner
texts.en: Ama cares for four children and is 36.  To help pay household expenses she makes soaps and shampoos, which she wholesales.  She has been doing this for 11 years.  She buys her raw materials in the big marketplace in Lomé and sells her products in the marketplace in Adidogomé.  She is asking for a loan to build her inventory.

loans.use: Buy products for making soap.

loans.name: Samuel Gachuhi

texts.en:
Samuel Gachuhi N. is 37 years old, married to Serah Mwangi and they have three children. He has operated his retail shop in Naivasha town for the last three years.

Samuel was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his second loan. He paid his first loan of 15,000 KES well and in good time. He plans to buy sweets, sugar, rice and flour in bulk to sell with the loan amount.

In the future, Samuel hopes to grow his retail shop into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy sweets, sugar, rice and flour in bulk

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Horn S. is a 28-year-old woman who sells different kinds of Khmer cake in her village in Kompong Chhnang Province. Horn S. currently generates an income of approximately $2 per day. She has a life partner in her husband who is a local farmer. Besides selling Khmer cake, she assists her husband in the farming business as well. They have two children, both of whom are enrolled in school. 

Dry weather is expected in the beginning of this year, and it may affect Horn S.’s husband's business. He faces a difficult season if he is not able to irrigate his crop. In order to solve this situation, Horn S. is taking out her loan to support her husband to purchase a machine that he uses to pump water for his crops.

loans.use: To purchase a pumping machine for pumping water in rice crops

loans.name: Ararat

texts.en:
Ararat D. was born in 1974 in Gandzakar villagelocated in the area of Ijevan.  Ararat and his father are engaging in animal breeding and land cultivation. In their farm they rear cows and calves, and raise barley, which they use as a fodder for their farm animals  He sells dairy products from their farm at the Ijevan market to support his family. 

Ararat says that on their farm they get a lot of leftover byproduct from the whey they produce, so he decided to buy some pigs which will eat this whey. He asks for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy some pigs and to buy some fodder, because he didn't sow barley last year.

loans.use: To buy some pigs and  fodder

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel de 42 años, tiene un taller de ensamblaje y pintura de carros, vive con su esposa e hijas de 15 y 13 años. El trabajo por muchos años con un familiar que tenía un taller de enderezadora pero como quería independizarse y tener su propio negocio un taller de enderezado y pintura de carros. 

Trabaja desde las 09h00am arreglando carros destruidos por choques. Con el préstamo quiere comprar pinturas para arreglar más carros. En el futuro quiere comprar un carro para movilizarse a los lugares donde se encuentran sus clientes.
texts.en:
Manuel, 42, has a car repair and paint shop.  He lives with his wife and daughters who are 15 and 13 years of age.  He worked for many years with a family member who had a body shop but he wanted to become independent and have his own body shop and car painting business.

He works from 9am fixing cars that have been destroyed in collisions.  He will use the loan to buy paint so that he can fix more cars.  In the future he wants to buy a car so that he can go where his customers are located.

loans.use: For paint.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a rickshaw for transportation business

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la unión D. varias señoras vecinas del asentamiento Villa del Sur  y María Auxiliadora del barrio Mbokajaty D. la ciudad D. Villa Elisa.
Este comité es excelente, salen adelante gracias a la inversión del crédito en sus respectivas actividades comerciales.
La Sra. Marta Cristina
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to several neighbors from Villa del Sur y María Auxiliadora settlement, in Mbokajaty neighborhood, in the town of Villa Elisa.

This is an excellent committee whose members get ahead in life as they invest their loans in their respective commercial activities.

Marta Cristina

loans.use: to buy coats

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeurn L. (pictured above) is a weaver. Her husband, Mr. Heng Min, is a farmer and raises cows at home. They have two sons and three daughters. Three are married, one has full-time employment and another one is a tailor. 

Mrs. Saroeurn L. is requesting another loan of $500. She will use $200 of the loan to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business and the remaining $300 for buying fabrics for her daughter’s tailoring business.

loans.use: to buy weaving materials for her weaving business and fabrics for her daughter’s tailoring business.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladis; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de jora que es un ingrediente que se usa para hacer chicha (bebida a base de maíz) y también trabaja en un salón de belleza, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de salón de belleza y venta de jora. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar jora al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gladis, age 38, lives with her partner and has three children. She is a member of the communal bank “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”'; the bank is located in the district of Andahuaylillas of the Quispicanchis province which is part of the Cusco department.

Gladis divides her time between her daily activities with the business of selling jora, which is a corn-based product used for a preparation of chicha (a traditional corn-based drink). She also works in a beauty salon. By means of these activities, Gladis is able to provide for her children. She would like to improve both her beauty salon business and her jora sales. 

Gladis is seeking a loan in order to be able to purchase jora at wholesale prices. She is happy about the loan and is committed to repaying it in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase jora wholesale (jora is a corn-based product used in preparation of a traditional drink)

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María es una mujer laboriosa de 53 años. Está casada con Benjamín de 50  años, el amor de su vida, ambos tienen 6 hijos quienes en busca de un futuro mejor estudian en Lima, la capital del Perú, por eso ella vive sólo con su pareja en la casa que le heredó su madre. Emocionada relata, que desde muy joven se dedica a la siembra de maíz, flor de gladiolo, variedad de verduras, como: alfalfa, arveja y papa. HOy con ayuda de su esposo, se despiertan muy temprano para tener listo la comida del día, y luego inspeccionar y regar los terrenos sembrados así como también cortar pasto para alimentar los cuyes que crían, ya que estos animales los comercializa desde gazapos (cuyes pequeños recién destetados), hasta reproductores. La comercialización se realiza en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, en donde vende un promedio de 40 a 50 unidades de cuyes durante los días jueves y domingo, obteniendo un promedio de S/. 15 soles de ganancia por cada uno. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es haber sido muy perseverante pues gracias a eso pudo cubrir la educación de sus hijos, quienes ahora cuentan con una carrera profesional, además todos los integrantes de la familia viven cómodamente. Para el futuro desea comprar reses, así como cuyes, entre otros animales menores, y para poder alimentarlos sembrará hectáreas de alfalfa, ya que es una planta que sirve de forraje para estos animales. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva esperanza”, este es el décimo crédito con MFP, donde manifiesta estar tranquila de trabajar en un banco comunal  de confianza. Con el crédito está pensando comprar 3 bolsas de semilla de arverja para su siguiente siembra; y para asegurar una buena cosecha comprará también sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en: María is a hard-working woman of 53. She is married to Benjamín, age 50, the love of her life. Together they have 6 children, who in search of a better future are studying in Lima, the capital of Peru. Because of this, María lives alone with her husband in the house she inherited from her mother. With emotion, she recalls that since she was very young, she has worked planting corn, gladiolus flowers, and a variety of vegetable crops such as alfalfa, peas and potatoes. Today with the help of her husband, she gets up very early to prepare the food for the day, and later inspect and water the planted fields or also to cut grass to feed the guinea pigs which they raise to sell starting from "gazapos" (little recently weaned guinea pigs) until they are of reproductive age. They sell their products in the city's wholesale market, where they sell an average of 40 to 50 guinea pigs on Thursdays and Sundays, obtaining an average of 15 Peruvian soles of profit for each one. What she likes most about her work is the fact that she has been very persevering, since thanks to this she was able to pay for the education of her children, who are now on professional career tracks. In addition, all of the family members live comfortably. In the future, she would lke to buy a larger number of cows, as well as guinea pigs and other small animals, and to maintain them she will plant some hectares of alfalfa. She belongs to the “Nueva Esperanza” ["New Hope"] communal bank, and this is her tenth loan with MFP. She has peace of mind working with a communal bank she can trust, and she mentions that their savings are very well taken care of. María is beginning to plant peas, and because of this with the money from the loan she is thinking about buying 3 bags of seeds, and to ensure a good harvest she will also buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy 3 bags of pea seeds and sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane, a 33-year-old divorced woman with four children, rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in fresh foods for nine months. She started her business with 300,000 UGX and now has 600,000 UGX as working capital. Her hardship is low sales. Her vision is to own a food store and to buy a plot of land in town. Jane needs this loan to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.use: To buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.name: Rommel David

texts.en:
Roomel David is married with two children, ages 7 and 14.  For the last ten years he has owned and operated a jewelry making business. After working for another jeweler years ago, Roomel David saved his earnings and bought a spot for his own shop in the central market where he can create and sell his jewelry.   The loan proceeds will be used to buy additional materials to make more products to sell.  

Roomel David’s dream is to construct a house on a piece of land he already owns and to provide a bright future for his children.

loans.use: to buy additional materials to make more products to sell.

loans.name: Leticia Elizabeth

texts.es: Leticia Elizabeth de 33 años de edad, habita en casa propia con su madre de 67 años y sus dos pequeñas hijas las cuales ya se encuentran cursando sus primeros años de estudio. Leticia posee un puesto en la zona central donde reside en el cual  vende ricas e higiénicas tortillas. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la venta de tortillas razón por la cual ya es muy conocida en la zona y los clientes la prefieren por brindar un buen servicio y sobre todo higiene y  buenos precios en sus tortillas. Ella es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora cada día se pregunta cómo puede mejorar sus ingresos para poder dar  a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.  Ha decidido  ampliar su negocio y ofrecer a sus clientes no solo tortillas sino también bebidas como agua y jugos, de esta manera quiere a traer a más clientes que le permitan mejorar sus ingresos. Esto le dio la idea de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar variedad de bebidas e invertir en el mantenimiento de la venta de tortillas. Tiene mucha Fe que tendrá éxito con la decisión tomada y sus condiciones de vida poco a poco se irán trasformando de manera positiva.
texts.en:
Leticia Elizabeth is 33 years old.  She lives in her own home together with her 67 year-old mother and her two young daughters who are in their first years of school.

Leticia owns a stall in the central zone where she lives.  She sells delicious and hygienically-prepared tortillas.  She has been selling tortillas for many years and so she is very well known in the area.  Her customers are loyal to her business because she provides a good service, prepares her tortillas hygienically and sells them at a good price.

Leticia is a tenacious and entrepreneurial woman.  Every day she asks herself how she can improve her income so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life.  She has decided to expand her business and start offering her customers not only tortillas but also drinks such as water and juice.  In this way, she hopes to attract more customers which will enable her to improve her income.  She had the idea of requesting a loan from INTEGRAL so that she could buy a variety of drinks and invest in her tortilla business.  Leticia has a lot of faith that the decision she has taken will prove successful and that her living conditions will gradually change for the better.

loans.use: to buy a variety of drinks and invest in her tortilla business

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa is a 28-year-old housewife, who is also a mother of four children. Her husband Mahmoud sells carpets and household products for a living. Mohammad doesn’t own a shop. Instead he brings all his goods every day to a specific location in the market and starts selling regardless the weather  on that day.

So Wafaa wanted to support her husband and help him with his business by applying for this loan so they can have a shop in the future to display and sell all of his goods.

Since Wafaa is a conservative person, she asked for her husband to appear in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: To get her husband a shop to sell carpets in.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en: For the past three years Alejandro, a 79-year-old married father of seven, has owned his own small grocery store which sells a variety of products. His dream is to improve his grocery store by offering an even larger variety of goods. A hardworking man committed to making all of the necessary payments on time, Alejandro is asking for a loan so that he can purchase a wider range of soft drinks, beers, and breads for his store.

loans.use: to buy more products such as soft drinks and bread for his grocery store.

loans.name: Paulin

texts.es: El señor Paulin y su esposa son una pareja muy trabajadora que con esfuerzo y dedicación construyeron su patrimonio para ofrecer a sus 3 hijos. La casa que el tiene es muy pequeña por lo que desea terminar de construir un cuarto en su vivienda para tener mas espacio y vivir con mayor comodidad. Para esto requiere comprar material de construcción para realizar su proyecto.
texts.en: Paulin and his wife are a very hard-working couple who, with effort and commitment, built a home to offer their three children as an inheritance.  Their home is very small and Paulin would like to finish building an extra room so that they can have more space and live more comfortably.  He needs to buy building supplies in order to carry out his project.

loans.use: to finish building a room

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca tiene la edad de 70 años"pero un corazon de 18 años", solo estudio primaria ya que cuando ella era pequeña los padres preferian enseñar a sus hijas las labores del hogar y dar estudios a los varones,es soltera y tuvo dos hijos los cuales ya estan casados.

ella nos platica que desde hace un poco mas de 8 meses abrio una pequeña tiendita de abarrotes en la parte de enfrente de su casa que da la caretera para poder ganar un poco de dinero extra para salir adelante, Doña franciasca es una señora muy alegre y entusiasta y nos dice que tiene muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante, ella ademas de tener su tienda de abarrotes vende comida a los viajeros que se lo piden y asi puede tener mas entradas de dinero para seguir ayudandose.

 ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de galletas, dulces, refrescos, jugos, arroz, frijol, aceite, papel higienico, sal, arinas, cerillos y  jabon para resurtir su tienda ademas de un poco de insumos chiles, tomates, cebollas y  carne para la preparacion de su comida.

ella nos dice que espera que Dios le continue prestando vida para continuar trabajando y salir adelante, tambien envia un saludo a las personas que han hecho posible su cedito y que le dan la oportunidad de continuar trabajando para ganarse la vida.
texts.en:
Francisca is 70 years old but has “the heart of an 18-year-old.” She only completed elementary school because when she was a little girl parents preferred to teach girls housework and send the boys to school.  She’s single and has two children who are married.

She tells us that a little over 8 months ago she opened a small grocery store in the front part of her house that faces the highway to earn a little extra money to continue moving forward.  Francisca is a very cheerful, enthusiastic person and she tells us that she very much wants to work and get ahead.  Besides her grocery store, she also sells food to travelers who request it and this is an extra source of income that helps her get by.

She needs this loan to buy cookies, candy, soft-drinks, juice, rice, beans, oil, toilet paper, salt, flour, matches and soap to restock the store and also a few ingredients like chilies, tomatoes, onions and meat for her meal preparations.

She tells us that she hopes God will continue to give her life to continue to work and get ahead.  She also sends greetings to people who have made her loan possible which gives her the opportunity to continue to work and to earn a living.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en: Josphat is a business man.  He is 22 years old and single. He has been managing a business selling shoes to make a living. In the next 5 years, he wants to become successful in his business. His dream is to expand his business into wholesale.  Josphat is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan  shillings to buy leather materials for shoe making. He is thankful to Faulu Kenya for helping him to improve his business through financial support.

loans.use: To buy leather material for shoe making

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 38 years old and married with one child currently going to school. Josie works very hard to provide for them.

Josie runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Josie has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Josie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, de 50 años es una mujer valiente. Está casada desde hace 33 años con Gerardo, su esposo. Ambos tienen 7 hijos de los cuales falleció uno, ahora vive con 3 de ellos en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Punray. Siempre tiene una sonrisa en los labios. Con esa alegría comienza el día, pues ella se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de carne de toda variedad, el cual comercializa a los pobladores de la zona de Huacuas, donde tiene clientes fijos. Los que también le pidieron ropa de toda variedad, por ello Victoria, compró mercadería de la capital para revenderlo; ahí obtiene buenas ganancias, pues la zona es alejada y no existen comercios. Además ella aprovecha el frío del lugar; tejiendo faldas y chompas a base de lana, los que comercializa de la misma manera. Le gusta mucho su negocio; por ello espera ahorrar lo suficiente para poder tener una tienda equipada con las necesidades de los pobladores de la zona andina. Confiesa que su pasatiempo es la agricultura; siembra arveja en su terreno agrícola, pero en poca cantidad. “No debo dejar la costumbre”, afirma. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Punray avanzando” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con su objetivo. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.  Victoria de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de madejas de lana para sus tejidos y ropa de toda variedad para su negocio.
texts.en:
50-year-old Victoria is a courageous woman.  She has been married to her husband Gerardo for 33 years and the couple had seven children.  One of their children died and they now live together with three of them in their own home which is located in the small village of Punray.

Victoria always has a smile on her face.  She starts each day in this cheerful way.  Victoria's business is buying and selling all kinds of meat.  She sells her meat to the people who live in Huacuas area and has regular customers there.  Her customers also ask her for all kinds of clothes.  Victoria therefore bought merchandise in the capital city to re-sell.  This makes her good profits as the area is quite remote and there aren't many stores.  She makes the most of the fact that the place is cold and knits skirts and sweaters.  She also sells these.  Victoria really enjoys her business and hopes to save up enough money to open a store equipped with things that people in this Andean region need.  She confesses that her hobby is agriculture.  She sows peas on her plot of land but only in small quantities.  "I mustn't lose the habit" she says.

Victoria is a member of the "Punray Avanzando" community bank and this is her ninth loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive your support so that she can continue achieving her goals.  For her part, she pledges to be punctual in making her loan repayments.  With your support, Victoria will invest the money she has requested in buying skeins of yarn for knitting and all kinds of clothes for her business.

loans.use: to buy skeins of yarn in different colors and a range of clothes

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
To overcome poverty, Marivic helps her husband in managing their Auto Repair shop to earn income. She is 37 years old and has two school-aged children. Due to financial difficulty, they want to strengthen their business to increase their income and satisfy their basic necessities. They have operated their business for almost 17 years now and usually earn a profits of P10,000 a month which they utilize for their food and allowances for their children.

Marivic is requesting a loan of P12,000 to buy welding rods, oxygen, and paint to be used in the repair shop to provide better service. They believe that they can strengthen the business as they continue to work and make improvements on it.

loans.use: to buy welding rods, oxygen, and paint to be used in the repair shop.

location.town: Brgy. Poblacion, North, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.ru: Хусейн женат имеет троих детей. Жена домохозяйка. 14 лет он занимается торговлей. Начинал он с торговли мелочами. А сейчас у него свой магазин с товарами ежедневного потребления. У него в магазине и продовольственные и промышленные товары на которые есть спрос. Товары он закупает оптом. В предпраздничные дни следует пополнить ассортимент товаров. Он хочет получить займ для пополнения товаров магазина к зиме и к праздникам. Он надеется получить займ. Спасибо.
texts.en: Huseyn is married and has three children.  His wife is a homemaker.  He has been involved in retail sales for 14 years.  He started with selling trinkets, but now has his own grocery store.  Huseyn has food and household products in his store, all of which are in demand.  He buys his merchandise wholesale.  Huseyn needs to refill his goods assortment in anticipation of holidays.  He wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of merchandise for the store, for winter and holidays.  He hopes to get this loan.  Thank you.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the holidays

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Don Gerardo tiene su negocio de venta de artículos escolares y fotocopia en su casa de habitación, el tiene cinco años de tener esta actividad comercial, el trabaja todos los días de la semana. 
Don Gerardo visita las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un préstamo para invertir en su negocio. El es casado y padre de familia de dos hijos los cuales se encuentran en el colegio.
El préstamo lo va ha invertir en compra de un toldo y dos mesas metálicas con sus sillas esto para poner lo que es venta de comida rápidas y cafetería para sus clientes que lo visitan.
texts.en:
Gerardo has his business selling school supplies and photocopies in his home.  He has had this commercial activity for five years.  He works every day of the week.

Gerardo is visiting the offices of CEPRODEL to request a loan to invest in his business.  He is married and the father of a family of two children in school.

He is going to invest the loan in buying an awning and two metal chairs and tables to set up a fast-food cafe for his customers who visit him.

loans.use: to buy an awning and two metal tables and chairs.

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en: Cerila, a 28-year- married mother of two, lives in the Philippines where she has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. In business for five years, she is requesting a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages. A member of HSPFI since 2011, Cerila hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Esperanza, tiene 32 años, esta casada y es madre de 2 hijos, vende abarrotes en las ferias, es socia de Finca desde hace mas de 1 año, con el primer crédito que recibió compró abarrotes y aumento su mercadería, desde que ingresó a Finca empezó ahorrar, su negocio esta creciendo, le gusta las capacitaciones porque todas las charlas que recibe lo comparte con su familia, el prñestamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de galletas y golosinas. Su meta es comprar un carro para poder transportar su mercadería y seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of Esperanza Communal Bank.  She is 36 years old and married, and the mother of two children.

She sells groceries in the markets.  She has been a member of Finca for more than a year.  With the first loan she received she bought groceries and increased her merchandise.  Since she became a member of Finca she began to save.  Her business is growing.  She likes the training because she shares with her family all the talks she hears. 

She will use the loan she is requesting to buy cookies and sweets.

Her goal is to buy a car to be able to transport her merchandise and continue growing.

loans.use: to buy cookies and sweets.

loans.name: Amua Shg Group

texts.en:
Alice is the facilitator of the Amua SHG group. Alice and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Alice joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Alice had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alice was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Alice will invest in livestock rearing and educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Amua SHG group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Alice with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Manie

texts.en: Mamie is 32 years old and lives in Airport community. She is married with four children between the ages of 7 and 15 years old, two of which are currently in school. All of her children live at home. Her husband is a security man and for the past eight years she has been operating a salon in her community. She enjoys the flow of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more artificial hair, hair spray, and supplies for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more artificial hair, hair spray, and supplies for her business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 35-year-old married woman with seven children, five of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food at a food stall in Yambio, South Sudan for five years.
Esther is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Seab

texts.en:
Seab, 53, is married, and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer. Additionally, she is involved in fattening up pigs to sell in order to generate more income to support the family. Her husband is a nylon rope vendor. Her twenty-year-old daughter is a garment worker. 

In order to improve her family's finances, Seab is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more nylon rope for her husband to sell to his clients. In the future, she would like to invest more money to expand her husband's business, build a bathroom and support her children to study until they get Bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more nylon rope for her husband to sell to his clients.

loans.name: Judith Gined

texts.es: Judith Gined es una persona que se reconoce por ser muy trabajadora y muy dedicada a su familia. Desde hace algún tiempo su esposo la abandonó y por tanto quedó como una madre soltera cabeza de familia de su hijo que actualmente tiene 6 años. Judith Gined siempre había querido aportar a los ingresos del hogar, por lo que aprendió la actividad de la venta de mercancía y también la de criar y vender cerdos. En esta segunda actividad es que se viene desempeñando desde hace aproximadamente 3 años, y gracias a la cual genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Judith Gined tiene el gran sueño de que su hijo pueda acceder a una buena educación, y que ella le pueda brindar todo lo que el necesite, pues actualmente solo genera ingresos suficientes como para cubrir vagamente las necesidades básicas de su hijo. Judith Gined espera que su negocio siga creciendo, por lo que trabaja fuertemente todos los días. En vísperas de vender sus próximos cerdos, Judith Gined requiere de la compra del cuido para alimentar los cerdos, sin embargo, no cuenta con el capital suficiente para la compra de este cuido, por lo que aspira a que un crédito le permita acceder a la compra de este cuido y seguir obteniendo los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Judith Gined espera que sus ventas aumenten en los próximos meses, y con este dinero espera ahorrar para que su hijo pueda gozar en un futuro de una estabilidad económica mayor a la que ella le ha podido brindar hasta ahora.
texts.en: Judith Gined is a person who is known for being hardworking and dedicated to her family.  A while ago, her husband left her, so she was left to be like a single mother who is the head of her family with her son who is currently 6 years old.  Judith Gined has always wanted to contribute to the family income, that is why she learned how to sell merchandise and also to raise and sell pigs.  She has been doing this second activity for the approximately 3 years, and thanks to this work, she makes the necessary income to sustain her home.  Judith Gined has a big dream that her son will be able to have access to a good education, and that she will be able to offer everything that he needs to him.  Right now she only makes enough money to barely cover the basic needs of her son.  Judith Gined hopes that her business continues to grow, which is why she works hard everyday.  In hopes of selling her next pigs, Judith Gined wants to buy care to feed the pigs.  However, she does not have enough money to buy this care.  This is why she is hoping that a loan will allow her to buy this care and continue obtaining the necessary income to cover her household costs.  Judith Gined hopes that her sales will increase in the following months, and she wants to save this money so that her son can enjoy a more financially secure future compared to the one that she has been able to offer him up until now.

loans.use: buy the necessary care to raise her pigs, so she can later sell them at a good price.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida has been successful in her food business and she has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC. Aida is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital and to purchase paint for the cafeteria. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Aida from GDMPC. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to use as additional capital and to purchase paint for the cafeteria.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Steve

texts.en: Steve is a 31 years old young Tanzanian living with his wife and two children. He is determined to live a model life within his community. As part of his dedication to avoid cutting trees for firewood (cooking energy), Steve is determined to install a biodigester. He believes that by doing this his community will be influenced to imitate him and finally they can save trees which are quickly disappearance due to deforestation. Moreover, Steve will be able to save his family earnings that would have gone to buying kerosene and fertilizer (biodigester produces a very nice fertilizer). He has requested TAHUDE Foundation to provide him with a loan of USD 625 to purchase/install the biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase/install a 6 cubic meter biodigester.

loans.name: Saru

texts.en:
Saru is 34 years-old .  She is Married and has 2 children aged 17 and 4.  Many years ago, she established  her statues making business.  Working 7 days a week and 7 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys raw material for her business.  In the future, Saru plans to uplift the economic conditon of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 
  Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts.  Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity.  Terra cotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills.  Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand tool finishing.  In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone.  With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume.  This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin.

loans.use: to buys raw material for her business

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Greetings from Hebron, Palestine!! In the picture is Huda, who's 42 years old and from the town of Doura. Huda is a single woman who works in an insurance company. She also has run a farm for 15 years, and she has one full time employee and another part time one. She needs the loan to buy new seeds and to fix the existing water pipelines. One of the challenges Huda faces is the number of competitors in the town of Doura. She hopes to expand and enhance the farm production level in the future.

This loan will enable Huda to enhance the production level and fix the broken pipelines before entering the coming dry summer months. Huda thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To fix existing water pipelines for her farm

loans.name: To

texts.en: Mrs. To is a married mother of four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 49 years old, and t wo of her children is currently in school. She has a fishing business. She has requested a loan to purchase additional materials for her fishing business. She has been in this business for 15 years now. She would like to build and expand her business so she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is single and an active member of Kandisi Wisdom Women Group. She has been a member of Women Fighting Aids in Kenya (WOFAK) since 2003.She trains the youth in HIV/AIDS related matter to minimize the spread of this scourge.

She has a small retail shop where he sells phone accessories, and operates a payphone. As a trainer with WOFAK, she is given an allowance of USD.4 per day 3 days a week. Late last year, she had her business in Nairobi unfortunately; thieves broke into her shop and cleaned it.

loans.use: The loan applied for will be used for re-stocking the shop to catch up with the demand in the area.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.en:
Married and the mother of three children, Mrs. Akossiwa E. also cares for her younger brother. Her husband is a farmer. Mrs. E. is known in the community for her doughnuts, which are recognized for their quality. Despite the fact that she is illiterate, she successfully managed and repaid her first loan. Her cleanliness is greatly appreciated and increases her clientele. In order to increase her daily doughnut production, she needs further financial means. This is why she is seeking a $600 loan to stock wheat flour, oil, and other necessities for doughnut production.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants, Madame E. Akossiwa a aussi à sa charge son petit fils. L’activité principale de son mari est l’agriculture. Reconnue dans sa localité à travers la fabrication de beignets, Madame E. fait une production de qualité. Malgré son état d’analphabète, elle a eu à gérer son premier crédit qui a été soldé sans incident. La propreté dans son lieu de travail est appréciée de tout le monde et fait accroître sa clientèle. Pour augmenter sa production de beignet quotidienne, elle a besoin de plus moyens financier. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit de $600 pour s’approvisionner en sacs de farine de blé, huile et autres et autres nécessaires à la préparation des beignets.

loans.use: stocking of wheat flour, oil, and other ingredients for doughnut production

loans.name: Nasima

texts.en: Nasima is 40 years old and married with four children. She has four years experience operating her food store, which her son helps her run. She has learned to manage the cash flow, organize the goods, and handle cleaning, packaging and selling her wares. She is excited to begin her first loan cycle so she can restock her store and purchase new items that customers are asking for. She is a hard working woman.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her food store

loans.name: Eliodoro

texts.es:
Eliodoro and his family live in the Achacahi-Tipampa Community (which is about 2 hours from the city of El Alto). He has 5 dairy cows, and he sells his dairy products to PIL Andina (which is a milk plant). He has 4 children of 12, 10, 4 and 2 years of age. The two oldest help take care of the cows. Selling milk is his main source of income to support his family.

The loan will be used towards the purchase of a medium-grade dairy cow which will help increase milk production.

This is their first loan with IMPRO. Their background check shows that they are prime candidates for a loan that will help to improve the quality of their dairy cattle and their production!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Eliodoro y su familia viven en la Comunidad de Achacachi - Tipampa (A dos horas de la ciudad de El Alto). Tienen 5 vacas productoras de leche, que comercializan a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche), tiene 4 hijos de 12, 10, 4 y 2 años de edad y los dos mayores ayudan en la crianza de las vacas; la venta de leche es su fuente de ingreso para la manutención de su familia. Con el crédito comprara una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo y mejorar la calidad del ganado y de su producción.

loans.use: To buy a milking cow

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en: Saidu C. is forty-eight years old and married with five children.  He started his business five years ago, but he is unable to diversify his business due to lack of capital.  Saidu said that with five children all in school, he needs to generate sufficient income for re-investment in the business and meet family expenses, especially school fees.  He is requesting another loan of $350 to increase his stock and plans to purchase better quality clothes to attract more customers.

loans.use: Diversify business by purchasing higher quality merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his restaurant

loans.name: Delma Eugenia

texts.es:
Delma Eugenia is a home maker, a loving wife and mother, and an owner of her own business. Their marriage has given Delma and her husband three children, who they have worked to help progress. Two of the children are of school age, and the oldest helps out in the business.

Approximatly four years ago Delma had to leave behind her life of working only as a housewife, and open a business in the Isreal Lewites market in the city of Managua.
