It was not easy for her in the beginning, as she hadn't yet learned to deal in plastics. Nevertheless, she took the risk for the well being of her family. She began with $800 in capital. Her location is not very well placed, as she must take her products out to display them.

She came up with the idea of opening her business as the need arose to pay bills and to pay for things that her husband's small salary didn't cover. Currently, Delma sells about $80.00 in product per day. Thanks to CEPRODEL, she has been able to improve the infrastructure of her location, and purchase more merchandise. She has been working with CEPRODEL for 2 years, and has a history of 9 loans.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Delma Eugenia es propietaria de su negocio, ama de casa, madre incondicional y esposa dedicada. Tienen tres hijos fruto de su matrimonio a los que en conjunto con su esposo han tratado de sacar adelante. Dos de sus hijos están en edad escolar y el mayor le ayuda en el local.

Hace cuatro años aproximadamente Delma tuvo que abandonar la vida únicamente de ama de casa e iniciar su negocio en el mercado Israel Lewites de la ciudad de Managua. El inicio de su negocio no fue facil pues como todo comienzo ella no manejaba muy bien el asunto de los plásticos, sin embargo aun así se arriesgo por el bienestar de su familia.Comenzó con un capital de U$800.00. Su local no esta muy bien ubicado ya que para exhibir su producto tiene que sacarlo.

La idea de poner su negocio surge debido a la necesidad de sufragar gastos y cubrir necesidades que el salario devengado por su esposo no cubría. Hoy en día Delma vende aproximadamente U$80.00 diarios, gracias a CEPRODEL ha podido ampliar la infraestructura de su local y comprar más mercadería. Tiene 2 años de trabajar con CEPRODEL con un récord de 9 creditos.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Sinorn

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Sinorn, 49, and her husband Mr. Phi Sovan, 50, have been married since 1987. They have four children-- two sons and two daughters. Two of Sinorn’s children are working and the other two are studying. Sinorn and her family live along National Road number five about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. Sinorn has been growing rice since she was married. Her rice farm is about five kilometers from her house. Her husband is also farmer and a moto taxi driver.

Sinorn is requesting her third loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $150. She will use this to purchase fertilizer and pesticide for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticide for growing rice

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.en: U. Ilhom lives in Nau, Tajikistan. He is married and has 4 children. Mr. U. has been a client of the MicroInvest since 2004. He is engaged in a home business of raising and selling livestock. He is a school teacher but he continues working with his father's business of raising livestock. Mr. U. has 10 years experience selling livestock and he dreams of a large herd. Now Mr. U. requests a loan of $625 to purchase mixed fodder.

loans.use: To purchase mixed fodder

loans.name: Magdalena's Upendo Group

texts.en:
Salome P. is 33 years old, married, with three children, ages 17, 15 and 11. Salome owns a small hardware shop that she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 6am to 7pm and can earn a monthly profit of approximately $70 from her sales.

In the past, Salome has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member who has a small business as a food vendor.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in fabric and thread

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha belongs to Las Shipibas Community Bank, located on the corner of Jr. Sáenz Peña and Jr. Tarapacá, in the Calleria District in Ucayali. She is 40 years old and the mother of 5 children. Her husband is a businessman. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to create a food sales business.

She relies on her street food sales, for which she rises at 6 a.m. to prepare breakfast for her children and husband. Afterwards she prepares food, which she sells from 6 p.m. to 1 a.m. With this loan of $750, which she will repay in months, she will little by little, buy provisions for food sales.

Martha is satisfied and pleased about all that she has pursued with her strength and sacrifice, and that she can support household costs, and she is thankful for the support brought by Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Martha pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Shipibas, ubicado en la esquina del Jr Sáenz Peña con el Jr Tarapacá, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años y es madre de 5 hijos, su esposo es comerciante. Martha con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de comida.

En la actualidad ella cuenta un negocio de venta de comida en la calle, para lo cual se levanta a las 6 am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos, y de su esposo luego se dedica a la preparación de sus comidas, que los vende desde las 6 pm hasta la 1 am.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: víveres para la preparación de sus comidas, el cual los invertirá de poco en poco.

Martha esta muy satisfecha y contenta, todo lo que tiene lo consiguió a base de esfuerzo y sacrificio, ahora puede apoyar en los gastos de su hogar, y se siente muy feliz por el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Provisions for food production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase women's clothing to sell in her community

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phạm Thị T., 46 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 2003. Her husband is an injured veteran with a pension of 1,400,000 VND a month. They have 3 children. Two are in college and the youngest one is still in high school. She uses the funds of her loans to invest in raising pigs and brewing rice liquor. By product from liquor brewing is used to feed the pigs. The business earns her 4,000,000 VND a month. That is enough for her to raise her children and cover their college expenses. She is applying for a loan of 6,000,000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Phạm Thị T. 46 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2003, chồng chị là thương binh lương tháng 1.400.000đ, anh chị có 3 người con hiện đang sống cùng gia đình, 2 con lớn đang học đai học, 1 con đang học cấp III. Tham gia Quỹ gia đình chị vay vốn chăn nuôi lợn và nấu riệu, với mô hình làm kinh tế đó gia đình chị đã tiết kiệm được chi phí trong chăn nuôi, bã rượu đươc gia đình tận dụng làm thức ăn cho lợn đó cũng là nguồn thức ăn rất tốt nhiều dinh dưỡng, chăn nuôi thuận lợi kinh tế gia đình phát triển có điều kiện cho các con được học tập đầy đủ. Vòng vốn này gia đình xin vay 6.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và nấu rựou. Thu nhập bình quân. 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Pigs

loans.name: Amriya

texts.ru:
Amirya D. is a resident of Fayzabad district, where she lives with her family. She is married and had five children. In the center of her village, she has a store where she sells hardware. She would like to increase her turnover by taking out a loan that will help her increase her variety of goods and draw in new customers. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva volunteer.

Давлатова Амрия жительница района Файзабад. Живет со своей семьей . Она замужем и миеет пятерых детей. В центре кишлака имеет магазин. Торгует промышленными товарами. Хочет увеличить товарооборот путем получения кредита.Это поможет ей увеличить ассортимент товара и привлечь новых клиентов.Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Goods delivery

loans.name: Kesi's Jambo Nia Group

texts.en:
Kesi is 42 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 5 and 3. She has been a charcoal and soap seller since 1999. Every day, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Kesi now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and soap for re-sale. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Zainab, who owns a shop.

loans.use: To  buy more charcoal and soap for re-sale

loans.name: Pablo Absalón

texts.es: A sus 61 años de edad don Pablo Absalón tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de cereales que el mismo procesa de Maíz, Trigo, avena, cacao, etc., además vende un postre de nombre Arroz en Leche muy popular en nuestra cultura, él está casado y su esposa trabaja en costura, tienen  3 hijos ya mayores de edad los cuales trabajan independientes, Don Pablo inició su negocio hace ya  12 años después de quedarse sin empleo como trabajador de la construcción , su liquidación final fue para el inicio de la inversión de este pequeño negocio, el cual, aduce le llena mucho de satisfacción ya que ha captado una buena clientela que gustan de sus productos. Uno de sus sueños es poder darle mayor seguridad a su casa de habitación por lo que solicita este crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción y poder construir una pared trasera de su casa.
texts.en:
At 61 years of age, Pablo Absalón has a small business selling grains, such as corn, wheat, oats, cocoa, etc. that he himself processes. In addition, he sells a dessert called Arroz en Leche (Rice in Milk) that is very popular in this culture. He is married, his wife is a seamstress and they have three adult children that are working. Don Pablo started his business 12 years ago after finding himself without work in his field of construction. His severance pay was used as the initial investment in this small business, which gives him a lot of satisfaction since he has gained a solid clientele that likes his products. One of his dreams is to be able to provide greater security for his house, for which he is requesting this loan to be able to buy construction materials to build a rear wall for the house.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a rear wall for his house

loans.name: Vich

texts.en:
Mr. Vich E., 47, and his wife, Mrs. Bich Long, 47, live along national road number one, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have eight children: four sons and four daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home. Three children are construction workers; another two children are garment factory workers. One son studies at the local school.

Mr. Vich is a mason and a motor taxi driver. He does his job in his village and nearby his village. His wife stays at home and takes care of their children. The main income in the family is from Vich and his children. He is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike so that his children can drive to work.

loans.use: Purchasing a motorcycle

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana A. is single parent and has 2 children. She received schooling through the primary level.

Nana has been selling a variety of soft drinks at the chapel square in Elmina, Ghana since 1998. Nana uses her income to pay for her children's schooling and utility bills. Nana will use the loan to purchase a larger quantity of soft drinks to sell to her customers. With the bigger profits from her expanded business, Nana plans to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: Purchase larger quantities of soft drinks

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es: El Sr. Ramón tiene 36 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, su esposa es ama de casa y le tiene un niño de 10 años de edad, que esta estudiando la primaria, don Ramón trabaja como guarda de seguridad, anteriormente estuvo sin trabajo le costo encontrar debido a inestabilidad del gobierno, pues estuvo trabajando de ayudante de albañil, y su esposa lavaba y planchaba para ayudar a los gastos del hogar, pero gracias a Dios tengo un trabajo fijo, con el préstamo que esta solicitando lo quiere para infraestructura en la construcción de un muro frontal para tener seguridad con su familia, esta es su cuarta solicitud en Afodenic, lo cual han sido de muchos beneficio por la oportunidad y confianza que le han brindado. A largo plazo  es poder obtener otro trabajo donde pueda ganar mejor, ayudar a su hijo con los estudios.
texts.en:
Ramón is 36 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Laureles Sur in the capital of Managua. His wife is a homemaker, and he has one 10-year old child who is in primary school. Ramón works as a security guard, having previously been unemployed due to political instability. He was working as a construction assistant, and his wife laundered and ironed to help out with the household expenses. However, thanks to God, he found stable employment. With the loan he is requesting, he would like to improve the infrastructure of his house by building a front wall to better secure his family. This is his fourth loan request with Afodenic, loans that have been very beneficial to him for the opportunities and confidence they have provided him with. Long-term, he hopes to obtain other employment that pays better and to help his son with his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies to build a wall.

loans.name: Gloria Teodora

texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Desarrollo (Development) Village Bank. She is 40 years old and has four children. Her common-law husband is currently working in Spain, and sends her money each month for their family. 

Gloria used to sell prepared meals in the city of Ayacucho, but after food prices rose dramatically she decided it wasn’t a very good way to earn a living. Now, Gloria works on her guinea pig farm (guinea pigs are considered a delicacy in Peru). The farm used to belong to Gloria’s mother, who left it to her. Gloria now has her own home on the farm, where she is raising about 150 guinea pigs. She wants to breed even more guinea pigs to expand her business.

Gloria is requesting a loan of 800 soles to buy guinea pigs. Each guinea pig costs 9 or 10 soles, so Gloria should be able to buy 80-90 guinea pigs with the loan. Her goal for the future is to open a store of her own.

loans.use: Buy guinea pigs

loans.name: Mrs. Srorn Chhay  Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank, which is located in Tep Archun village in Kandal province, consists of fourteen people, and they plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Srorn C. is the village bank president. She is a grocer in the local market. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory. She hopes to increase her income in order to provide a better life for the family. She is a 38-year-old widow with a child who is enrolled in the local school. Mrs. Kong Don, who is a group guarantor, is also presented in the picture with the village bank members.

loans.use: To ask loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory.

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun H., 36, and her husband, Mr. Mao KH., 42, were married in 1989 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. One of their children has full-time employment, two children are in school and another one is still young. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number 5 about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.

Savoeun has been selling and planting lotus fruit for over four years. She buys them from her villagers and sells them in the market at Phnom Penh. In addition to selling lotus fruit, she sells fish and grows rice as well. Her husband has been selling beef for three years. He buys cows and sells them to the slaughterhouse.

Savoeun is requesting her first loan of $1000 to purchase a trailer to connect to her motorized hand tiller for carrying rice.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to connect to a motorized hand tiller

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Greetings from Kigali, Rwanda!  Antoinette M. is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company.  She has owned a small shop in the Gasabo district of the capital city for ten years.  Each day she works from 7:00 am to 9:00 pm which allows her to earn a profit of approximately 100,000 Rwandan Francs each month ($200 USD).  She has two employees who help her run the shop.  

Antoinette is requesting a loan of 500,000 Rwandan Francs to be paid back over a period of eight months.  She will use the loan to buy a refrigerator for her shop so that she can sell cold drinks.  

Antoinette is 58 years old, widowed, and has three children.  In addition, she cares for four dependants.  She hopes that this loan will help her increase her monthly profit so it will be easier for her to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase a new refrigerator

loans.name: Borhanudin

texts.en: Borhanudin is the son of F.. He lives in the 6th district of Kabul, Afghanistan, with his six-member family. He wants to repair his house to be able to live comfortably. He has requested an individual loan of 50000 afghani for the term of 12 months to buy construction materials. He is happy that through the loan process one can solve his/her problems.

loans.use: buying construction materials

loans.name: Fiorella

texts.es: Fiorella tiene 21 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una casa arrendada. Desde hace 6 meses vende verduras, la idea de implementar este negocio se la dio una de sus tías, para que ella pueda generar más ingresos ante sus necesidades económicas. Cada día trabaja de preferencia en las mañanas porque en este horario tiene más clientes y por las tardes  se dedica enteramente a la atención de sus pequeños hijos. Lo bueno de su trabajo es que sólo  ocupa medio tiempo y le permite atender los asuntos de su casa, además tiene buenas ganancias, con las que poco a poco se ha propuesto hacer crecer su negocio hasta que sea más solvente. Es la segunda vez que Fiorella tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy agradecida por lo que ha logrado, ya que en su banco comunal aprende muchas cosas. Fiorella va a comprar más mercadería, consistente en varios sacos de papa, zanahoria y otras verduras.
texts.en:
Fiorella is 21 years old, lives with her husband and her 2 children in a rented home. She has sold vegetables for 6 months. One of her aunts gave her the idea to start this business so that she could generate more income to address her financial needs. Each day she prefers to work in the mornings because on this schedule she has more clients. During the afternoons, she dedicates herself entirely to caring for her young children. What’s good about her work is that it only takes half the day, and it allows her to attend to household matters. Additionally, she has good earnings with which, little by little, she has proposed to grow her business until it is more solvent. This is the second time that Fiorella has requested a loan with MFP. She is very grateful for what she has achieved, given that she learns many things in her community bank. Fiorella is going to buy more merchandise, consisting of various sacks of potatoes, carrots and other vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en: Nuon K. is twenty-nine years old and lives in Pursat province in Cambodia where she has owned a plot of land since 1979. She grows all kinds of crops, and plants twice a year. She is a good mother to five children, all of whom attend school. Her husband helps her in the farming business. Nuon will use the loan to pay for plowing and to grow a potato crop.

loans.use: To pay for plowing and to grow potatoes

loans.name: Nimatou

texts.fr: Y. Nimatou est née vers 1968 à Agbalilamè. Nimatou est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Nimatou a actuellement la charge de tous les enfants parce que son mari est malade et n’est plus capable de subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Nimatou vend des divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, etc.) dans une petite boutique construite devant sa maison. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Nimatou fait ses achats. Pour faire agrandir de façon considérable son activité  et pour mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Nimatou sollicite le soutient financier de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Y. Nimatou was born around 1968 in Agbalilamè. She is married and the mother of four. She currently has all the children in her care because her husband is ill and is no longer capable to providing for the family. Nimatou sells various goods: candy, cookies, canned foods (milk, sardines, tomatoes), sugar, pasta, soaps for the laundry, dishes, and bath, etc. At Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin, she makes her purchases. To have her business grow considerably, and to do better in satisfying her customers, she's requesting financial support from ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 boxes of canned milk, a box of powdered milk, a box of sugar, 3 boxes of soap, 2 boxes of canned tomatoes, a half-box of sardines, a dozen straighteners, a dozen shampoos, 2 sacks of rice (50 kg each)

loans.name: Naseem Tariq Mahmood Group

texts.en:
Naseem baji is married to T. M. and they have lived in the city of Lahore, Pakistan, for the past ten years. Lahore is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi food. Naseem baji is a very hardworking lady. She operates a business sewing clothes in order to share the financial burden with her husband. He works in a factory on a monthly wage and his income is not sufficient to meet their expenses. Naseem baji is applying for a loan to buy cosmetics because she wants to start a cosmetics-selling business as sewing clothes is a very time-intensive trade.

Asmat baji and Bilquis baji each want a loan to buy beams for their shuttering business.

About group loans
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to start a cosmetic-selling business

loans.name: Abundia

texts.en:
Mrs. Abundia D. is from Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old and is married with four children.

Due to financial insufficiency, she decided to engage in a sari-sari (variety) store so as to be of assistance in family finances, specifically in their daily basic needs. She started with minimal capital. A friend told her about Paglaum MPC - its program and services. Therefore, she decided to become a full-pledged member in August 2008.

Now, she has obtained the loan of PHP 12,000 as additional capital for her sari-sari store. She admitted that it helps a lot with their necessities. She dreams someday that the business will expand, that she will have a bigger and concrete store, that she will send their children to school and that they will live life with an improved standard of living.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Muidinjodja

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Шодмонов продолжает расширять свой бизнес. В ассортимент товаров он добавил подростковую одежду. Раньше он ездил за товаром в ближайшие города Согдийской области, а сейчас привозит товар из ближнего зарубежья , за это он благодарен кредиторам за поддержку в его бизнесе.На запрашиваемый займ он хочет закупить подростковой обуви.
texts.en:
S. continues to expand his business. He added adolescent clothing to his merchandise selection. Previously, he used to go to nearby towns in the Sogd district for his merchandise, but now brings the merchandise from nearest foreign countries. He is grateful to the creditors for supporting his business. He wants to use this loan to buy adolescent shoes.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of adolescent shoes

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: Rosa Argentina G. O. tiene 32 años de edad. Ella tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es un comedor. El negocio empezó hace 10 años, ya que inicio vendiendo comida en su habitación, y por los escasos recursos económicos enfrentaba esto impedía elaborar una amplia variedad de comidas, debido a estas circunstancias  tenía que prestar el dinero a una amiga y así incrementar sus productos. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, frutas, vegetales. Su deseo es proporcionarle  mejoras  a su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa Argentina G. O. is 32 years old, has 2 children, and runs a diner. The business started 10 years ago, when she started selling food in her room. However, scarce economic resources that she encountered impeded her from elaborating her variety of food options. Due to these circumstances, she had to give money to a friend and in that way increase her food products. The loan is for working capital for the purchase of rice, beans, sugar, oil, fruits and vegetables. Her wish to to provide improvement to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Captal

loans.name: Luci

texts.es: Luci tiene 42 años, vive con su pareja, quien es su principal apoyo. Con ellos también viven sus 3 hijos, que ya son adultos y trabajan. Ella se dedica a la venta de gallinas, plátanos y granos en general, los cuales lleva a vende en el mercado de su localidad, pero en caso de que le sobrase mercadería, la lleva a vender por los distintos lugares de su zona de forma ambulante. Luci se ha establecido un horario de trabajo, que es de 6 de la mañana a 6 de la tarde y ella misma es responsable de cumplirlo. Por otro lado, su pareja se dedica al transporte de pasajeros con el motocarro que compró Luci, mientras ella sólo se encarga de administrar las ganancias y su cónyuge vela por el cuidado mecánico de su vehículo. Hace 8 años que Luci tiene sus propios negocios y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sentirse útil, además que con las ganancias logra generar el dinero necesario para solventar los gastos y fortalecer la economía de su hogar. Este es su 6to crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que todos los integrantes son honestos y muy solidarios. Con el dinero solicitado comprará repuestos para mandar a reparar su motocarro y también comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería.

loans.use: Reparación de su motocarro e incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Ma'ali

texts.en:
Ma'ali is a woman with a whole lot of dreams to move ahead. Each day, she works hard by doing her best embroidery for each of her clients who are repeat customers. She has been doing this for many years -- since she was a little girl. Ma'ali now lives with her husbend in Palestine. She works while taking care of her two children who give her all the motivation to move ahead. 

She will continue to work with the sole purpose of providing a better future for her family. She is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase more colored thread and fabrics, the basic components of her embroideries. Let's support this young mother who works hard to keep her dreams alive in her mind and in her heart.

loans.use: Purchase more colored thread and fabrics

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is married to Jimmy P. Sr. She is already 35 years old and was a mother of three children: Jaylord - 14 years old; Jimmy P. Jr. - 10 years old and Jestony - 4 years old. She hopes to give their three children with a proper education which they will be used in searching for better jobs someday. Catalina and husband then work very hard for the fulfillment of their ambition for their children to have in the future. 

Hog raising is being manage by Catalina to earn income while her husband manages their upland farming business.  Catalina also sometimes sells vegetables in their village to generate additional income. Her desire to improve her business motivates her to request for a loan of PHP6, 000 from the KIVA lenders. She is hoping that she could avail the loan amount she is requesting for her business to grow further.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Keit

texts.en: Keit S., 31, is a farmer who lives with her husband and four of her children. Living in the Kampong Cham, she typically makes US$2 every day. Her husband, pictured here, is a local doctor. He sells medicines and treats an illness from house to house. He earns approximately US$6 each day. Keit S. is asking for a loan of US$1000 her husband needs to purchase medicines and medical equipments.

loans.use: Buy medicines

loans.name: Elvera

texts.en: Elvera A. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 55 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Elvera owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Elvera joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Elvera is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Filiga

texts.en:
Filiga T. is a 43-year-old woman living in the town of Alamutu E. She is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Filiga owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling ice cream in the local community. Filiga has been engaged in this business for over 1 year and earns approximately 300 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Filiga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Filiga is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Filiga plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Celidey Del Socorro

texts.en:
Celidey’s business consists of selling used shoes. She sells the shoes from her house just outside of Managua and also from the central market in Jinotepe, which is roughly 20 minutes away. She is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL to buy more shoes. The shoes all arrive from the United States. People want the shoes that look new, she said, so before putting them in the store she scrubs all the shoes until they look as clean as possible. 

Celidey has been in the shoe business for six years now. This is her first loan with CEPRODEL. She is hoping the loan will help her increase her inventory and thus increase the size of her business. Celidey is 37 years old. She married with two daughters. Both of her daughters, ages 13 and 17, are in school.

loans.use: To buy used shoes to sell

loans.name: Anchata

texts.fr:
Madame Anchata M. a 32 ans, marié et mère de quatre enfants, elle réside avec son époux et leurs enfants au quartier Noumouso de la ville de Kadiolo (dans la troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Anchata M. fait la commercialisation du beurre de karité et de tubercules  il y a environ quatre ans. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de son beurre de karité.
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de collaborer  avec  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant  2 ans. 
Après  trois prêts tous remboursés correctement, elle sollicite son quatrième prêt pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acheter,  6 sacs de 100kg de noix de karité et 2 sacs de 100kg de patates.
 Elle s’approvisionne à Kadiolo ville les jours de foire et souvent dans les villages environnants. Ces noix sont d’abord transformées en beurre de  karité avant d’être revendues.  
Ses produits sont vendus  à domicile  et au marché de la ville de Kadiolo les jours de foire, en gros, au comptant à une clientèle composée essentiellement de forains (Sikassois).
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 19.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, payer les intérêts de son prêt et épargner le reste.
texts.en:
Mrs. Anchata M. is 32 years old, married and the mother of four children. She lives with her husband and their children in the Noumouso district of the town of Kadiolo (in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Anchata M. has been selling shea butter and tubers for around four years. She is in great demand from her customers because of the quality of her shea butter. In order to satisfy increasing customer demand, she decided to collaborate with the microfinance company, Soro Yiriwaso, two years ago. Having repaid three loans punctually, she is asking for a fourth loan to increase her working capital in order to buy six 100kg bags of shea nuts and two 100kg bags of potatoes. She stocks up in the town of Kadiolo on fair days and often in the surrounding villages. The nuts are firstly made into shea butter before being sold on. Her products are sold wholesale for cash at home and at the market in Kadiolo on fair days to customers who are mainly fairground workers (Sikassois). With this loan she plans to make an average monthly profit of 19,000 FCFA which will be used principally to increase her working capital and pay the interest on her loan; she will save anything that is left.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shea nuts

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 43, sells sarongs, laces, and bags at retail prices to her customers in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria, where she lives. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. Elizabeth is married and has five children. She is a client of LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization), which is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN, which will be used to purchase more sarongs, laces, and bags to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs, laces, and bags to sell

loans.name: Jani

texts.es:
La Sra. Jani, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Golondrinas II”,  Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 28 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella.

Anteriormente, Jani se dedicaba a la Venta de Productos de Belleza. Sus ganas de salir adelante, con sus propios medios le han valido para implementar su propio negocio de Alquiler de habitaciones, ubicada en su misma casa.  

En la actualidad cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada, que vienen de otras zonas por estudio o trabajo. Sus ganancias los obtiene cada fin de mes, con los pagos de sus habitaciones, nos cuenta que es muy responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así e implementarse en otro tipo de negocio. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará accesorios, para modificar los servicio higiénicos (baños y duchas) de los cuartos y valdes de pintura, para dar una mejor infraestructura a sus habitaciones.

Jani, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante y asegurarse una vejez tranquila y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Jani is a customer of the Communal Bank “Las Golondrinas II" in the Tarapoto District of San Martin Province. She is 28, married and has a son who is still her dependent. Jani used to sell beauty products. However, her will to prosper on her own has inspired her to set up her business of room rentals, located in her own home. She has an established clientele who come from other areas of the country to study or work. She receives her earnings at the end of the month from the payment of the rental fees. She tells us that she is very responsible with her payments and plans to start another type of business. With this loan of 1500 soles, she will buy bathroom accessories (for the toilets and showers) and buckets of paint to modify and improve the infrastructure of the rooms. Jani feels she is full of strength to continue working in order to ensure herself a peaceful retirement. She is very thankful for the Manuela Ramos movement for contributing to the fulfillment of her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Wright, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Housing-construction materials

loans.name: Kyatoko Group, Rukungiri

texts.en: Bosco A., who appears in the small photo is also in the big photo and he is the leader of his lending group in Rukungiri. He is 41 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom are in school. He also takes care of two orphans. Bosco is a businessman with a grocery store in Kyatoko trading center that has run for 13 years. He buys and stocks fresh produce, such as vegetables, matooke (a plantain dish), Irish potatoes and so on. From his transactions, he is able to make 100,000 UGX as weekly profit. This enables him to take care of his family and pay his children’s school fees. Bosco needs a loan to buy more produce for resale.

loans.use: To buy more produce for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel S. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children.  To make a living, Maribel owns and operates a a food stall in her local community.  Maribel has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In February 2009, Maribel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI.  Maribel is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 4th loan from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family income. 
--------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is happy to share that her business is currently going well. She is a 39-year-old rice farmer. She is married and has three children. Her oldest child is 11 years old. 

She wants to maintain her farm’s good condition, so she spends her time cultivating it and making sure it is free of pests and weeds. She also needs additional inputs for her rice farm, so she applied for a loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner. She will buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs with her loan.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita B. is a 66 year-old married woman who supports her family by buying and selling nipa (leaves used for roofing of homes). She lives in Sitio Turil, Brgy Daan Banua, Ilog, Negros Occidental with her husband Maniel.  Her husband is 64 years-old and works as a caretaker of fish ponds.  Their three adult children are busy raising their own families. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1995 and has improved her living conditionswith the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her nipa business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 20,000.

Nenita is now borrowing Php 28,000 so that she can buy and sell nipa. This will be her 14th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan, of Php 28,000, which she paid off within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Nenita aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To provide additional capital

loans.name: Bulamu Development Group Of Mityana

texts.en:
With seven children of his own and two dependents to take care of, 39-year-old hardworking W. Joseph knows he has his responsibilities cut out for him. This reality has looked him in the face for the past seven years as he goes about his trivial-round business of tea packing in Kakonde, Mityana.

With his minimal 240,000 shillings monthly earnings, Joseph has faced long odds in providing for all his family’s needs, principally his children’s education. He wants to improve the status quo of his family with the acquisition of this loan. He wants to give his business an improved lease of life by buying packing boxes for his tea leaves.

loans.use: To buy packing boxes for his tea leaves

loans.name: Andre

texts.en:
Andre is 42 years old, married with 2 children.  Andre is widely known in the business of selling foodstuffs mainly beans, peas, wheat, etc.  He has been in this business for about two years and the hours of his business are from 7 am to 5 pm every day.

Andre is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company, which will allow him to increase the quantity of foodstuffs for sale as well as the number of his customers.  With this additional quantity of foodstuffs, Andre will earn more profits which in turn will hopefully be used in taking care of his family and reinvesting in his business for better financial stability.

loans.use: increasing the quantity of foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Angelitos Group

texts.es:
Angelitos  es un grupo con formado por  Aracely del Carmen P. R., Gloria Isabel C. y Carlos Lisandro Mesa Mon tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que día a día buscan como ganarse el pan.

P. R., coordinadora del grupo hace aproximadamente cuatro años con unos ahorros compro los primeros materiales para su negocio estos fueron cuero, pega, suelas con lo cual inicio su pequeño taller de calzado. Este por medio de los créditos lo ha ido mejorando ya que con ellos ha podido invertir en más materiales para el negocio.

Mientras C. de 51 años vende tortilla, frijoles y cuajada y Carlos Lisandro Mesa Mon es taxista. Ellos invertirán el crédito en sus respectivos negocios.
texts.en:
Angelitos is a group made up of Aracely del Carmen P. R., Gloria Isabel C., and Carlos Lisandro Mesa Mon, three hardworking and enterprising people who make great efforts to bring home the bacon every day. Four years ago, P. R., the group's coordinator, used some savings to purchase the first stock for her business. These were leather, glue, and soles that she used to start a small cobbler's shop. Thanks to previous loans, she has been able to improve her business and invest in more stock. Meanwhile, C., 51 years old, sells tortillas, beans, and curds, and Carlos Lisandro Mesa Mon has a taxi. They will invest their loan in these different enterprises.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy leather, glue, soles, etc.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; Nuestra socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba perteneciente al departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Sofia;   ella tiene 32 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo y su conyugue cría truchas en Urubamba, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la educación. La socia es promotora en Ollantaytambo ubicado a 25 minutos de Urubamba. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para el hogar y pagar una pequeña deuda.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “PEROLNIYOC” communal bank. She lives in the province of Urubamba, in the department of Cusco. Her name is Sofia, and she is 32 years old. She has a live-in partner and one child. Her partner raises trout in Urubamba. Sofia divides her time between her household activities and her work in education. She provides educational support in the community of Ollantaytambo, 25 minutes from Urubamba. She is requesting the loan for household expenses and to pay a small debt. Sofia values and appreciates the support provided to her in this way, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For household expenses and paying a small debt

loans.name: Moth

texts.en: Moth L., 37, is a low-income person living in Siem Reap Province. She is a good and determined single mother who tries to feed her five children, even though she is recently divorced from her husband. She has one married child who lives separately, while the remainder are staying in the family home and working in a variety of jobs. Moth L. sells fresh fish in the market to earn a living. Every day in the late morning, Moth L. goes to a place where fishermen sell fish in bulk. Then she hurries to bring the fish to the market, which she sells them retail. Moth L. has a son who is not yet working. She hopes to encourage her son to have a job, but she has no cash to make that possible. So, she would request a loan to purchase a used motor-trailer taxi for her son to begin a service business.

loans.use: To purchase a use motor-trailer taxi for her son to begin a service business.

loans.name: Sahro

texts.ru: Ваисова Сахро проживает в районе Кабадиян. Возраст, 51 год. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Муж работает в больнице. Сама Сахро более 6 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота, чтобы увеличить количество скот.
texts.en:
Sahro V. lives in the Qubadiyon district. She is 51 years old, married and has 5 children. Her husband works at a hospital. Sahro has been involved in animal husbandry for over 6 years. She breeds livestock at home. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle in order to increase the quantity of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia lives in a city called Borewala, which is a part of Punjab, Pakistan. 

She is a housewife who stays at home, manages the household chores and takes care of her family. 

Her husband's name is I. M.. He works as a driver. He drives a rickshaw that he renst. Working on a rented rickshaw is never satisfying, even after working very hard. 

Razia wants to help her husband buy his own new auto rickshaw, which will not only avoid the cost of rent, but he will also be able to work for longer hours, which will earn him more money. She has applied for a loan from Asasah for this purpose. 

Razia is not satisfied with her current financial situation, but she is sure that with the loan her husband will lead his family towards a better standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase a new rickshaw

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es:
La señora Dorotea tiene 52 años, es madre soltera que vive en la comunidad de Boquerón Alto de la Provincia Tiraque del Departamento de Cochabamba.

La señora Dorotea es una persona humilde su casa es con techo de paja la pared de barro vive con sus dos hijos trabaja solita en algunos casos con ayuda de sus vecinos. La actividad principal de la señora es agricultura que produce papa y haba el crédito que esta solicitando es para insumos agrícolas el objetivo de la señora es mejorar su producción de esa manera mejorar sus ingresos económicos. 

Su mayor sueño es poder en un futuro mejorar las condiciones de la casa donde vive junto a sus hijos, también desea poder ver a sus hijos salir de la escuela y estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Sra. Dorotea is 52 years old and a single mother who lives in the community of Boquerón Alto in Tiraque Province, Department of Cochabamba. She is a humble person who owns a house made of mud walls and a thatched roof. Most of the time she works alone, but she occasionally receives help from her neighbors. Her main business activity is agriculture, growing potatoes and beans. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy farming supplies so that she can improve her production and increase her earnings.

Her greatest wish for the future is to improve the conditions of the house in which she lives with her children. She also wants to see them get ahead in school and study for a professional degree.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “TESORITO”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Julio;  El socio tiene25 años de edad, el socio es soltero y es administrador de tortas Tota; el socio trabaja en la calle belén.  El socio también tiene su negocio propio él tiene sus cabinas de internet, el socio administra también su propio negocio y con él tiene trabajando a otra persona. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio de alquiler de internet.       

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Little Treasure” this bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Mr. Julio he is 25 years old, single and manages Tota cakes, he works in Belén street. The member also has his own business, internet booths, the member manages this business as well and another person works with him. The member needs the loan to invest in his internet rental.

The member is grateful and values the loan given to him through this medium and is equally committed to meet with the payments of his quotas in the time period established.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member needs the loan to invest in his internet rental.

loans.name: Nafuu

texts.en:
Nafuu is a married woman with one child who is still young for school. She has been operating her business of selling kikois (large colorful fabrics) (Leso) for the last two years, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She has no other source of income.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase a bale of kikois for resale. Nafuu faces the major challenge of high transportation costs in her business, as she moves from door to door. She hopes to succeed in business and become self reliant.

She owns a house with electricity but no running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of kikois for resale

loans.name: Fatima Muhammad Yaseen's Group

texts.en:
Fatima is a resident of the city of Borewala which is famous in Pakistan for its shrines. She owns a two-room brick house in the area named Habib colony and lives in it with her family. She is a housewife and prefers to stay at home. By being a caring wife, she performs her responsibilities of a good mother as well. Her family respects and loves her a lot. 

Her husband's name is M. Y.. He is a butcher by trade and operates his own butcher's shop in the market where he deals specifically in chicken meat. He earns well on a daily basis but his business is greater on occasions. He has a good clientele base and serves them with good fresh meat. 

Fatima has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy the chickens in larger quantity and increase his selling. 

Fatima remains worried about her children's future but she thinks that she will be able to provide them with better living facilities if her husband's business improves.

Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Fatima.

loans.use: To buy large quantities of chickens for resale

loans.name: Silvia Emma

texts.es:
Silvia de 36 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado), tiene una pequeña tienda. 

Ella y sus hermanos comenzaron abrir tiendas en el sector donde vivían poco a poco vieron que era rentable para ellos y las personas del sector se sentían contentos en las tiendas. Gracias a la buena administración de ellos Silvia a podido tener su propia tienda y sus propios víveres. Trabaja desde las 08h00 vendiendo detergente, lácteos, arroz, granos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceite, bebidas para su tienda en el futuro quiere pollos para tener una granja que quiere tener y así tener mas ingresos y asegurar la economía de sus dos hijos.
texts.en: Silvia, age 36, lives in Perimetral de Guayaquil (a periurban zone, surrounded by a salt estuary). She has a small store. She and her brother started opening stores in the sector where they live, bit by bit, and saw that it was profitable for them and that the people of the sector were happy with the stores. Thanks to their good administration, Silvia has been able to have her own store with its own food. She works from 8:00 am selling detergent, milk products, rice, and grains among others. With the loan, she wants to buy rice, oil and drinks for her store. In the future, she wants chickens for the farm that she wants, and thus to have more income and to secure the future of her two children.

loans.use: rice, oil, detergents

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia M. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 37 years old. Nemia is married and has 4 children. Her eldest is 8 years old while the youngest is only 1. To make a living, Nemia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. 

Nemia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nemia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Nemia is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun S. is a 48-year-old married man who currently resides in Siem Reap province. Bun S. makes his income by ferrying villagers and tourists across the river. He generates a profit of approximately $6 US a day to help support his family’s daily expenses. His wife is a housewife who manages many duties at home. Bun S. is blessed with three children, all of whom are single. Because his ferry is small, he wants to expand it. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to purchase some pieces of wood to enlarge his ferry. Bun S. was not available on the day the photo was taken, so his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: to purchase some wood to enlarge his ferry

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: He wants to expand his shop

loans.name: Esperanza Gardenia

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Las Increíbles.

La señora Gardenia es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe por parte de la Fundación Espoir. Ella tiene 25 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 7, 6, 4 y 3 años los tres primeros están  en la escuela. Su marido trabaja en el Municipio de Bahía.

En la actualidad administra dos departamentos y además se dedica  al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo ya que dedicarse a una sola línea no le permitiría ganar lo suficiente para sus gastos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta. Trabaja cuatro días a la semana desde las 7h30 hasta las 11 am que llega a hacer el almuerzo para sus hijos y en la tarde desde las 15h00 hasta las 17h00, en las noches se dedica a sus hijos ayudarles en las tareas sobre todo al más pequeño. Compra sus productos en Guayaquil ciudad a la que va una vez al mes.

Este crédito es para ir a Guayaquil a traer más mercadería, (pantalones, blusas, camisas, etc.) porque allá salen más baratas. Ella está en el l Banco Comunal  desde sus inicios y le gusta por las facilidades que dan para los créditos. Su sueño es tener un local donde vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
The Las Increíbles (The Incredible Ones) communal bank meets every two weeks in the beautiful city of Bahía de Caraquez known for its beaches, its rich gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

Gardenia is a founding member of the communal bank.  She likes it because of the benefits she gets from Fundación Espoir.  She is 25 years old and is in a common law relationship.  She has four children who are 7, 6, 4 and 3 years of age.  The three oldest are in school.  Her husband works for the City of Bahía.

She currently manages two apartments and is also a merchant.  She sells all kinds of clothes because sticking with just one line does not produce enough to cover costs.  She sells door to door.  She works four days a week from 7:30am until 11am when she returns home to make lunch for her children.  She returns to work from 3pm until 5pm.  She dedicates evenings to her children helping them with their homework, especially the youngest.  She buys her products in Guayaquil, a city she visits once a month.

The loan is to go to Guayaquil to bring more merchandise (pants, blouses, shirts, etc) because they are less expensive there.  She has been in the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because of the ease in obtaining loans.  Her dream is to have a locale in which to sell her merchandise.

loans.use: To buy shirts, pants, blouses, undershirts, etc.

loans.name: Maria Cleofe

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 53 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel, es madre soltera vive con uno de sus hijos tiene 27 años de edad y estudia agronomía, doña María posee una tienda y vende tortillas, desde hace 12 años se dedica a este oficio y lo atiende de 7:00am a 9:00pm, su negocio son las tortillas y en la tienda ofrece golosinas y bebidas.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para surtir el negocio,  comprando jugos, sodas y golosinas, con esta ayuda incrementara el negocio y contara con productos que los clientes le demandan. El sueño de doña María ver a su hijo graduado, poseer casa propia y pagar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Dona Maria is 53 years old and lives in San Miguel, San Miguel state. She is a single mother and lives with one of her children who is 27 years old and studying agriculture. Dona Maria has a store and sells tortillas. She's been doing this work in this location for 12 years. She opens from 7:00 a.m. till 9:00 p.m. Her business is selling tortillas as well as candy and drinks.

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise to enlarge the stock, buying juices, sodas and candies. With this help, she will increase the business and provide products that her clients are demanding. Her dream is to see her son graduate, own a house of her own and pay her debts.

loans.use: To buy juices, sodas and candies

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Benkadi sont essentiellement des  femmes mariées  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à LAFIABOUGOU  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur première  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de poisson frais, de tomates fraîches et de condiments  avec FATOUMATA B.. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 10 paniers de condiments de diverses qualités et 20 kg d’oignon. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de SIKASSO.
Elle vend à SIKASSO au marché de Médine et à  domicile au comptant  à une clientèle composée essentiellement des  femmes .
 Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
Benkadi Group ("Harmony") is composed of four women, mostly married, who on average are 34 years old and have three children. Most of them live in a monogamous family in Lafiabougou, a neighborhood of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

This is the first time that this group of women works with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy the needs of their customers. They sell fresh fish, fresh tomatoes and food condiments.

Mrs Fatoumata B., one of the group members, intends to use her loan to buy 10 baskets of condiments of various qualities and 20 kilograms of onions. She gets her supplies at the great market in Sikasso. She sells at the Médine market in Sikasso and from her home for cash to a clientele mostly made up of women.

Mrs B. expects to make an average profit of 35,000 CFA francs a month. Part of it will be saved or spent on household expenses, and any remaining amount will be invested in her business.

loans.use: Pour acheter des condiments alimentaires

loans.name: Safia Kosar

texts.en:
Safia kosar belongs to a small city in Punjab Pakistan called Kasur, which is known for its tanneries industry. She lives there with her family in a two room brick house. Safia is 41 years old and is a school teacher. She earns a reasonable income from her teaching profession. She is also a very good housewife. Besides her school job she also does her household tasks very well. Safia has 4 sons and a daughter. Safia gives the required time to her children and teaches them. Her children are very intelligent and always get good scores in their classes.

Safia is married to M. A., who is a carpenter by profession and makes furniture on order to earn income for the family. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s furniture business. With the loan, he will purchase wood, nails and furniture polisher and also hire a worker which will help him to complete his orders on time and earn maximum profits.

Safia is hopeful that her husband’s business will become better after the loan investment is made. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To buy wood, nails and furniture polisher for furniture making business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR PASION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Yucay, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.Elizabeth ; ella tiene 41 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de maíz, la socia distribuye a la ciudad de Lima y también trabaja como docente del nivel primario en un colegio en el distrito de Maras, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de maíz. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Elizabeth is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor Pasion”, which is located in the District of Yucay, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.  

She is 41 years old, married, and has three children. Elizabeth divides her time between her daily activities and her business of buying and selling corn.  She distributes her products in the city of Lima and also works as a teacher at the elementary level at a school in the District of Maras.  Elizabeth wants to improve her business of selling corn, so she is requesting a loan in order to buy more corn in bulk.

She is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: Purchase corn in bulk

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es: Nestor de 24 años natural del distrito de Anco, convive con Frida de 24 años y tienen 02 queridos hijos, Magaly de 08 años y Farid de 01 año de edad; juntos viven en su casa propia donde reina  la paz y la armonía. Nestor, es el sostén de su familia, desde muy niño sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra, es campesino y tiene 06 hectáreas de terreno donde viene trabajando 07 años en sus propias tierras. En su parcela cuenta con variedad de plantaciones como: hojas de coca,  plantas de café y plantaciones de cacao. Que son plantas oriundas de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. En tiempos de cosecha necesita el apoyo de la mano ajena y tiene que contratar jornaleros para avanzar con las extracciones de los frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus productos. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar más plantaciones de café. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo y esta dispuesto a cumplir puntualmente con sus cronogramas de pagos. Agradece a la institución Prisma por concederle el crédito. Con los  2,000 nuevos soles solicitados,  contratará peones para el desmonte de malezas.
texts.en:
Nestor, 24, is from Anco district.  He lives with Frida, 24, and they have two beloved children: Magaly, 8, and Farid, 1. They live together in their own house where peace and harmony reign.

Nestor is his family’s provider.  From a very early age his parents taught him how to work the fields.  He’s a farmer and has six hectares where he’s been growing his own crops for the last 7 years.  His parcel has the following crops: coca leaf, coffee plants and cocoa bean plants all of which are plants native to the Apurimac River Valley. 

During harvest season he needs extra help and must hire day laborers in order to pick the fruit.  What he most likes about his work is harvesting because that’s when he sees the months of hard work rewarded in the quality of his fruits.  He considers transporting his crops from the field to the city of San Francisco, which is where the best prices for them are available, to be the most difficult part of the job.  In the future he wants to buy new lands to increase his coffee production.

This is his first loan with MFP and he feels that this contribution will help him much in his work’s progress and is willing to repay in a timely fashion. He is grateful to Prisma for granting him the loan and will use the requested 2000 new soles to hire day laborers to clear weeds from his fields.

loans.use: To hire day laborers to help him remove weeds from his fields.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is currently in the business of selling household products like saucepans. She is 25 years old, married to a businessman, and has no children. Rose took out a loan to stock more household products like saucepans to sell. She hopes to build a house with extra  profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more household products like saucepans to sell

loans.name: Gerelt

texts.en:
Gerelt T., 53, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they own. They have a decent standard of living. 

Her husband is a driver and they operate a transportation business together. They transport people from one place to another in the city by their micro-bus. They began this business in 2006 and they support their living by the profit of their transportation business. Their daily family income is 50,000 MNT and she says, "We are trying to save money because one of our children has a serious health problem and needs have an operation abroad." 

Gerelt is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy a spare parts and pay for the maintenance of their micro-bus.

loans.use: to buy a spare parts for their micro-bus

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene G. is from the village of Nampicuan, Aurora, Isabela. She is 20 years old, married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Arlene owns and operates a specialized retail store selling AVON products such as shampoo, soap and lotion in the local community. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,800 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2011, Arlene joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Cristo Del Consuelo (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Cristo del Consuelo está formado por 8 mujeres muy alegres, carismáticas y sobre todo emprendedoras que luchan a diario en sus diferentes trabajos para mejorar la economía de sus hogares. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, cuenta con una variada  gastronomía, tiene varios lugares turísticos para visitar y su gente es muy amable y carismática.

La Señora Zoila Fernández vive por el sector de Cristo Rey en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 42 años, es divorciada y tiene 4 hijos de 22, 20, 18 y 16 años de edad, su primera hija trabaja y ayuda en la economía del hogar, su segunda hija es casada e independiente, su tercera hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad y su ultimo hijo trabaja  solo para sus gastos personales. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Zoila se dedica a la venta de chuzos (carne en palito), esta labor la realiza hace 17 años de domingo a domingo desde las 4 de la tarde hasta las 11 de la noche.

Este es el onceavo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y  lo va a invertir en la compra de producto para la elaboración de chuzos como: carne, pimientos, cebolla, papas, salchichas, etc.

Su sueño es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
The communal bank, Cristo del Consuelo, is comprised of eight cheerful, charismatic women who are entrepreneurs and struggle daily in their respective businesses to improve their household economies.  They live in the city of Cuenca which is the third most important one in the country.  It has a varied gastronomy, many tourist sites and kind, charismatic people.

Mrs. Zoila Fernández lives in the Cristo Rey area of the city of Cuenca.  She is 42 years old, divorced and has four children, ages 22, 20, 18 and 16.  Her eldest daughter works and helps cover household expenses.  Her second daughter is married and independent.  Her third daughter is in school in the city and her youngest son works to cover his own expenses.  They live in rental property.

For seventeen years, Doña Zoila has been selling  "chuzos" (meat on a stick), from Sunday to Sunday, from 4:00 p.m. to 11:00 p.m.

This is her 11th loan through the communal bank and she plans to use it to buy ingredients for the chuzos: meat, peppers, onions, potatoes, sausages, etc.

Her dream is to have her own home one day.

loans.use: To buy meat, peppers, onions, potatoes, sausages, etc.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario, tiene 38 años, y toda su vida transcurre alrededor de constante esfuerzo, ella, está casada con Fidmer, de 33 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos, peor sólo vive con uno de ellos, en sus casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cayan. Desde muy pequeña trabaja en la chacra, porque sus padres fueron grandes agricultores que le enseñaron todas las técnicas agrícolas que ahora Rosario, emplea en busca de cosechas exitosas, pero lleva 15 años cultivando papa de manera independiente, junto a su esposo. Ella, ama la tierra que la vio nacer y desde siempre sembró grandes extensiones de tubérculos (papa), porque la zona donde vive es alta, y es lo único que produce mejor, porque la calidad de la tierra es ideal, lo que más le gusta es cultivar los surcos para dejarlos alineados, porque pueden desarrollarse libremente y crecer fuertes, sin embargo le desagrada cargar los pesados sacos y trasladarlos a los mercados; por eso buscan compradores directos. En busca de nuevos ingresos económicos, quiere contar con un puesto de venta en el mercado de la ciudad “Huasahuasi” para comercializar verduras y sus sabrosas variedades de papa. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Unión por el trabajo”, y este es el décimo crédito con MFP, donde está contenta de trabajar con esta asociación; pues antes pertenecía a otro grupo de personas muy trabajadoras, pero por motivo de la ubicación se tuvo que retirar. Rosario, comprará con el dinero solicitado 12 sacos de semilla de papa de la variedad “yungay”, que piensa sembrar dentro de este mes, asimismo varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos entre su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Rosario is 38 years old and her entire life revolves around constant effort.  She is married to Fidmer, 33, and they have three children but only one of them lives with her in her own house located in the hamlet of Cayan.  

She has worked in the field since she was a little girl because her parents were great farmers who taught her all the farming techniques that Rosario now uses in search of successful harvests.  However, she’s been farming independently alongside her husband for 15 years now.  She loves the land of her birth and has always planted large extensions of tubers (potatoes) because the area where she lives is at a high elevation and that’s the only thing that grows well because the quality of the land is ideal and they can develop freely and grow strong.  However, she doesn’t like having to carry the heavy sacks to market and this is why they seek out direct buyers. In search of new sources of income she wants to have a stand in the city of “Huasahuasi” to sell vegetables and her delicious varieties of potato.

She is a member of the “Unión por el Trabajo” (Unity for Work) communal bank and this is the tenth loan.  She is happy to work with this association because she used to belong to a different group of very hard working people but because of its location she had to drop out.

Rosario will use the requested money to buy 12 sacks of potato seed of the “Yungay” variety that she plans to plant this month as well as several sacks of organic manure to spread among her plants.

loans.use: to buy 12 sacks of potato seed and sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Etoile Group

texts.fr: ETOILE est un groupe de sept personnes, dont les membres appartiennent au même groupe d’artisan et vivent dans la même localité. La représentante du groupe, Lydie Bibiane (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est née le 22 décembre 1966 à Sakété dans l’ouémé. Lydie Bibiane est mariée à un instituteur nommé Fagnon. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Lydie Bibiane assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Lydie Bibiane a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire, mais a appris ensuite la couture. Lydie Bibiane exerce cette activité depuis dix sept ans. Parallèlement à cette activité, Lydie Bibiane vend des fournitures scolaires et du charbon de bois à son domicile. Lydie Bibiane s’approvisionne à cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Lydie Bibiane et son groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
