ETOILE (STAR) is a group composed of seven persons who belong to the same group of tradespeople and live in the same locality. The representative of the group, Lydie Bibiane, who is raising her hand in the photo, was born on December 22, 1966 in Sakété in the Ouémé district and is married to a teacher by the name of Fagnon. The couple have two children, both enrolled in school and living under their roof. She and her husband share in supporting their family. 

Lydie Bibiane stopped school at the secondary level and then learned to sew. She has been working at this business for seventeen years. Alongside this business, she sells school supplies and charcoal at her house. She buys her supplies in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. This is the first time that Lydie Bibiane and her group have requested the help of ALIDé so as to reinforce their working capital and their businesses and better respond to the needs of their clientele.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and sewing notions.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is 45 years old and married. He lives in the village of Didi Dmanisi, Dmanisi District. Zurab lives with his wife Khatuna, 19- and 17-year old sons, 15-year-old daughter and parents. Khatuna is a housewife; all three children go to school. Zurab leads the family agricultural farm; he grows potatoes, maize and haricot on the family-owned plot of land. Zurab trades the vegetables. He sells his own vegetables and also some other cultures, purchased in neighbor villages. The total average income of the family is 900 Laris per month. 

With the requested credit, Zurab will purchase fertilizers and pay for the fuel for his tractor to till the land. Zurab hopes that after fertilizing the land, the harvested vegetables will be of a good quality and will be sold for a good price. 

The profit received from the farm will be used for the education of the children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and fuel for his tractor

loans.name: Marfelina

texts.en: Marfelina, a 41-year-old married mother of five children, lives in the Philippines where she has been raising and selling livestock such as goats and cows to earn a living for the past two years. A member of PMPC for eight years, Marfelina is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en:
Nickson is 35 years old, married, and has a son aged three and a half. He operates a business that sells secondhand clothes and employs two people. He has been selling mens, ladies, and children's clothes for eight years. Nickson plans to use this loan to purchase more secondhand clothes which he intends to resell.  

In the future, Nickson hopes to expand his business and open more outlets. He describes himself as welcoming. He also likes to sell quality brands.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand clothes to resell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace has a small kiosk where she displays cooked waakye (rice and beans cooked together), plain rice and stew. She serves it with eggs and macaroni, fish and meat. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. Her trade is five years old. As part of her marital duties, she helps her husband pay utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy ingredients such as rice, tomatoes, cooking oil and so on to cook for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a bigger kiosk.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, tomatoes and cooking oil

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en:
Raeda is a 28-year-old housewife. She is married to Emad, a soldier in the military and has a son and a daughter. Raeda is known for her quiet character that is reflected in the business she started, arranging artificial flowers. It has been two years now since she started her business at home. When her husband is not on duty, he helps her to deliver a good quality of service to their customers. During these two years, Raeda has find that importing the materials she is using from outside Jordan is much cheaper for her. So she has applied for a loan to be able to import new material that could add a new flavor to the works of art she makes.

And because Raeda is a conservative person, she requested that her husband appear in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: to import new flower-arranging materials

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es: Dionicio (41 años) es un hombre trabajador y responsable, vive en casa propia junto a su pareja y sus dos hijos por quienes sale todos los días a trabajar para brindarles una mejor educación y sobre todo una mejor calidad de vida.Dionicio tiene como rutina del trabajo que realiza salir muy temprano a las calles en busca de los pasajeros eventuales que están en busca de transportarse de un lugar a otro, lleva con esta actividad ya casi dos años, además de trabajar en su mototaxi, el tiene una bodega en su casa y es su esposa quien se encarga de este negocio.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene contacto directo con las personas, hace buenas relaciones y sobre todo que siempre encuentra pasajeros queriendo ir de un lugar a otro.Lo que no le gusta es tener que estar en el sol arduo de la ciudad pero entiende que es la manera que el optó para ganarse la vida y espera poder seguir trabajando así para poder mejor la calidad de vida de su familia.Este es el tercer prestamos de Dionicio y se siente bien y tranquilo aun que el grupo atravesó algunos problemas el sabe que siempre se tienen entre ellos para apoyarse.Con el préstamo solicitado el comprará algunos repuestos para su mototaxi ya que por lo años y el mal estado de las pistas tiene que ser modificados y cambiados muy a menudo.
texts.en: Dionicio (41) is a responsible, hard-working man.  He lives in a house that he owns with his wife and their two children, children for whom he works hard to provide a good education and a better quality of life.  Dionicio starts his days very early, on the lookout for passengers for his taxi business.  He's operated the business for almost two years now.  Along with his taxi business, Dionicio has a corner shop that he opened in a spare room of his house, a business managed by his wife.  The thing that he likes best about working is contact with other people.  He connects well with people and he likes finding new passengers and taking them where they have to go.  What he likes least about working is the sun on a hot day, but he knows it's a price that he has to pay to make a living and support his family.  This is Dionicio's third loan and he's happy that his community group has overcome some recent problems.  He knows that they will always support each other in the end.  He will use the loan to buy some spare parts for his mototaxi.  The mototaxi needs constant care because it's old and suffers from the poor state of local streets.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his taxi business.

loans.name: Marifat

texts.ru:
Маърифат вдова и ответственная мать 2 детей. Она трудолюбивая, умная и добрая женщина. Когда её муж покинул их, она тяжело переносила те дни и думала, как зарабатывать денег чтобы кормит своих детей. Тогда она начала заниматься приготовлением лепешек со своими родственниками. Она мечтает, устроит своих детей в хорошую школу, и она хочет, видит их в будущем образованными и трудолюбивыми человеками.  Она занимается этим бизнесом более 5 лет. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и зарабатывать много денег для своих детей. Маърифат хотела бы получить займ в размере 2300$ США для покупки муку на запас с целью расширения бизнеса. Она заранее хочет, благодарит всех кредиторов за поддержку и милосердие. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Marifat is a widow and a responsible mother of two children.  She is a hard-working, smart and kind woman.  When her husband passed away, she had a hard time surviving those days and thought about how to make money in order to feed her children.  It was then that she started to prepare flatbread together with her relatives.  She dreams of placing her children into a good school and wants and sees them becoming educated and hard-working people in the future.  She has been involved in this business for over five years.  She wants to expand her business and earn a lot of money for her children.  Marifat wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2300 for the purchase of flour to stock in order to expand her business.  She wants to thank all of the creditors in advance for the support and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase flour

loans.name: Mais

texts.ru:
Mais 43 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 4 detey. Mais yavlyayetsya IDP personom, on pereselenec iz Fuzuli gorod, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione posolke Kayidish specialno postroyenniy dlya vinujdennix pereselencev. Mais uje 10 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov.
Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Maisa , on blagopoluchno oplatil pervuyu ssudu i za etu ssudu on blagodaren Kive i lenderam.
Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korov dlya razvitiya skotovodstva.

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/126666
texts.en: Mais is 43 years old, married and has four children.  Mais is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person), who moved from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Kayidish village of the Fuzuli region.  This village was built specifically for displaced people.  Mais has been involved in animal husbandry for 10 years and breeds cattle.  This is his second loan.  He successfully repaid his first loan and is grateful to Kiva and lenders for this loan.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy cattle and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man with three children; two attend school, while one is still too young.  He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.  He operates a carpentry business, selling to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. He dreams of establishing a well-furnished workshop in the future.

With his KES 20,000 loan, George wants to purchase timber. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase timber

loans.name: Álvaro

texts.es:
El señor Álvaro le está haciendo falta la bardal al frente de su vivienda. 
Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material que es (block, cemento, arena y varilla) ya que el se encargara de realizar la mejor en horario adicional a su empleo. 
Don Álvaro desea la seguridad y protección de su familia ya que trabajo de noche en una fábrica y su esposa la señora Xochil  y su hija se quedan solas. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del sueldo que recibe de su empleo ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia. Ya que la Doña Xochil se encarga del cuidado y atención de su hija y del próximo hijo que esta por nacer.
texts.en:
Álvaro’s property needs a front wall.  He’s asking for a loan to buy building materials (concrete block, cement, sand and iron rods) since he’ll do the work himself after he gets home from work.

Álvaro wants security and protection for his family because he works nights at a factory and his wife, Xóchitl, and his daughter stay home alone.

He plans to repay the loan with part of the salary he earns at work which is his family’s only source of income since Xóchitl takes care of their daughter and the next child that’s about to be born.

loans.use: to erect a front wall.

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en:
Batsaihan is 33 years old and lives with his wife and one child in his house in Ulaanbaatar city of Mongolia. His wife helps with his business and his child goes to the kindergarten. 

Batsaihan operates a shoe-making business. He started his shoe-making business in 1996. At first, he was only able to make one kind of shoes on order and they barely sold. Now, he makes a variety of types of shoes and he sells them to resellers. He is a hard-working and diligent man who says, "I believe that I can do even better and I have a bright vision for my business." He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy materials to make more boots to increase his assets.

loans.use: To buy materials to make more boots.

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en: Khawla is a married woman and has three sons and two daughters. She has a wedding gown store and a beauty salon, which are the only source of income for the family. She wants to buy more wedding gowns for sale and a new beauty salon kit such as: hair and body creams, hair brushes, etc., but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of amount $3,000 from FATEN. When Khawla gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase new wedding gowns and she will have a larger collection to compete and sell more. Also, she will purchase a new beauty salon kit so she will improve her work positively and increase her income. This will enable her to provide better living conditions to her family. Khawla is photographed in her store.

loans.use: to buy more wedding gowns and a new beauty salon kit.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es: José Alberto trabaja como coordinador de seguridad. Él tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, él es un hombre muy trabajador que disfruta de tener este medio de trabajo por el cual le ha brindado la ayuda necesaria para realizar las remodelaciones para su vivienda. Él solicita este crédito para la compra de cemento, zinc, madera entre otros. Sueña con arreglar su vivienda para que sus hijos se puedan quedar con ella.
texts.en: José Alberto works as a security coordinator; he has two children in his care.  He is a very hardworking man who enjoys having this job which has provided him with the means to do some home improvements.  He’s asking for a loan to buy cement, metal sheeting and lumber, among others.  He dreams with improving his house so that his children can inherit it.

loans.use: to buy cement, metal sheeting and lumber, among others.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Elvie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Elvie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Elvie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Yamil Adolfo

texts.es: El señor Yamil a sus 28 años de edad es un emprendedor quien desea iniciar su propio negocio. El señor Yamil desea montar su propia legumbreria en el garaje de su casa ubicada en el municipio de Marinilla localizado al oriente de Antioquia.  El señor Yamil necesita comprar mercancía como frutas y verduras, muebles y enseres, con lo anterior el señor Yamil podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su esposa quien lo apoya en todos sus propósitos. A futuro el señor Yamil sueña con tener bien posicionada su legumbreria y tener muchos clientes.
texts.en: Yamil, 28, is an entrepreneur who wants to start his own business.  Yamil wants to open his own vegetable shop in his home’s garage located in the town of Marinilla in east Antioquia.  Yamil needs to buy merchandise like fruit and vegetables, furnishings and furniture.  Yamil will be able to improve the quality of life of himself and of his wife who supports him in all his efforts.  In the future, Yamil hopes his fruit and vegetable shop will be well positioned and has many customers.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, furniture and fixtures.

loans.name: Jacqueline Tété

texts.fr: Jacqueline vit maritalement avec deux enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la vente de divers et d'oeufs de poule. Elle exerce son commerce au marché de Vèdoko, l'un des marchés qui draîne beaucoup d'affluence. Pour se ravitailler, elle  se rend à AGRISSACH pour les oeufs Dans le but de répondre aux préoccupations de sa clientèle, elle fait donc recours au financement de Finadev. Le bénéfice engendré lui permettra de  renforcer son fonds de commerce et de contribuer en partie aux charges du foyer.
texts.en: Jacqueline is married and has two children. Her main activity is to sell a variety of items including hens' eggs. She carries out her business at the Vèdoko market, one of the markets which attracts large crowds. She gets her supplies of eggs from Agrissach. With a view to responding to her customers' demand, she has turned to Finadev for a loan. The profits she makes will enable her to strengthen her business and to contribute towards the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy 109 trays of eggs

loans.name: Ricardo De Jesús

texts.es: El señor Ricardo a los 68 años de edad es padre de 9 hijos, se dedica a la venta de dulces y snacks a la salida de un colegio del municipio de Marinilla localizado al oriente de Antioquia, esta labor la realiza desde hace 9 años en un pequeño carro ambulante de manera que adecuo para ubicar sus productos. El señor Ricardo requiere de la compra de surtido para su puesto de venta de dulces con el fin de poder incrementar sus ventas y así mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida. El sueño del señor Ricardo es poder tener su negocio más amplio y con mayor variedad de productos.
texts.en: Richard, sixty-eight years old, is the father of nine children. He makes a living selling candy and snacks outside a school in the municipality of Marinilla, in the east of Antioquia. He has done this work for the last nine years using a street cart that he adapted to hold his products. Richard needs to purchase stock for his candy stand in order to increase his sales and therefore increase his income and quality of life. Richard's dream is to be able to expand his business and offer a larger variety of products.

loans.use: to purchase his stock of candy.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 34 years old, he is married and blessed with two children. He has been operating a motorcycle transportation service for the past three years with a monthly income of Kes 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Peter will use the loan to buy a motorcycle. He will use the anticipated profits from the business for his children's education. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and venture into mixed crop farming.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Mujeres Al Triunfo 3 Group

texts.en:
Constancia is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres al triunfo 3 (Women to victory). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her four children. She is a widow. She says that her biggest challenge was to raise her children after her husband died.  She had to take care of everything, house, family and income.  This is her 4th loan with Esperanza.

Constancia has had her business for almost five years. Using some savings and taking loans from other places. She started selling some grocery products from a small stall in her house. Now she has a colmado, a grocery store located in the neighborhood, where more of the neighbors buy their daily meals. Constancia will invest in her business by purchasing rice, beans, sugar, canned food, flour, and other goods.  She will use the profits to save and reinvest in her business.

Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo and is composed of 5 people.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, canned food, flour, and other goods

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé depuis 2010 rassemble des femmes qui habitent le même quartier et ont comme activité le commerce.

Fanta qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la représentante du groupe,elle est âgée de 43 ans,est mariée et mére d'une fille.

Fanta fait du commerce,elle vend des fruits et céréales au marché central de la ville.

Elle compte acheter avec le crédit des fruits comme de la banane,les oranges et les mangues pour une valeur de 100000f ;250 kg de mil à 200 f le kg et 100kg d'arachide pour une valeur de 50000f.

Les bénéfices du prêt serviront à participer  aux dépenses quotidiennes de la maison et à augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was created in 2010 and is made up of women who all live in the same neighbourhood and all work as retailers.

Fanta (on the right in the photo, with her hand raised) is the group representative.  She is 43 years old, married and mother to one girl.  She sells fruit and cereals at the central market in town.  Fanta intends to buy fruits (bananas, oranges and mangos) at a total cost of 100,000 francs CFA, 250 kilos of millet (for 200 francs CFA a kilo) and 100 kilos of peanuts (for 50,000 francs CFA).  Her profits will help her provide for the day-to-day expenses of her household and increase her savings.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and grains

loans.name: Koraneza Advanced Cb Group

texts.en: Jeanne d'arc is a group leader, 47 years old. She is married with 6 children aged 8 and 23 years. They all attend schools. The group is called KORANEZA which means “WORK NICELY” in English. They sell different items and they wish to expand their business for the better future. Jeanne d'ark is a farmer who sells food stuffs and has been doing in a business for the past 8 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more rice, beans and sorghum for sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more rice, beans and sorghum for sell.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: My business sells electronics such as: TVs, irons, video recorders, microwaves, etc. I use the money to help pay for the education of my family and to improve the conditions of the business so that there is always an assortment of products. My business relies/benefits from a good location and regular clients that come to me for their purchases. I need the loan to offer more products that are requested by clients.

loans.use: To buy TVs, stereo equiptment, blenders and toasters.

loans.name: Ayéna

texts.en:
Ayéna B. is married and the father of four. A farmer by trade, he married a merchant of smoked fish who sacrifices every day for her children’s happiness. Mr. B. is a subsistence farmer. These days, soil degradation and the caprices of Nature continue to result in lower and lower crop yields. Despite his courage and self-sacrifice, it is hard for him to shield his family from hunger. At wit’s end, he is requesting financial support to revitalize his fields. The requested loan of $700 will serve to acquire fertilizer in order to produce more in future growing seasons. The income from the sale of his crops will allow him to take care of his family and to lead a peaceful life.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur B. Ayéna est un homme marié et père de quatre (4) enfants. Cultivateur de profession, il a épousé une revendeuse de poisson fumé qui s’évertue au quotidien pour le bonheur de ses enfants. Monsieur B. pratique une agriculture de subsistance, et aujourd’hui, la dégradation du sol et les caprices de la nature font que les rendements sont de plus en plus médiocres. Malgré son courage et son abnégation, il lui est difficile de mettre sa famille à l’abri de la faim. Ne sachant plus à quel saint se vouer, il sollicite un appui financier pour relancer son activité. Le crédit de $750 qu’il demande va servir à s’approvisionner en engrais chimique afin de mieux produire les saisons à venir. Les revenus issus de la vente des produits permettront à Monsieur B. Ayéna de s’occuper de sa famille et de mener vie paisible.

loans.use: To stock up on fertilizer to improve crop yields

loans.name: Maleyka

texts.en: Maleyka is an Internally Displace Person from the Armenian-occupied Zangilan district of Azerbaijan. She fled to Baku in 1993. Married, she has four children. She started her business in 1995. Maleyka plans to borrow $300 from Normicro Baku branch to increase her variety of goods.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow and a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret K. is thirty four years old and married with four children.  Her husband is unemployed and Margaret is the only income earner in the family.  She is engaged in selling different kinds of agricultural products and sometimes is assisted by her two of her children.   Like many women in Sierra Leone, Margaret is committed to providing for her family and continuing to send her children to school.  Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and is requesting a $275 loan for another expansion of the business.

loans.use: Expansion of her agricultural input business

loans.name: Elga Judith

texts.en:
An example of a courageous and regal woman is 39 year old Elga, mother of four small school age children who are all her love and her reason for being. In spite of her husband leaving, she has tried to create a space in her home to offer cosmetics and clothing because of the need for work and the small amount of money available to her. For months everything had gone well, but a home never lacks inconveniences and she was caught by one of the hardest, a sick daughter. The daughter suffered from anemia, a sickness that required treatment in the hospital of the capital city. What is more, the sickness ran up huge expenses and include months of treatment.

Thanks to patience and dedication that Elga maintained she now finds things back to normal, but the economic recovery of the family is not complete. For the purpose of providing for her children’s welfare Elga needs $200 in order to acquire more items and continue with the sale of her products. Let us help Elga to recover, as well as her daughter who has been hit by some of the unfortunate things that life deals to us.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein.

Un ejemplo de mujer valerosa y regia es Elga de 39 años, madre de 4 pequeños aún en etapa escolar, los cuales son su adoración y razón de ser. A pesar del alejamiento de su esposo, por motivos de trabajo y con el poco dinero que dispone ha tratado de acondicionar un espacio en el interior de su hogar para ofrecer cosméticos y prendas de vestir. Hace meses todo marchaba bien pero en un hogar nunca falta la presencia de inconvenientes y a ella le ha tocado uno de los más duros, la enfermedad de su pequeña hija, quien sufrió de anemia hemolítica, enfermedad que tuvo que ser tratada en un nosocomio de la capital y que además le ocasionó grandes gastos y meses de tratamiento.Gracias a la permanencia y paciencia que mantuvo se encuentra totalmente restablecida; sin embargo la recuperación económica de su familia aún no es un hecho total.Y con el propósito de velar por el bienestar de sus hijos ella requiere de 200 dólares para poder adquirir más artículos y seguir con la venta de sus productos. Ayudemos a que Elga pueda recuperarse, al igual que su hija de los malos momentos que la vida tiene para alguno de nosotros.

loans.use: Purchase of items for her small sales stand.

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
In 2003, Ms Hoàng Thị Tín was one of the poorest member in her village. At first, she applied for a small loan because she wasn't confident about the weekly payment. To her surprise, it was quite easy for her to make the weekly payment with the money from the sales of the mats the she weaved. The profit was good. So in later rounds, she always applied for maximum amount. After 4 years, she has renovated her house and bought tools. This time she's requesting a loan of 450 USD to buy sedge for mat weaving. She's 39 and she looks younger than when she first joined TYM.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Năm 2003 chị Hoàng Thị Tín là một trong những hội viên nghèo trong thôn, nhà tranh tre tạm bợ. Vòng vốn đầu chị không dám vay cao vì còn sợ việc trả hàng tuần. Nhưng việc dệt chiếu trả tuần đối với chị không ngờ lại dễ dàng như vậy. Lợi nhuận thu được cũng khá. Các vòng vốn tiếp theo chị đều vay mức vốn tối đa. Qua 4 năm tham gia Quỹ chị đã sửa được nhà, mua sắm được một số trang thiết bị. Vòng vốn này chị Tín đề nghị vay 450USD thêm vào mua cói để dệt chiếu. Ở tuổi 39, trông chị tươi trẻ hơn nhiều so với ngày đầu tham gia Quỹ.

loans.use: Buy sedge to make mat.

loans.name: Al Rida Group

texts.en: Mariam, Nahla, Rahila and Mountaha are all married women that are part of one group called: 'A. Rida'. They live in the Bekaa and each needs a loan for her own business. Mariam needs to buy merchandise for her grocery shop. Mounataha needs to buy provisions for the traditionA. food she makes which is called the 'moune'. Rahila has to buy merchandise for her commerce, and Nahla wants to purchase new products for her accessories and perfumes business. This group has a long and solid history with A. Majmoua.

loans.use: To buy the needed provisions and merchandise for their businesses

loans.name: Munaku B(Iii) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Solome is 36 years old and married with two children. She makes and sells snacks. She wants to use the extra profits to pay school fees for the children. Ruth bakes cakes and wants to buy a fridge with the loan. Alice and H. both sell timber, while Prossy sells soft drinks.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To add in snack business

loans.name: Kompong Kor I Group

texts.en: This is a loan which will be shared between twenty-two members of the Kompong Kor I Village Bank in Kandal Province. Mrs. Reth P., age 38, is the Village Bank President. She has two children who are looking for work, and now she and the Village Bank would like to request a loan in order to buy fertilizer, fuel, and hire a person to help her work in her rice field. AdditionalL., she would use the loan to buy pig food.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, fuel and pig food

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Nuru K.. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children. In addition, she has one dependent who lives with her because he is in school and his parents live in a remote area. In 2007, Nuru established her market stall business. Working six days a week, and 9 to 12 hours a day, she earns about $160 each month from this business. She is assisted by her hursband and two employees.

Nuru has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now seeks a new loan in order to purchase beans, nuts, and onions in bulk for her market stall. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $45.

In the future, Nuru plans to diversify her business. For example, she would like to start a charcoal-selling business: these small, black, dirty pieces of dry earth are important to the people of Tanzania because they rely on charcoal to cook meals. Indeed, many Tanzanians still use small coal pots, in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal) and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags, or kerosene in order to light them. The fire requires constant fanning to ignite and maintain the flame, and makes cooking quite a hot and laborious task. Nuru acknowledges that this may not be the easiest or most environmentally-friendly way to cook, but it is the only option many people can afford in Tanzania. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of beans, nuts, and onions in bulk

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara belongs to the Communal Bank “The Shipibas”, located in the Jetty Grau, of the District of Calleria of the Department of Ucayali. She is 35 years old and is a mother of 4 children. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver. With the first loan she received of 300 PEN, she decided to invest it in order to buy and sell regional products. Currently, she sells bananas, regional fruits and beans. She leaves her home early to set up her shop and drives to the port of the city. It is her sales that allow her to support her family and give a better life to her children.

With this loan of 1,500 PEN, which will be paid in four months, she will buy green bananas, maduros, sapotes, faro, tangerines, oranges, cocona etc. Sara is very happy to work with Manuela Ramos because it allows her to work independently and is a big help for women.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sedloff, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Sara pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Shipibas, ubicado en el Malecón Grau, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 35 años es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es motocarrista, Verita con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la compra y venta de productos de la región.

En la actualidad vende plátano, frutas regionales, fréjoles, para ello se levanta temprano y se dirige al puerto de nuestra ciudad a ofrecer sus productos y así poder llevar sustento económico a su familia y darle lo mejor a sus hijos.

Con este préstamo recibido de S/ 1,500 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará plátanos verdes, maduros, sapotes, fariña, mandarina, naranja, cocona, etc.

Sara esta muy contenta de trabajar con Manuela Ramos por que le permite trabajar independientemente y es una gran ayuda para las mujeres.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more merchandise for sale

loans.name: Thuy Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Thuy Thi H. is 35 years old with two school-aged children. She joined TYM Fund in 2007. Her husband is a carpenter and while his income is steady and stable, she wishes to not be so reliant on her husband for financial support. Aside from working in her shop she is also a seamstress. Although enduring a painstaking craft, her skillful hands produce beautiful merchandise, which attracts many customers. Already in her second year of participation with the Fund, she finds that the loan repayment terms are very agreeable and convenient for her family. With the family income increasing and her children allowed greater education, she has noticed that her children are very well-behaved and receives high grades in school. Her monthly family income is around 200USD. This time around, she requests a loan of 575USD to buy more goods for her small convenience store and more carpentry wood for her husband.

Translated from Vietnamese by Trinh Quoc Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị Thúy, 35 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2007. Chồng chị làm thợ mộc, 2 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Tuy thu nhập từ nghề mộc của anh cũng tương đối ổn định, nhưng chị Thúy cũng không muốn sống dựa vào chồng. Chị xin vay vốn về mua hàng tạp hóa về bán và đầu tư thêm cho anh mua gỗ về làm mộc. Ngoài ra chị cũng làm thêm nghề may. Tham gia Quỹ năm thứ 2, chị cảm thấy cách vay trả của Quỹ rất phù hợp với gia đình. Nhờ chịu khó lại khéo tay nên cửa hàng của chị rất đông khách. Thu nhập gia đình tăng lên, hai con chị có điều kiện được ăn học nên các cháu đều ngoan và học giỏi. Thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình khoảng 200USD. Vòng vốn này chị Thúy là đơn xin vay 575USD để mua hàng bán và gỗ làm mộc.

loans.use: Buy goods for her grocery store and wood

loans.name: Ear

texts.en: Ear K., 45, is married and lives with her husband and seven children in Cham province. She and her husband work as farmers, making about $1.50 a day. They are also supported by their older children, several of whom work in garment factories and one of whom is a motorbike mechanic. Weather has been difficult for farming in Cambodia this last year, and inflation has forced food prices to skyrocket. These factors have made for difficult times for many Cambodians. To help cope with these conditions, Ear K. has applied to CREDIT for a loan of $1,200 to aid her son’s business. He works as a motorbike mechanic, and could make a lot more money if he opened up his own shop. She sees this loan as a way to increase her income and is confident that the business venture will succeed.

loans.use: To establish mechanic shop

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Rehema M., who is married and has two children aged four and six. In 2005, Rehema established her grocery business. Working seven days a week, ten hours a day, and assisted by her husband and one employee, she earns about $440 every month. Rehema has already received and repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requests a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, beans and vegetables in bulk. In the future, she plans to open another business. Rehema thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, beans and vegetables in bulk.
